_WDH7G0w1cKgUyalBPRm4A.text: We first visited Chin Chin during our last trip to Vegas in 2009. Loved the service and the food, so we returned for dinner during this trip. Dexter was our waiter, and he was amazing. Great drink suggestion for my husband, who happened to really enjoy it. Dinner (sushi) was fantastic as well.

rvNpNJQ7hp6AI2z0XQ-Pww.text: we went for the lunch buffet, only because of the BOGO deal we found on yelp.  Otherwise, we won't have gone there, esp. given all the good choices on the Strip.  Food was OK, but the service was very good (which was rewarded by a generous tip, thanks Oscar).

wwh8tZhXAzZARGZymS07jg.text: Was in Vegas for a convention and was looking for good but affordable Asian food for dinner. I didn't want to pay $100 for dinner so when I came across the menu for Chin Chin, my friends and I decided to try it out. I ordered the sushi rolls and they came out really fast and it was really good. I spent around $30 and was very satisfied. I would definitely recommend it if you are looking for something not too fancy and affordable especially in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f7qsXeye4f8TmYPk9NEaVg.text: Came in for dinner on the 28th and sat at the bar. I had an awesome time. The ladies behind the bar had smiles and awesome service. The sushi chef helped out and brought out my food from the kitchen. It is so awesome to see this teamwork!  Lauren is one of the bartenders and I forget the other ladies name. Again awesome people and truly let me enjoy my time here.   Oh, the food was very tasty.

WdxxNkLRn40N6l89-S-OFg.text: Love to sit at the bar and see the people pass by in New York New York. The have great fresh rolls with a twist. Try the lemon crush it is a taste of heavenly freshness

RT7vjti3n2vzgCagtxDSKg.text: We sat down to eat during their buffet service. There were maybe 8 other people there at  noon which I guess should have been a sign. We ordered two sushi rolls which would have cost $50, and after waiting 15 minutes they were only just starting them. Needless to say, we walked out.

vHNr0Ni9TM699CSuWEVvmw.text: 5 stars for the dinner menu,  but only 3 stars for the breakfast buffet.    The breakfast buffet is just so-so. Nothing special and the taste was just okay.    Onto the dinner menu: excellent!  Our waiter was super nice and completely on top of his game so we didn't wait long for anything.  And the food was delicious.  The sushi rolls were perfectly made (and quickly too). We also ordered walnut chicken,  pad thai, mu Gu guy pan,  seafood noodles,  and wanton soup to share around the table.  Everything came in large portions and was cooked to perfection.  Definitely recommend for a group meal.

qbm7cjLGY6Vwq_sjrI1jEQ.text: Oscar was great. Super personable and friendly. He made great recommendations and was patient with us. Lettuce wraps were amazing. We also liked the orange chicken, pad Thai and broccoli beef! Yum yum

4rl-Wo7YH-U75fQH2HE6iw.text: So gross. We just dropped $90 on a meal that Probably wasn't even as good as panda express. No wonder there wasn't a wait. Disgusting. Don't even waste your time. You'd be way better off grabbing a slice of pizza. So disappointing. Wish I could get my money and time back.

yo0tOTdLpZ1LITQVi4IlWQ.text: Nice environment. The choice of food is OK for lunch, don't expect too much. The food is a combination of American influenced Chinese food with some sushi, vet spring rolls. The dessert is nice.

WeL1lV0pCYWQdmdXo7hlRA.text: Thank you for saving our anniversary dinner!!! After leaving a nearby sushi place because of horrible service, my husband and I were famished and decided to just give this place a try since we were staying at NYNY anyway and didn't feel like going anywhere else to eat. Immediately, we were greeted by this very friendly hostess who showed us the menu, which is a mix of Chinese and Japanese. At that point I was "Hangry" and was about to eat whatever so we decided to get a table. We waited about 2-3 minutes and we're seated at a corner booth. In less than a minute, our server Robb came up to greet us right away. He was very friendly and asked us if we were celebrating anything. We ordered and I was surprised how big the rolls were! They both tasted good and was satisfied. After dinner they came up and gave us a very cute plate that had congratulations written in chocolate and a cheesecake to share. Looking around though, everyone looked very happy with their food and their portions are good on either menu. It's a great value for strip pricing and I cannot say enough praises for Robb and his trainee Natalie who were exceptionally amazing at what they do! The manager even took time to go around the tables asking everyone how everything is going! I am seriously impressed with this place and the staff they have here!

Fu0s1GdUmjQZJ2Uw3IZcsg.text: Solid food, excellent service and decor doable  :) Would I come back here if I was in Vegas again...probably......ok maybe not, the food is solid but it's also pretty forgettable. However, I will give them 5 stars for service. The servers there were incredibly accommodating and made sure to take extra care of the people in our group who had certain food allergies.   We ordered the sampler appetizer platter, which had some good things like the egg rolls, but the other chicken dishes and dumplings were pretty boring...not bad...but not exciting either. The entrees of garlic eggplant and sweet crispy chicken...again good...buuuuttttt not "oooo I want to come back and eat more of this" good.   All in all, solid Chinese food, service excellent and atmosphere like a PF Changs, BUT when you're in a city like Vegas and there are so many other food options to explore, I would give Chin Chin a miss. The food just isn't that special for you to miss out on all the other great culinary experiences the city has to offer :)

taA2zOuwc9GU0qQE95W7_g.text: The moment I found out, I had to experience it. I had my reservations, but I knew deep down it was now or never. I made time in my schedule and I even cancelled on a few clients just for this. But let me tell you, it was worth every single second. Never in my live have I encountered anything this unique. The moments were not only enchanting, but they were unforgettable. We get so caught up in our busy daily lives that we forget to stop and smell the lovely aromas. Thank you so much for making time stand still even if it was for a brief few moments. Blessings, Oz

OyZvQSgHW8IVFklF_L5sbQ.text: The breakfast buffet is highly recommended! From basic items (scrambled eggs, pancakes, bacon), to gourmet benedicts and omelettes made to order, this buffet has it all. This was a great value compared to some other Strip competitors! Our check for two (no alcohol) came to $46 with gratuity for our awesome waiter, Andres!

ap-093HGhTMJq7_FaXATKw.text: As with ALL Chinese buffets, you have to home in on the items that they do best & keep going back for more... That being said, I was a bit disappointed that the buffet is rather modest & had a few items that were not very good, especially given that the buffet is $19.95 (plus tax) per person & is located in Vegas, where a restaurant has to compete with all the other restaurants & buffets that are here... On the plus side, while I am very wary of the sushi served at Chinese buffets, my wife found the sushi here to be good & freshly prepared...

KFeJlyGXE4yb6m7KrgVyKw.text: Food was just so-so. Seriously, have to pay extra for rice in  a Chinese restaurant. First time for everything I guess.

6_M8KmaJVrzWz80TLhG5wg.text: This is my favorite place to eat when i stay at NyNy in Vegas!!  Now they offer breakfast and lunch buffet!!  Had both this weekend and for $20 u cant go wrong!!  I love their sushi!!  Big portions and always so fresh and good!!  Service is always the best!!  Always look forward to coming here for dinner but now can come for every meal

wE5HUxrbIVtzOdBhk1bRRg.text: Great food. Reasonably priced. Comfortable dining area. Penny was a very friendly and attentive waitperson. Linda is a terrific manager. Both on top of things. I've worked in food & beverage, so I know a little about what distinguishes one eatery from another. This place does it right.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looking out into NY-NY.

llX4m0dOVwBddd2fQTqJeg.text: I ate here the other night with three dining companions.  We decided on this place after deciding to meet up at New York New York.  My dining companions split both the edamame and star wontons for appetizers.  Since I had eaten recently, I personally did not partake in either of them but my friends raved about both appetizers.  For my entree I decided upon the Mongolian beef.  Having ordered it the waiter informed me that I would not get rice with it and would I like to order a side of it. I politely declined. My Mongolian beef consisted of steak and chives in a sauce with crispy noodles, cucumber and carrots on the side.  The cut of meat was a little better than I was used to in such dishes and the sauce was good.  However I found the dish to be weird, especially the cucumber pieces.  The only other thing of note is that my friends ordered three sushi rolls.  They were disappointed with the size of them but raved about the flavors.  The bottom line for me is that I would probably not eat here again.  The food was just ok and I feel like better food could be found for the price.

AQCAJujSyxF1S0Cn3W_2zQ.text: It was our first time here. These guys rock! We were a group of 16 people on Christmas day, and everything was great. I definitely recommend it! Our waiter was Andres. He was very nice.

68zE1V-nzI3P-GhxKNVOEQ.text: After walking around New York New York  and only seeing steak, pizza, and pasta, we were happy to find Chin Chin. Pineapple rice was delicious and the the sushi roll was fresh.  It was exactly what we were looking for.

0iX4fY9N72P5ii1DO0yx4g.text: It was my first time in Vegas with friends and we were dying for sushi. I'm sad to say this isn't the best place for that. The rolls were priced as expected for sushi but they were the dinkiest, saddest excuse for rolls I'd ever seen.   The noodles, however, were exquisite. I even tried a bite of my friend's tangerine beef--I'm not a big meat eater but that was sooo delicious.

Qww-g1-J27VXQ-lB2vmvLA.text: Good place for reasonably priced Chinese food in a sit down restaurant in Vegas, with a very good service. General Sao chicken & Eggplant dish are a must try.  One star less for a long wait, been there twice and everytime we stoof in line for about 20mins :D......I believe it is for most of the good restaurants on Saturday nights.

wCV3ieT8cA2GeaqenrVZOg.text: This place is awesome, the food is very fresh and good compare to what you pay for! It worth the try and the serves rock! Andres did an amazing job to take care of our loud family!

MLLFQ-wWyWowzmm-rR9ArQ.text: I guess this is "Chinatown" for "New York".  We found this place out of hunger and lazyness and decided to give it a shot.  This is the first Chinese restaurant I've been to that also has a Sushi bar.  I guess Asian cusine is all getting globalized now a days.    We were lucky to get a great server and their food was pretty good.  Defenitely not authentic enough for me but very tasty for American/Asian food.  Among the dishes we ordered the curry rice was the best.  The seafood won ton soup was pretty good too and the sushi tasted just like any sushi place.    Funny name.... Chin Chin

mSJ8sxPy4ESuQRZ2FFab2g.text: I can go for peanut noodle any day especially right now!

N0aELFA3AYZhLGUXZzJ5Ng.text: The app sampler was good and the wanton soup was great . But the drinks are not cheap so watch it .

ZaMWNbYzfIa_9rGKBKAOEA.text: I thought Chin Chin was great.  After a weekend of all sorts of pub/bar food and Italian type fare, this sounded so good.  The portions were huge, the prices were really good (like $11-15 dishes) and the service was great - even with such a large group.  We shared the Chinese Chicken Salad which was nice and spicy and full of chicken.  We then shared the Peanut Noodles with Chicken which was also good, but I far preferred the salad.  I had order envy from literally everyone at the table - it all looked and smelled so good.   This is a good spot in Vegas for something casual and different than the usual pizza or burgers.

nRcxoh_z0b2MDHuetH_MEQ.text: We were staying at the NYNY and liked this place so much we ate there twice. The lo mein was delicious and the breakfast buffet was also fantastic. lobster and crab crepes were amazing and the salmon eggs benedict was also super. My son loved the red velvet pancakes. Highly recommended!

ovPMgmP8hh7aJHxgLBDdXA.text: Visited this restaurant with my husband after my last night at a trade show in Vegas, where we had a few drinks and a bunch of appetizers, and the experience was fantastic. Service was great, and food was amazing. I especially loved the bau buns, pot stickers (the sweet sauce they're served with is sooo good!), and the tuna tartare. A colleague joined us after and had a couple of sushi rolls. And the price was reasonable and portions large. I was expecting mainly standard Chinese food, but there are a lot of good more upscale options as well. I would definitely visit again the next time I'm in Vegas.

_5njoS8KrI7BlO9-alpUbA.text: You eat at one chin chin, you eat at all Chins. It is your typical chain restaurant quality- more expensive than you'd want to shell out, but the food isn't horrible so you don't stay away.   The Vegas one is slightly different that it keeps up with the buffett theme of Las Vegas. This one offers breakfast/ brunch buffett for around $14/ person, from 7/7:30 to noon-ish. if you can get up that early while you are in vegas, or perhaps you haven't gone to bed yet, the buffet isn't bad. Very simple, not too exciting, and variety is rather limited, but you get your brunch staples- scrambled eggs, scrambled eggs with duck, bacon, sausage, duck, bbq pork (chinese style), some potatoes, noodles. I actually prefer this to the $25 brunch buffett at MGM or similar casino. It's cheaper and i can never my $25 worth of food at 10:30 or 11 in the morning. And the food here is actually good. I like their duck scrambled egg, and their spring rolls and dumplings are yum too.  The line can get long, and with limited seats/ space, you can wait a bit. But people eat and go- so you are maybe made to wait for 30 min at most. And my other complaint would be you have to be in line to get your food, and since there is only 1 line of buffett trays, once you are done, you have to go back to the end of the line for round 2. It reminds me of being in the school cafeteria a little.   Solid 3.5 stars!

HvQa6YERKZ6dymCDUK_CHQ.text: This place was horrible. Our waiter was very nice, but the food! The hot n sour soap came out cold and was way too salty. The roasted meats tasted like they had been sitting for days. The hunan sauce was inedible, and the yang chow rice flavorless. Avoid this place. 100.00 for crap!

IkJowc60OjVwHSc35Ub-wQ.text: Place was not good. Food taste bland and it is way over priced for what you get. Orange chicken was nasty and so was the fried rice. Won't be coming back here.

KsSgVjzMor-uDT8sCv-ubA.text: This place is terrible.... we were seated right away but it took 10 minutes for a server to acknowledge us.... we get our drinks and our order in.... dumplings and seafood noodles.... it took 30 minutes  for these two items... The place wasn't even busy... When we finally got our food we were very disappointed.  The noodles were overpowered in soy sauce and the shrimp and scallops were over. cooked. The dumplings were absolutely tasteless.... I didn't dare send them back because I didn't want to wait another 30 minutes. I couldn't complain to the server anyway because after the food was dropped....we were forgotten about.... never again at this place .... I suggest you do the same

-Rb_GN3M_p3Jd8bcJk9Ltw.text: The wife and I had about an hour to kill before Zumanity. We were hungry, and didn't want to eat pizza or a sandwich. We saw Chin Chin and the sushi menu. Before we took the time to look at the menu, we sat down and then realized they didn't have any veggie only rolls on the menu. Instead of moving along, we decided to go with entrees instead.   I had the veggie lo mein, my wife had the peanut noodle dish. Both dishes were very fresh, not heavy on the sauce, and the noodles were the freshest I've ever had at any Chinese place. The veggies in the lo mein were perfect. Not overcooked, not undercooked. I could have just had broccoli in it. The peanut dish was "spicy" and had a great sweet tangy flavor. The food is very Americanized, so don't expect authentic...buts its on the Strip, what can you expect.   Our dishes were $14 and $13 respectively. The portion size of each would have been good for us to split. This would have been nice to know, and will be helpful if we go back. Since we were seeing a show after dinner, we didn't want to get a doggy bag.   My wife also had two cocktails - malibu and pineapple. They were $8 each. I had a Tsingtao bomber which was $8 which was actually not a bad deal.   The service was really good, and both the bartenders were very friendly. We had a nice chat with both of them.   As we don't eat on the Strip often, it is good to know we can get a semi reasonable and delicious meal.

h256lvhaD_jUiWUVBBNpkA.text: My wife and I ate at Chin Chin one evening in Vegas when we had already settled into our hotel for the evening. I was a little worried, because we based a lot of our dining and activity choices on reviews, including Yelp, and Chin Chin wasn't especially well received.    My own exposure to authentic Chinese is limited, so that wasn't  a huge factor for us. The food was very tasty; basically just a significantly improved version of the Chinese food we can get in mid-Michigan. My wife had Orange Chicken and I had Pad Thai. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meal, though I had nothing to compare the Pad Thai to I can attest that the Orange Chicken was head and shoulders above any I'd had in the past.  We also had an appetizer sampler (assorted delights I think) that was very satisfying. I would recommend it if you are more concerned about flavor than authenticity.

wkiw5vMp9SqyVDsxGHFubQ.text: Just an average experience.  We ate at Chin Chin this past week with friends.  The decor is cute and the menu offerings promising.  They seemed a little understaffed when we were there on a Monday at lunch time because our waiter kept disappearing, but he was very nice and accomodating.  The food is just average...nothing amazing or overly tasty.  I ordered the chicken lo mein and literally had 3 pieces of chicken in my dish.  I was starving and was really wanting that chicken!!!  The noodles and veggies in the dish were bland...not seasoned well, if at all.  Others at our table had similar feelings about their dishes.  The portions are large...enough that two people could share and the prices are reasonable.  However, the food is just missing its mark.  I would not go out of my way to recommend Chin Chin to anyone and doubt I would return.

2HKpEHxNsxccmnDZPSk3iQ.text: I wonder to know how people gave 3 or 4 stars?! Everything is ok, best service and good quality make a great special launch. I strongly recommend this buffet. One of the best buffet I've been there. They all try to make sure their customers  are enjoying. Christmas eve 2016

iZqjuDEJbzHZ2Vv5BWz8hg.text: The food here is not exactly authentic and quality. But I too think the Asian hostess (manager?) with the long highlighted is really hot! Her being there, makes the food tastes like a five-star restaurant.

SE6ouV29yiETpdHGMJlLww.text: Ate here a month ago and we're all still craving it... cannot wait to get back to Vegas simply to eat at Chin Chin in the NY NY Hotel again!   Highly recc'd the eggplant dish! Also, General Gao's Chicken was OFF The HOOK. We travel the country for a living... we eat a lot of this stuff... Chin Chin owned it!  Priced well. $110 fed 4 people well and that included drinks. And by well I mean, unbuttoning your pants afterwards!  This was our second time eating here... and it won't be our last! Wait staff was attentive and kind. Service was fast and the place was bumping... very impressive. LOVE that all the food came out at once, nice and hot.... and being from Boston we of course all loved the free parking! :)

OjF_xl0OGk-bp-UtZRENqg.text: There are some friends you can put your complete food trust in and there are others, for the sake of the relationship, you should ignore. I should have known better than to listen to this particular friend about going here for breakfast but we went anyway. I was like "Breakfast? At a Chinese restaurant?"   Still, he insisted and we all went, regrettably. It was a buffet for starters, which I am not a fan of, ever. The idea of paying to walk around never made sense to me. Plus the general public breathing and maybe touching or sneezing on my food doesn't appeal. Then you have the food that's just sitting there dying under heat lamps for God knows how long.  Anyway, yea, sorry. It was just not good.

_qWvGSmqkSRePAGMyP9otQ.text: Absolutely great customer service at this place!  The staff will go above and beyond to create a pleasant experience. Thumbs up to the management as they lead by example. Breakfast all American buffet isn't very good but the sushi is Delish!

rNrr1KpXSlO6BbBpgUe97g.text: Stopped by here while on vacation and was blown away by the food and service.  I will definitely be coming back here.   My personal favorite was the sushi which was not only delicious but a True work of art.  If you are in Vegas you must try out Chin Chin. You will not be disappointed.

h2ZDh_YardFGRN45JPGwqA.text: Wow - we loved this!! Best dumplings and wontons we've had.. great value for money too. The orange chicken was super yummy also! Lots of options to order from - would recommend

iJ_Uq_gjXesOHbhWAlNBfA.text: Not sure how they still exist in Vegas. I got general tso and it was sososososoo salty. Service was awful too.

auR6WyjnynBJZ6v4mm41GA.text: Horrible service by the manager REBECCA .. She made a mistake on my refund and then when i confronted her about t she chooses to argue with me about it instead of apologize .. This place is over priced and Panda Express tastes better .. $70 for 2 people .. Def not worth it .. Save your money if your craving Chinese go somewhere else

LP2WcjWc9W3VKRPCiTYZzw.text: This was my first stop in vegas and will be my last. I understand Japanese cuisine can be pricey due to quality but this establishment took it too far especially when it's not a fine dining restaurant. As I was looking over the menu for possible sushi ordering, I was blown away by the prices. For example: 1 order (2 pcs) of a tuna nigiri was $12.50! That would've been like 2 orders (4 pcs) for me if I were to dine in at a casual restaurant like this one in Sacramento, CA. I just ended up getting a small entree instead since I rather pay that same price to fill up my stomach. Service was ok but not so great - it took them a while to greet me and ask for drinks and then it took a while to place my order in.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small portion of veggie chow mein.

60TNghhpX6Y0ErVxY5zoRg.text: We had a great lunch here. Angel was our waitress and she did a great job and was very friendly. Everything tasted good and service was quick. Was a little on the pricey side but portions were good sized. We'll stop by again on our next trip to vegas.

2SsMJ50VQgG7Aqi-9HTUpA.text: Extremely slow service and under staffed. However, everyone was friendly and kind.  We got sushi, beef and broccoli, and some friends rice and it was all delicious. The price range was pretty good, anywhere from $10 - $25 and I like to think that is good for vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cali roll cause I&#39;m basic

O7hCHdDxeOUliPWitCr52A.text: Really sub-par Asian food, the dumplings had a bad taste like canned beef stew, I sent back my "signature" Chinese chicken salad which was very bland, with lots of iceberg lettuce and over cooked chicken. My husband ordered a vegetable dish, which was super salty and not tasty at all. I am half Chinese, and have eaten lots of Chinese and various Asian cuisines in my day, and this was NOT GOOD. Service was ok, my friend said that the wonton soup was good. My advice: STAY AWAY! There are many other better choices in Vegas.

sb70YWhwnHOY0dZcMAdcPA.text: It was ok, the food was underwhelming and for the price it's was awful. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and very appealing to be inside so that made up for the lack in the quality of food

0GebHooyn-yLGRqP7CGrSQ.text: Based on reviews we visited chin chin last night. Meal disappointed us big time.  Singapore noodle was watery, which is a big no no. BBQ pork lacked flavor. Only positive was then shrimp pieces large.  Other dish was their beef chow fun.  A bit too much soy sauce. Maybe we should've gotten apps or their rice dishes. Positive is the staff was very friendly. Server attentive.

Aq1-wDsIS9HU3_25Bwzmew.text: I would say we are picky in regards to sushi.  All big cities and international restaurants.  Are there places in Las Vegas that have a fancier vibe and the sushi chefs are SUPER serious?? Sure.  This is our third time here in two trips; we love it. It is fun, the sushi chef is amazing, the service is good and we love the food!  I can't speak to the regular menu, but love the sushi. If you like rolls, the Hawaiian and Hokie Pokie rolls are great. Putting review on Trip Advisor as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_u2pdak1_gv-wmFt5cAz3w.text: This was so disappointing!! It was our last night and we talked about Chin Chin for hours and slowly lost our faith over time while reading the menu but we were committed! It tasted like Americanized Chinese, heavy on the salt!   But the service was great!

_vVsb5zTNEqpwO6Dl09-Bg.text: I really shouldn't expect so much from Asian restaurants that are at tourist locations. I usually love Chinese food pretty much anywhere besides theme parks and tourist locations where the dishes are subpar and overpriced.   Since it was pretty late, we decided to share an entree. We ordered the moo goo gai pan. It had chicken breast, water chestnuts (my fave!), celery, and mushrooms. This was so disappointing. There was barely any flavor and our total came out to $27 for the entree and two scoops of rice. I would have rather have had Panda Express.  Oh...and there was some sort of problem going on in the back of the hotel which caused a disgusting aroma that smelled like sewer/poop to sweep through the restaurant and throughout the casino. It was pretty gross and most customers, like us, ended up taking the food to go. It wasn't their fault for the smell...but yikes...it made it very hard to enjoy the food if you sat down to eat it.

oGbQq2moHZoQFZV3lZQEeQ.text: My husband has been eating sushi for over 10 years now and he's not easy to please. He said "That's the best sushi I've ever had"! Did I mention he's NOT easy to please? Food was great, atmosphere was nice. People are friendly. Great place to eat!

YiEZiopUwiq-NvEwZwyRKQ.text: Looking for a quick lunch at $19.00?? Look no further as it is located in New York New York. Will definitely come back.   Pros:  -Check in and get a free meal -great ambience , small restaurant but gets to the point  -friendly staff and would go the extra mile for your needs  -delicious buffet selection   Cons: -Where we sat, my side of the booth seat was indented and lost its bounce back so pretty much it sinks in.

xBuPFC9NAX4Ke7zUpemfIg.text: Every casino on the strip has a chinese/noodle place of varying quality, Chin Chin at the New York New York is actually one of the better ones in my opinion. My wife and I went here after a concert at T Mobile arena on a Saturday night and managed to get in before it got packed. We shared an appetizer plate with some really good standard Chinese items and then split a plate of the beef low mein. The noodles were really good and so was the beef, would definitely order it again.  Also cool atmosphere inside and decent wait staff, you could certainly do worse at some of the other Asian places on the strip. Prices for food weren't awful but in typical strip fashion the drinks were way overpriced.

ITUJ3s7_VdoyZyBcP0vWnA.text: Oh boy..... When it's a late night and you are desperate for food just prior to bedtime then you find yourself here!   Bad idea....   Should have read yelper reviews...    Ordered sushi staple of California Roll, standard fried egg roll, Chinese Chicken salad and Mongolian beef adding the brown rice for $2.  Service was great, manager kept checking on us.  Food on the hand....yikes meh...  CA Roll was mushy, fell apart... Egg roll was burnt yet not cooked so not sure how that happened.   Chicken salad was disastrous, looked like it was thrown together with a scant of ginger dressing!   There was chicken breast which bumped this up to 2 stars...  Hubbie enjoyed his beef thus the star again!     I can't say anymore or else I'll drop it another star....

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt egg rolls and California roll
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian beef on brown rice
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese chicken salad

e-f37x_V7WegD8HIkNzPag.text: Wow Chin Chin is so under-rated. I was surprised nobody ever told me it was hidden in NYNY.  My group stopped here for a quick lunch and opted for the buffet. We thought it was a good deal since most single entrees are $15, and the buffet was approx $19.  The buffet isn't HUGE like your exclusive hotel buffets, but it's just the right size.   I expected the food to taste like your typical greasy inauthentic Chinese food, but I was wrong! The food was light, not too salty and had just the right amount of everything.  Ooooo and their dessert bar was to die for! I liked everything here. The service was wonderful and I'd eat here again.

2IDIagnhMF6jVvgk3w1QzA.text: The lunch buffet was delicious and Steven was a wonderful waiter! So glad we took advantage of the buffet!

y3as4TXt5urZmcSRr_Z6QQ.text: Decided to try this spot out with a friend. We both got half order of chicken fried rice a half order of Chinese chicken salad and half order bbq pork. Rice was delicious along with the salad but the bbq pork was gross it had lots of fat on it. I would avoid this item ... Our server was good when he was around he took a bit of time to bring water. The manager came over and removed the bbq pork from our check. She was very friendly and had a nice smile. You kinda felt like she was your friend once you left this place. Great job manger person. Over all the place is clean and has a cool vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My fortune cookie. Haha
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ .. No good too much fat ..the Chief should cut the fat off.
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese chicken salad delicious.

X4FFO5QqGJuBbbJRkUnM4g.text: I was at this restaurant while on my birthday weekend with my boyfriend. We ate here on 6/21/15. The place was mostly empty with very slow service. The chocolate cake was good, but the sushi tasted like it was prepared in the morning and had been sitting out all day. Not fresh at all. The spicy tuna was so over the top spicy, we sent it back.  The reason for my review now though is the most frustrating of all: my credit card was just charged on 7/9/15. Two and a half weeks later! I was about to call my bank for fraud when I realized what the charge was. I've never had a charge take that long to show up on my card! Just seems so ridiculous to wait that long and my statement says it was authorized 7/8/15. Not sure what is going on here, but I would avoid it due to old sushi, slow service, and now, apparently, lack of processing cards in a timely fashion!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cake for my birthday

I3iJRvyZBBxnamSTM-lQuQ.text: My wife and I had the ahi tuna roll and it was super good! The chef also gave us tons of little treats here and there! Great Yellow fin tuna, Edamame, some hot sake, and drinks! The staff was great, the food was amazing, my wife and I will defiantly be back! 10/10

XNXP6Rq8xz0h2TVEVwy53A.text: we stayed at NY NY Hotel and we're too tired from walking all day to go somewhere for dinner so we decided to give this place a try. we were pleasantly surprised!  we had sweet and sour chicken  with fried rice,cashews prawns, salad and "sex on the beach" cocktail . Everything was simply delicious  and beautifully served!  we didn't  leave a crumb on a plate :). The service was wonderful!  They exceeded our expectations!  the price is also reasonable. I want to add,because we had lunch buffet in this restaurant next day,and it was amazing!  We got the discount coupon 20%,so again it very responsibly priced and we had high quality tasty food! We enjoyed every bit! The service was exceptional. Every staff member is very nice and courteous!  Thank you guys!!!We will be back next time we in Vegas!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xBC-K67DvGHInvj1IH0Jzw.text: So this was my 2nd time eating here; it was delicious that first time. Their gluten free options make my boyfriend very happy! However, tonight, I was served wontons with RAW chicken inside. It was dark pink mush. The chef cooked a new batch for me, but unfortunately I had already eaten half of one. They were quite apologetic and comped our meal, but no amount of comped money is worth the risk of salmonella. It's a sadly inexcusable mistake and it's why I'm giving my rating 1 star. Here's to hoping I dodge the diarrhea bullet - my plane flight is in 48 hrs.

cgdak9Jz-7e5cpD0anu_0A.text: Everything about our recent visit to Chin Chin's was great. Very friendly service, and all four items - Chinese chicken salad, shumai, cilantro dumplings, and Yang Chow fried rice - were great. The salad was dressed perfectly and had lots of chicken. The shumai might have been the best item. The fried rice was prepared without soy sauce (as the menu indicated) so it could have been bland but we liked it a lot. Last visit might have been ten years ago and I remember thinking the salad and dumplings were not as good as my first experience decades ago in Studio City. This time it rocked. We will definitely stop by next time we're in Vegas.

QU1ChOdwJM6fo9x_TdtUNQ.text: The best sushi I've ever had! Great Chinese food and great service. Good prices, the entire staff is very friendly and a very inviting environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing lemon cake!!

IM0lvrP55CyRcUajXyEfgQ.text: The Mongolian beef was good as any.  The Ma Po tofu was not flavored correctly.   Service was good. Overall experience was average.

ujgzZF6p0FatoatVtG_CzA.text: Wow, went to Chin Chin Thursday night and was very happy with the food and the service. The staff was friendly and service was fast. The prices were very fair. I Look forward to going back again shortly !

P35yoyhiuhRtLtZdCR7a2g.text: Very friendly staff (Maegan). Food was pretty good. We tried eggs Benedict with crab cake, vegetarian eggs Benedict & salmon eggs Benedict. Will definitely recommend.

bdPGBaYTH8YDWITyX7PIGQ.text: This review will be on the breakfast buffet ($14 per person).  I have to say that this breakfast buffet didn't have a lot of choices.  These were the things they had from what I could remember: mainland eggs, Cantonese eggs, bacon, french toast, pastries, and croissants.  All of those tasted okay and nothing special.  There was also BBQ pork or something but for breakfast?  Yeah... I thought it was weird.  They had fruit and yogurt which seemed like it was made.  I was surprised a lot of people were eating here for breakfast even though there wasn't a lot of choices.  I guess they were like me and didn't want to go somewhere else that's not in the New York New York Hotel. lol

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My breakfast piled up on one plate (taken with my cellphone)

_fH1nHLXjPItOogJngjG9w.text: Came here for the breakfast buffet and it was delicious. I have a gluten sensitivity and dairy allergy and the servers and kitchen were incredibly accommodating! I was able to order an omelet and even eat a couple of things off the buffet. Very helpful and friendly staff, great food.

nGQlRX-S8z4cCsaCKYqY0A.text: It's really beyond my expectation. The food here is welcome by my families from China and the service is pretty good!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton soup. It&#39;s soooo good! Delicious soup with a lot of sea food inside.

cBbLYCrRWvKCVKKZesp7_g.text: The selection is limited but it is TASTY! The lettuce bowls with minced chicken was very yummy! Also the desserts were really good ( cake pops, cookies and mini muffins).  The service was great! Our waiter was very cool and he didn't hover!  I will return to Chin Chin!

1lYpRrBM0kqOpJq6eNyAuQ.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here for sushi. The rainbow roll was ok. We also ordered the snowflake roll which said it was king crab. It was not. It was crab salad, and it was not good. I do not recommend this place for 2 reasons. 1. The food is subpar. 2. The prices do not match the quality.

j1xu8LsiLwG_ox-ztotbow.text: Had lunch here yesterday and it was excellent!   Our waitress, Jordan, was very nice and responsive to my family's needs. We ordered entrees instead of the buffet, but the servings were large and the prices very reasonable especially for Las Vegas. The only thing is that the food isn't as authentic as something you'd order on Spring Mountain.  Overall, really great! Will definitely be coming back!!

n6mBYhCczrfSPeyUhgXDmw.text: Had a wonderful dinner while staying at New York New York.  Food was delicious we had the chicken salad and the mongolian beef.  David was the absolute best server!!!

QP0LU7ESg06Mi8iESmFZkw.text: The only downfall to our experience was having to wait a couple long minutes before being served.  Other than than that minor mishap, everything else was good.  We had the Mongolian beef and the Pad Thai.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian Beef

S5FFu-znW9l3er0Ot-QAaQ.text: The service was fine, the staff were pleasant, but the food was not. Came here for the lunch buffet, the food was below average and not worth $22/person for lunch at all.

TB7nlX0n8_mWMItS4g6srA.text: We ate dinner at Chin Chin on Friday night.  I wanted a variety of items and some kind of beef, but not a Prime steak.  We landed at Chin Chin for some good old Americanized Chinese food.  Since our last meal was breakfast we ordered up some chicken pot stickers, pork bao, half of a Hunan chicken, and Mongolian beef...and some steamed rice (more on that later).  It was all good.  The Mongolian beef was actually very good.  I am usually a little scared of the beef that ends up in Chinese food dishes, but this was very tasty.    The Hunan chicken was a little tart for me, but it was nice and tender.  My wife loved it.    If you are a char siu bao fan (yeah that is spelled a hundred different ways), don't order them here.  The filling was off and the dough of the bun was heavy and yellow.  My guess is that they were made a while before we ordered them and steamed up to serve.  By a while I mean at the day before...or earlier...  The portions are pretty good, so if you eat family style don't over order.  One dish per person is plenty.    The prices were about $15 per entree, which isn't bad for a hotel on the strip.  Important note, rice does not come with your meal.  You have to order it by the bowl for $1.50 each or get fried rice.  That's kind of lame.  You really need to charge that extra $1.50 for a bowl of steamed rice?  Our server was a polite girl from some former Soviet block country.  Theek accent, but attentive to the table.

6FrziWMUVDFzKatbudsZpw.text: Okay, so part of the one star rating is my own fault.  It was the first morning on my first trip to Vegas.  We were staying at NY NY and got off the elevators at 930am after a long night and saw "Chinese Buffet Brunch!"  Now, why on earth did I think Chinese buffet - for breakfast - would be a good idea?  I'll never know.  The place was packed though, so I followed the leader.  5 minutes after eating, I had to run back up to my hotel room and then  spend the next hour on the bed clutching my stomach.  Yeah.  And don't blame it on the booze the night before... I wasn't even hungover when I woke up.  Lesson learned.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beware.
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ssUviVTETD5ApTyqSzxlJA.text: Food is totally tasteless, big portions, atmosphere poor.

AHxM8GfHkElEEQfMae2C1g.text: How ironic that as we are walking around trying to decide where to eat I mention my craving for PF Chang's.  We go into New York New York and just so happen to stumble upon Chin Chin, the closest thing to a PF Chang knock off as I ever did see.  I'm not hatin'.  I liked it.  It was fast, delicious, and came with good service and lots of free Coke refills.  If you like PF Chang's, you'll like Chin Chin.   P.S. Whoever said it is a little pricey is a little crazy.  Compared to almost any other sit-down place, it's very affordable.

DnY0agXnjGKDJq_G8hGHAA.text: We stayed at the Tropicana, and after a six hour trip to get to Vegas, all I wanted was some awesome Chinese food. The girl at the front desk told us to try New York, New York, and man, I love her for suggesting it.  It was so delicious and the service was so wonderful, we ended up coming back a second time, before our flight home.  Everything on the menu was delicious, but I have to recommend most of all the Velvet Chicken soup (they put peas in it! so cool!) and the Hot Sour Soup. Both were authentic twists on old favorites, and so good we actually had to get seconds. Perfect for helping with a hangover.  Also on the list: Any of their lo mein. Delicious, chock-full of goodies, and never greasy. Mmm mm!

2OZAzdctQrbIFka7m-HeSQ.text: Service was Great !! Ordered  Shrimp Fried Rice very Good.. . Mongolian Beef tasted good, but beef over cook (dry).

rvAGm8DuMt4NVjfVs1wXOw.text: Boring environment + moderate food + overpriced = chin chin

92FGoL8MFCSRmAzSNk3nLQ.text: Be wary of this place - used a certain credit card here once during my whole vegas trip, and 3 months later find it has been skimmed and a bunch of fraudulent charges show up.

bHhhIvpZbobJcF7tGImEZQ.text: i give this place 4 stars cause i eat alot of sushi and i live in seattle. but it prob is a 5 star sushi in vegas. the fried rice is real good as well.

ya2esYZFF6r_qXGISShqhg.text: As close as it gets to New York Chinese food. The Lo Mien is to die for as well as the orange chicken! Hubby had the sushi and said he really enjoy the shrimp tempura roll. Very good price for a quick bite to eat!

BPFL7tBVxHux1oUAJCw-oQ.text: I should never expect much for chinese food in vegas.  We tried one roll and it was pretty decent.  However, it was very small.  Stay clear of the peanut noodle.  Overly salty and didn't offer much.  Plus the noodles were like spaghetti noodles.  The curry fried rice was decent.  Potsticker could have been worse.  They have happy hour for $5 martinis but they didn't have any alcohol taste in them.  Stay clear of the sushi shots.  That was advice from our server.  O yeah, service was pretty wack since there wasn't anyone in the restaurant.

BIQJKvvmY7FtQEjAQj7L1w.text: Food was delicious and the portions were pretty big. I loved the dim sum options. Drinks were great, too!

mGgvE_pUbnKL_IQNH2muDQ.text: Very rare that I give any restaurant five stars.  However this little gem of a restaurant tucked away in the NY NY casino was really great.  I can only speak to the breakfast buffet which was excellent.  Not a huge selection like the mega-buffets but everything was cooked to perfection and there was enough variety to satisfy most tastes.  But what I really enjoyed was the exceptional service from the servers all the way to the bus boys.  Friendly all around.  For $17, it is hard to beat.  Nice sit down restaurant that happens to do breakfast as well.

ogtTEq-HwWtX_DQxgLFASA.text: [this is an old review posted recently]  It's Vegas so it gets an instant 5 star or instant negative 3 stars... Who cares.  Mid grade hotel... Attempt at mass appeal acceptable. Mass appeal compelling volume-dining in Vegas.  Reasonably priced (but only for Vegas. Staff was friendly and attentive (+1 star).  Decent open kitchen, post modern copper and polished aluminum accents filled the walls and ceiling (+1 star)  Mostly veggie friendly, (already mentioned) affordable for Vegas (or anywhere +1 star).  The food came out fresh but instantly... How'd they do that (+1 star)?  High-volume, obvious faux-everything decor, greasy food (-2 stars).  Hungry?  On a budget? In the south strip? Chinese an option? Chin Chin at New York, New York.

yU4ZNHoYhv73fCcvgmeJ-Q.text: I wanted something on the lighter side - and chin chin sounded good since I remember the sunset location was pretty good in LA.  This one is not the same!  The recipes are pretty off- so I think they contracted the name but the chefs are off.  I would never go back.

ke-TbsChONSLpL-PpPo1mA.text: This was our 2nd time eating at this establishment. We waited 30mins for our meal and as everyone was eating their food I had to ask 2 different waitresses when my meal was coming up. I continue to wait at least another 10mins but by now I just got up and settled for the lukewarm pizza with no taste across the way. It took a while to get that delicious pizza and while I was walking back I noticed that my meal had FINALLY arrived..  My family told them I canceled it and I complained to the waitress and the manager and all I got was a sad face from them. To top off my night, I waited some more to pay the bill with my credit card and asked some random waiter behind me if he could just process it for me but he said that my waitress will be right with me! At this time now my Husband chimed in and just paid cash cuz he did not wanted to be in this horrible restaurant one second more.

yDfnNrMzlaiYzzUF6BdqqQ.text: The food was so so. None of our sushi rolls were impressive; had the crab salad, and soft shell crab rolls. My pineapple fried rice was way too salty. The General Tso's chicken was pretty good, however. The prices are kinda high, too. I wouldn't recommend this place at all. Make the drive to Chinatown for the real deal instead.

SAZDgkzOpi7q_rBbycuiEA.text: Chin Chin, which mostly has locations in Los Angeles, is one of my favorite restaurants because they carry one dish I love: their Chinese Chicken Salad (with no chicken). This is California Chinese food, not authentic Chinese food, and some dishes are hit or miss. Favorites of my friends include: paper wrapped chicken, orange chicken, lettuce wraps, and spring rolls with delicious apricot dipping sauce. They have low fat versions of several of their dishes. I'm guessing this isn't a popular dining destination within the New York-New York, as it wasn't crowded at dinner time. Other eateries within the hotel/casino include: * Nine Fine Irishmen * America (yelp.com/biz/2exIfLCFNVh...) * Coney Island Pavillion * ESPN Zone (yelp.com/biz/cyV6Y8eOgpD...) * Gallagher's Steakhouse (yelp.com/biz/nnDLapJk1z2...) * Gonzalez Y Gonzalez (yelp.com/biz/JsCKeWHA8n_...) * Il Fornaio (yelp.com/biz/Lau3N654yNy...) * Il Fornaio Panetteria * Village Eateries * Schraff's Ice Cream

VNmJK29x3d7oX7M6mvW-Eg.text: O-M-G  So they had a Chin Chin here in Lakewood a couple of years ago and unbeknownst to me it closed down...I still have dreams of my lovely Chin Chin.  The way I used to get my order to go and eat it all before I hit Lakewood Blvd.  Ahh, Chin Chin, I used to feel as though you loved me just as much as I loved you...  So on my recent trip to Las Vegas (The Meadows for all you newcomers) I stayed in a fun filled hotel called New York New York.  There are three separate tower elevators to get up to the rooms.  You are assigned an elevator based on your room.  I think I cried and wet myself all at once to see that right before our elevator was CHIN CHIN!  I stayed in Vegas for four nights and probably ate every other meal here.  It is cheap, good Chinese food.  The best Chicken Fried Rice I have had in a long long time...  Two thumbs way up!

f1Ck3OAco_6neldY91JV0Q.text: Yummy!  Inside the fun New York New York casino, Chin Chin is the same restaurant which I dined at in Los Angeles on Sunset Boulevard a few months ago.   Sophie, our server, was amazing, which made the meal even better. Arrived before seeing Zumanity, and tried their dim sum, chicken in lettuce cups and a bowl of the hot and sour soup. Fresh and filling, and not too pricey.   Wasn't too crowded either, as it was around 5:30 when I arrived, but got more and more crowded during the meal. Not gourmet Chinese food, but not bad either.

fSwOPy7rO_IyQYpQVWktjQ.text: WhT can I say they have the best Chinese food ever always fresh good selection of dim sum to die for chile paste and apricot dip

tetLT0VRBn2eoYtyNlA8og.text: Service here was great, not impressed with the food however. We were going to go to ghallagers next door but decided to go to chin chin instead. The sashimi was okay, and the pork ribs were dry and forgettable.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xv_jTOBPwd1FM4iU7MwJwQ.text: I've been frequenting this restaurant since the 90's. Very few restaurants could go through successful transformations to survive. My last visit was not the best but two years later and the food was great and the service was excellent. I recommend the vegetable dumplings as an appetizer.  My family also like the velvet corn soup, they have it every time we go.

brkCFFhlilcRBhaK-RXTzQ.text: This place is over priced and the food and service was horrible! The most unorganized restaurant I have ever been to. We waited for almost an hour for breakfast. It was cold. No refills on coffee and it was awful food. Will never eat there again! Do not waste your money!

xiqzL6ZbHlOkFilcyLezCg.text: I used to go 3 to 4 times when in Vegas. Now new staff and new management , the friendly atmosphere isn't their. No body at sushi bar but me took for ever to get order. It's to bad having great staff makes a difference in the experience you get at restaurants. Even tho I had comp I should of found different place to go for food.

7e4XTX5keYJfaD80RPdBdw.text: Great service from Jordan. The food is overpriced. The gluten free orange chicken was pretty good but a bit too sweet and syrupy.

R7gc_6SymwfD7yQhx1qPDg.text: This is our favorite Chinese food in Nevada. After moving here in January, we were searching for a replacement of our favorite restaurant in California. After a few bad attempts, we tried Chin Chin's. Great food and great service. Especially if Dexter is working. Hands down the best waiter!! Worth the drive from Henderson.

z5zsxd3lasHWA1_AkZwk9Q.text: I'm eating here right now. Having the lunch buffet for $24. High, even by Vegas standards. Small buffet. Food is...ok. Sliced, roasted pork is very nice. 3 types of sushi (no labels as to what they are and all in the same pan). Not sure what I'm eating... But they're yummy. But, they have way too much rice and are too big to fit in my mouth, so I have to cut them... I'm a 43 year old man. I don't have a tiny mouth, lol. Along with that, there are no knives on any tables. The chunks of meat and broccoli are huge, but I can't cut them. Yes, I asked for a knife, but I shouldn't have to. The fried rice is terrible. Both trays taste burnt. Another restaurant where nobody is smiling, though the bartender/server is very friendly. My server is fine. It's a buffet, so... I'd skip it and go to the food court next time.

Erq9j7xeabcUzTy4QgHYrQ.text: That was the best Orange Chicken I have ever had and Mike F. took great care of us. Pricey but it's flippin Vegas. Totally recommend

qY-qWup4BUG255RWIAn0gw.text: Went to it because of the catchy name!. And loved the breakfast buffet. Very classy and tasty! Tons of choice!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Worth every penny. And very friendly service.

yvLKJ8Za7dMYe_9ocTaglA.text: Came here while on vacation in Vegas. Excellent food and service! The woman who seated us made small talk while a table was cleared. Our server, Austin, made sure our water was always refilled and checked on us through out the meal. He gave us recommendations on what to order. The food was delicious and filled us up. Definitely would go there again!

MqH_SZLm5Z6BEzLTdmNr7A.text: We were smashed.  So, take this with a grain of salt.  The food was very very good.  Service was very very good.   I don't know how much the alcohol played into all of this.   I know we were obnoxious, we showed up before they closed, we were loud and demanding.  But the food was very good.   I'd go back next time I'm in Vegas - sober - and see if this review still holds True

ZE3uLBmfa6bP6rpSOu7THA.text: NYE dinner- Service was great, our server was sweet (but a little over the top with forced energy). The food was decent....no complaints. Not the best sushi we have had(especially for the price), but it was good(esp the hokey pokey roll). I don't think we have any reason to return, $11 for a 16oz draft...$9 for a small wonton soup, and $20+ per sushi roll. Too pricey when Vegas has a lot of competitor restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WraEpd6fuDJnjIUP4Hlu6w.text: We were staying at New York New York and while roaming around we saw this place. This seemed to most crowed so thought to try this one out. Let me tell you I'm not a fan to chinse food as such but this place is really really good. Orange chicken is amazing - not too sweet, exactly how I like. They have signature dishes on the be menu, you can order any I bet you can't go wrong with that. Eggplant was good too. Definitely I go to place if you like Chinese.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avacado sushi
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange chicken

-S4dHmIX1j4v9e3L2XaO2w.text: I wasn't sure what to expect since it's in the middle of the NYNY casino but I really enjoyed this place. Service was very friendly and wasn't rushed at all. They even brought us to go cups with hot tea so we could finish our tea. The ginger dressing on the house salad is top notch and the salad is huge. The spicy garlic tomato beef is unlike anything I've had an a Chinese restaurant anywhere and it's almost like a cross between an Italian and Chinese dish. It was unique and enjoyable. Portions are large here, you won't leave hungry. This place is worth a try if you're on the strip and want Chinese food.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Salad
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Garlic Tomato Beef

oY0Hpy8tGGPfeS0xXzoPMw.text: I'm a huge fan of Chin Chin for almost 30 years. I support every location...Brentwood, Studio City, Beverly Hills, Sunset Strip, and this one in Vegas. I miss the one in Marina del Rey so much, as it was an enormous favorite of my Mom's.  Vegas is great and the pot stickers are double the size of the ones at the LA locations. I was a little surprised at the quality of the shimp they used in the Kung Pao dish, as they were much smaller in size than I have ever had at the LA locations. Food tasted great though and the service was excellent.

rbDPgiZymQtwFTqfHL7BkQ.text: It was not the experience I thought it would be when we first arrived. I haven't been so disappointed in a very long time. The service was good and friendly but I think it was to hide the fact that you were going pay way too much for nasty food. I had the  some kinda Pho seafood soup which I normally am nuts for but it was FOWL must of been fish frozen medly from a old grocery store! My hubby had sushi and I had a piece and it was good except the very fishy seaweed wrap. We are really into fresh yummy seafood and sushi and that by far was YUCK.    Then the bill came holy S&%$!!!! $75 for two barely meals WTF! OK its Vegas... I get it but Really we just took it! It will never happen again here or ever!!! Ruined the magic of our evening and Vegas experience for that evening! Thanks CHIN Nasty Chin!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZCUAX6d4Cf3bIxuQXa9tUw.text: Food was not good and order took FOREVER! The noodles was very salty, fried rice was old. Not the kind of Asian Cuisine I had expected to be.

Bx4TcjnT8QF7ITC6H0KadQ.text: We stayed at NYNY and our elevator was right behind Chin Chin so we constantly kept walking past it and decided to try their 2x1 breakfast special after talking to the girls when you walk in. What they DON'T tell you is that you can't use the complimentary bloody mary and mamosa special at the same time. My wife and I don't even like those drinks, but we thought since it was a comp of their breakfast specials we gave them a shot but only took two sips and left them.  Our waiter was straight horrible and even lied to us when my wife had asked for more orange juice... after 15 minutes of walking past us he finally came back and said they were "out of orange juice" and then 2 minutes later a waitress at another table was FUCKING SERVING ORANGE JUICE!!!! I couldn't believe it.   Once I finally got our check of course was when I realized and finally found out that I was charged for two breakfasts and had the shitty drinks comped. Ultimately, he let me do the 2x1 since it was cheaper and I ended up paying for the drinks just to get out of there.   Maybe the lunch/dinner vibe is better but I definitely wouldn't recommend this place for breakfast. All in all, we spent 2 hours to eat something we could've finished at Denny's in 30 minutes. Never again, dude.

IhEz0_G3EI89CHECiktX5w.text: Chin Chin has become a tradition for me whenever I visit Vegas (even if I'm not staying on The Strip), all because of the Szechuan Dumplings. They are tender and served with the most delicious spicy cilantro sauce. I always just want to get a double order and not try anything else, they are so good.  Went on a family trip recently, suggested we hit up Chin Chin, and had four persnickety adults agree that everything they ate was excellent.

837uPDhtst0_qWZfyCBnOA.text: OK, 5 stars...really?  YES!  The food here is wonderful.  Atmosphere was great, service (thanks Pedro) was unbelievable.  What a great, friendly guy.  We all had something different and it all was wonderful including the variety appetizer.  Prices were good for Vegas.   Cant say enough for how nice the remodel turned out, service and all around great time.  Would highly recommend!!!!

XqQokydYBXhtGe4megv8og.text: This restaurant is located in New York New York. I ate here for the breakfast buffet.   For some reason, I thought it was going to be breakfast buffet of Asian food. The only Asian thing they really had was the fried rice. The fried rice has eggs, peas, bacon and sausage in if. It was really good. The other food available was your typical breakfast foods. There were waffles, French toast, scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon. They had red velvet pancakes which were really good because they weren't too sweet. You also have the option of ordering an egg or omelette anyway you want it.   Overall, I thought it was a good breakfast buffet. I would come back here.

yecBh-ElNZsk9LrOrM0JkA.text: Service: At first we were seated fairly quickly. Then we had a coupon that was for free dim sum and the server was happy to take that with no issues. She then took our regular order for our entrees, quick and polite! After our dinner we ordered dessert which was also quick to come out. Overall fast and friendly!  Food: the seamed chicken dumplings was out choice for our free dim sum, they were so good they didn't need any sauce! The orange chicken was what my husband and I SHARED for dinner with 2 bowls of steamed rice. Just delicious!!!! They made our daughters chicken without sauce so she was very happy. Lastly we ordered mochi for dessert, it was not like the mochi we had eaten before but was good. We only tried the raspberry flavor but it was pretty good, it was a good small sharing dessert. Overall this was our second visit and On my way! one be our last!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our mochi, very yummy dessert!

cUwU7xTuw2HrGsyNYKNTWw.text: After running around doing touristy things with family, we decided to give this place a try. It has a bunch of great yelps, so why not? And if you check in on yelp, you can get a 2-4-1 priced lunch buffet. Sounds good.  I have had some of the best service ever while living in Las Vegas, and here was no exception. The hostess greeted us quickly and cheerfully, the waiter was great, we were off to a good start!  The lunch buffet was fine, nothing special to be honest. But what do you want for $19.95? None of us were impressed. We worked our way though a few items, even though it was 12:30 in the afternoon, the selection felt a little picked over. It was fine for a quick and easy bite.  The "dessert" are was colorful, but almost everything we tried was hard or stale. With the exception off the "cookie sandwiches" they were really great, and fresh.  After reading the reviews, I am thinking that ordering off the menu might be a better way to go. Next time, if there is one....I will try that.

8iQcsboi9bKYv_LyuGhQ8g.text: Great meal after George Strait concert. Highlight was our server, Dexter. He made great suggestions which made the delicious meal more enjoyable!

-Iro_yEV4FIdKJuQtRAG0w.text: I was disappointed in my last outing to Chin Chin.  A large Hot & Sour Soup with shredded pork, carrots, green onions, tofu, jalapenos, and egg that I consumed myself was very good, and slightly crisp Chicken Spring Roll wrappers were good, but the insides were just okay and not very flavorful.  I had to keep dipping the deep-fried morsels in Sweet & Sour Sauce to enjoy some taste.  From now on I will stick to Vegetable or Shrimp Spring Rolls.    Shrimp with Garlic & Snow Peas featured good-sized, succulent shrimp, tasty snow peas, and small mushroom pieces, but I could have done without the carrots, and would have enjoyed a delicate crystal White Sauce better than the dark Brown Sauce with which the dish was immersed.  Cashew Shrimp was prepared with a much lighter Brown Sauce that I liked a whole lot better.  I can only describe the Orange Chicken as weird.  It consisted of large chunks of chicken, peppers, and onions glazed with an Orange Sauce but not at all typical for this breed of Cantonese fare.  Szechuan String Beans were okay but unremarkable.  Most disappointing of all was Small Egg-Fried Rice with scallions.  The rice was richly bathed in soy-based Brown Sauce, and at first sighting had no visible egg in it.  I pointed this out to my server, and he volunteered to take back the dish and have more egg added, which I let him do.  Although improved, even upon its return the rice did not sport much egg.  Hot Tea was good, and our pot lasted quite awhile.  But by the end of our dinner, even an unusual Chocolate Dome, consisting of Dark Chocolate Ganache that exposed Chocolate Mousse and white cake inside that was possibly honey-soaked after being cracked open, could not save the day for this rather ordinary meal.  Our server was very good and accommodating.  And our surroundings that featured dark woods and white-linen tablecloths were comfortable and pleasant.  But there are just too many other better Chinese restaurants in Las Vegas that I have now experienced for me to go out of my way to return here.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining Room
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small Egg-Fried Rice
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan String Beans

z5KeoefNTtlChlzzEf4t7A.text: Place and food are awesome!!! Ben, omg  his an amaZing person has great customer skills extremely professional!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi is super fresh!!

-cIfN9RxHLFvlA5kCYl3ew.text: Stopped here before hitting the road home on our annual trip to Las Vegas. Arrived about 11am for Sunday breakfast and was very happy with the breakfast buffet. A lot to choose from, reasonably priced ($23), and the service was great. Made to order omelettes as well as buffet style. Hostesses were cordial and our server Jay was awesome. He was friendly, prompt, knowledgeable, and great overall. We will definitely make this an every trip stop before we head home Sundays. My only complaint was the restaurant was fairly small but the food and service make up for that. Worth the try--highly recommend it.

7FHyHMIzyDIxOz-s7aDweA.text: My meal at Chin Chin was better than I expected.  The menu is full of the food that you'd find in any local Americanized Chinese take out place along with various other Asian foods like Sushi and Pad Thai.  I didn't see any Pho or Bulgogi and I was almost expecting them.  I hadn't eaten all day and because the underwhelming size of a previous meal at the nearby Gonzales y Gonzales, I may have ordered too much.  I got a Spicy Rainbow Roll and the Peanut Noodles.  They were both good, larger than I expected, and not under-spiced. Even better, I didn't wake up thirsty in the middle of the night because of too much salt or MSG.  I would have liked to see more sushi and sashimi options, but to complain about it at a Chinese restaurant seems weird.  I would have also have liked to try something that I couldn't get at home and sadly, the Peanut Noodles were about as close as I could get.

4JRROPOpwGl0TtQvoAYt3Q.text: Prices were decent, portions are HUGE. We got a soup and it was enough for 8 people. It came in a mixing bowl not a soup bowl. Sushi left much to be desired. I ordered the volcano roll and it just had way to much going on, too much sauce, too much cream cheese in the roll and too much junk piled on top. It was overwhelming. My boyfriend ordered the noodle dish with pork and it was very good probably my favorite thing at the table. Service was very friendly and funny but it was also hard to find him. Drinks constantly empty. Waited a long time to receive our ticket. Food came out uncoordinated, because half comes from the kitchen and the other half from the sushi area so by the time we got our rolls the other side of the table was done eating

_ztWHrYk5uhyLuAjO1gZwg.text: Surprising to find a Chin Chin in Vegas! I've been to Chin Chin in LA and loved it so I had to check it out here.   Couple of awesome differences than LA.  -They have a full bar so you can drink right before the cirque du soleil show (which we did) -SUSHI -They have a breakfast buffet here!  We started off with sushi. Since the entire table wanted some sushi and sashimi, we asked to the sushi chef to go crazy with an assortment. (Pictures to follow)  After sushi we stuck with our favorites.. Chinese chicken salad, chicken potstickers, wonton stars. We only ordered apps since we got full off drinks and sushi.  Overall extremely friendly staff from the start to end. Managers seem to really care and table touch all the tables. Next time I come back to Vegas, I'll be coming back here for another meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLUEBERRY SPARKLING SAKE
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi!!!

NfO_ana705kNlBUXH1rBsQ.text: This is honestly a hidden gem in Vegas. I'm always skeptical of Chinese restaurants (being Chinese myself), but the food here is top-notch quality and mirrors what I typically eat with my fam.  We had the AYCE lunch buffet during my visit. We sat at the bar and was served by Kayli. She was very friendly and knowledgable -- she knew exactly what the dishes were (ppl beside us kept asking what sushi dishes they had). Kayli also knew her drinks and was able to whip up a dragon fruit mojito for me, which was not on the drink menu and was very well balanced and not too strong.  Food wise, I highly recommend the DIY lettuce wraps, and the BBQ Pork (SOOO GOOD). The fried rice was also amazing but a bit salty. Since they only had a small selection, I was able to try a bit of everything and it was amazing. They had all of the staples like shrimp and celery, 3x fried rice, chow mein, mango chicken, etc. Epic place and I'm glad I found it!   (Note - the one missing star is because of the small selection, and it was actually quite difficult to find in NY NY)

iypw6TDPDc8Y_VngsubI6Q.text: For the buffet, there appeared to be limited options, but there were just the right amount of options. Food was actually very fresh and great tasting. I highly enjoyed everything from this buffet including desert. Our server Andres was great, too!

aOiUrsd_CZWwNLPSYN-qdw.text: I have been here two different times and each time I had a great experience, great food and great service. My more recent visit I was eating solo and ordered the Chicken Pad Thai which was delicious. It wasn't too sweet and not too tart. Noodles cooked to perfection and a large portion.   I had a drink but don't remember the name and couldn't find it on the online menu but it was something about a dragon. Made with Absolute Apple vodka, cucumber soda and ginger beer. It was delicious.   The service was fast and it was great. I had no complaints about the service at all!    I'll be back.

4Cq4JXuRYqYQsPY3bnh_mQ.text: Fantastic!!! Koong, Garry, and Stephen where awesome, the hostess were so friendly and the waitresses were very attentive. Paola and Mica dragged us in and we come back everyday!

FslsdHwvd3L_ughHtx0sCg.text: We have the 2 for 1 Buffett breakfast special before 9am. Good omelette and buffet selection.

O6EioR1hPvy9ltsdDyazRg.text: The waiters are all very nice and welcoming; the place is lovely. Unfortunately the Chinese food (tonight?) is overcooked and not good at all. Pity!

LCDGTorj2Yj1SjQKXb_PCA.text: We arrived after a show on Saturday night, no reservation with a party of 8. The staff was friendly and got us seated in a matter of minutes at a comfortable table. In our party two were sushi fans, one is gluten free, and remainder like traditional chinese fair. Everyone was pleased. The waiter was great. The cheesecake was amazing!

lu0axCMzeTj1NPXIiIfKSA.text: I really loved Chin Chin! Tucked away in NYNY, it had the latest-running breakfast buffet on the Strip I could find. Always worth it to charge to your room for Mlife points as well.   Great food, artistic, trendy, clean, and delicious! Our server was incredibly kind as well. Coffee was what you would expect, but food was wonderful.

ni9Fvb441elW2o6BWjWFCg.text: After reading reviews about the buffet, I was skeptical. The menu looked good though. When I got there, I scoped out the buffet. It looked pretty good. It's $19.95 for lunch. Entrees run about the same so I thought I would try it. It was pretty good, decent variety and not overwhelming. Our server, Oscar M was quite pleasant and polite as well. I used the buy one get one coupon from Yelp for the lunch buffet, which helped significantly.

4TtyYNbVKThpV0IiNgjElA.text: We were looking for somewhere to eat before Zumanity.  We called Chin Chin and made reservations a few hours before just to be on the safe side.  When we arrived there was a small line - but we got right in.  Service was a little slow and the food was just plain blah.  I am shocked that people recommend this place and use the word superb in their reviews.

GxB-rbCWFdwFaEgXWtLKIw.text: Okay.. so the food was good.. the drink was strong.. but then I got sick right before we boarded our plane.. not good... guess I shouldn't have eaten there before flying.  I thought  it was a little pricey ... but you do get pretty large portions.

7KxxABri4qtPLa8mos1rrA.text: This review is more for the bar in the front. I don't really care for the food. If you are feeling adventurous and you love fruity drinks as much as I do, then this is the place for you. They have all sort of exotic fruit drinks. My favorite came with mango. They even have some with pomegranate. SUPER YUMMY! Also, the bartender was super cool about making you a new one if you didn't like it, BUT I LOVED THEM ALL!!!

PKcRvHd8kynisxBPatZ55A.text: overrated Chinese food.  reminds me of upscale around the corner food.  very disappointing.  The fried rice was bland and my garlic chicken had alot of bok choy but hardly any chicken.  Forget the drinks my chocolate martini needed chocolate.

J9TZv-0_64AQXu6f5Vi8ig.text: Just ordere fried rice (panda express has almost same quality and taste) and some noodle dish---anything but authentic and just wasnt memorable at all. Skip the waste of time, not even worth the one trip there.

aqgzuEfqlfpPf3y7Sr66sw.text: Great chinese food. I would recommend this over PF Changs. The bartender there named David did a great job in serving us. They also serve sushi even though its not chinese food, but it is pretty good. Chin Chin also has a breakfast buffett which serves you regular breakfast food, not chinese food for breakfast

NFtoOiriKTlLFCUsasd7Ow.text: We accidentally walked into this place recently because we were mildly intoxicated and hungry.  In short this place is trying to be upscale but it should be noted that it is affordable and they serve you huge portions thus the prior reviewers reference to PFChang's.    We ordered two entrees, a rice dish, and an appetizer but really we should have only ordered the two entrees since we only finished about 1/4 of all the food we had.  We were sad the food was going to waste because normally we would've love to take a doggie bag home but were starting our night out and did'nt want to lug our food all the way back to our room at Planet Hollywood.  Anyways, the server was great and was'nt too hovering or distant.  All in all we had a wonderful dinner here but we were sad to see 3/4 of the food at the table since were stuffed !

GROjh1dkauT8kjq6jd-_gg.text: I used to love Chin Chin, but the service and food quality has gone down considerably. The decor is very nice and it is inside one of the best themed casinos on the Strip. Unfortunately, there is a loss of subtly in their cuisine. The flavors are too harsh and they would benefit from a menu overhaul and more careful attention to subtly of flavors.

Aqjw4U0d69i8wpKe_gt-2Q.text: Food Poisoning !! Went to this restaurant in June of 2012 for lunch. Had the Shui Mei and pork steamed dumplings, along with the sampler sashimi plate. The food tasted sub-par at best. Several hours later, my companion was throwing up for the next 4 hours. Had to seek medical attention, a doctor was called to our room. My companion was trapped in the room for the next 2 days, dehydrated and too weak to travel. She could not eat at all, and we just stayed in. On the second day, I felt ill as well. This turned out to be a very expensive lunch, as the Doctor and the meds cost a large amount of money. So much for our vacation ! It was ruined, and we just left and drove back to L.A.. Since then (and it has been about 3 1/2 weeks since) Chin Chin management has not called back to discuss after I made reports to NY NY Risk Management Dept. I was told by NY NY that they lease and they passed the buck to Chin Chin, saying that they aren't directly responsible. All I can say is BEWARE of eating here ! My next call will be to the Nevada Health Dept. as I am getting no responses from either Chin Chin corporate or NY NY.

fT6MR77noW7hzKxErX1R3g.text: I would not recommend eating here. There are many other better choices for Asian food close by, such as in the MGM where we were staying.  But this place looked good, so we tried it.  First of all, we ordered some hot tea only to be served in dirty glasses.  Our waiter did not seem to care (he seemed to really not care about his job in general).   We placed our order, and then a few minutes later he came back to tell us they do not have any Pad Thai.  He asked us if we wanted something else instead, but how would we know if we no longer had menus in front of us? SO,  we asked to see menus again.  He totally forgot and we had to remind him twice to bring us menus.  (We did order one sushi roll which was pretty decent).  We picked a seafood noodle dish which was EXTREMELY spicy to our surprise.  Like the hot pepper shaker just totally spilled out all over the noodles.   Try to avoid this place at NY NY if possible. There are much better Asian options elsewhere.

xizMz7dWyI_0sV3AHt6zag.text: First time in Sin City and this restaurant made my trip. The portions were huge and the food was so flavorful and inexpensive. Chicken, bbq ribs, and fried rice were awesome. We had the best waiter ever. I strongly recommend this one.

VmxsPKApNOGGbt4L85rnFQ.text: Were this restaurant in my hometown, I would give it only 3 stars. But is is one of the better moderately priced restaurants on the strip, so plus one star for that. The portions are generous and many dishes are in the $12 - $15 range.

uzuXFmFMxnNaIo4sGVVayg.text: Spent the weekend in Vegas (Yeah Baby!), and after taking in Zumanity, we went to eat at Chin Chin. What a really great little Chinese restaurant that is located inside the New York New York Hotel and Casio. Started off with Pot Stickers that were very good and continued with a bowl of Won Ton soup with a nice piece of pork in it. Main Entree' was Kung Pao Chicken. It had the right amount of bang to make it enjoyable. The service was so-so. It wasn't very busy for 9 p.m., so the waitress could have been a little more available, but overall, we really enjoyed it.

OFnF0mRUR5ULiCBMDpbeWQ.text: The food was delicious!!!!!!!!!   We ate here Christmas Eve and each dish was divine. Their spicy eggplant was my favorite and something I have not been able to find anywhere else. We also had a noodle dish, a tomato beef  dish and pan fried dumplings. The service was excellent. The place was very slow. I noticed on Christmas Eve many of the places on the strip were slow. Maybe we got better service because our waiter obviously didn't have a whole lot else to do. Regardless, loved the food!!!!!!!

JvV80ypPDQPfslZeY6RCUQ.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant. There were four of us, so I got to sample quite a bit of their food. My friends were vegetarian, and I'm not - but surprisingly the thing I liked best was the Garlic Eggplant.  And I don't love Eggplant either though I've recently learned to like it.  It was really nicely flavored. I also tried and enjoyed the Chicken Fried Rice, King Pao Trio, spring rolls, and General Tso's chicken. It not a cheap meal, but this was in a Vegas casino, so I was expecting it.  I'd go back for sure.

U4U70qACo2VfjuFLq0mwfw.text: great food, fast service, nice staff. we waited a lengthy five minutes for our food (wow).
