DtqENNvDEmt1MsXIY-V-4A.text: We were hungry and needed to eat right away. Didn't see anything interesting to eat in this food court. So we decided to eat here. We split a Chinese chicken salad witch was good. could have used more greens. Main course was ribs and chicken. chicken was good and the ribs was good too. But the cause was way to salty ! And the sause was mixed with the rice so it was like eating mushy salty rice LOL . Was ok . I tried my friend food and that was to salty to !  I have to give them three stars because the chicken was cooked well and the ribs was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs &amp; Chicken
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In New York New York hotel

o_jZ6GY6otdntqnb54vKPA.text: It seems like everything cost twice as much in Vegas and the menu items at Chin Chin are no exception. We went with the lunch buffet at $23 pp (soda and tea are extra starting at $5). Although this cost is on par with most all you can eat buffets in Vegas, the sushi starts at $25 for just a few pieces with a cup of rice being $8.00 extra. The variety of food was good and the quality is on par with Panda Express. The entrees included Kung Pow Chicken, Beef & Broccoli, General Taos Chicken with soup, rice, egg rolls, salad, 4 types of sushi rolls and a variety of dessert items. The service was very friendly and attentive. We stayed away from ordering sushi as it was too expensive for what little you were offered.

qwQ9Q-N0KEhWUOCfWxIYbQ.text: Worst sushi I had in my life and the rolls were $25 each. Each member of my group ate one piece and had to leave  the rest because it was so bad. 0/10 would recommend.

qsTBn_AVRhDUzq4ktimMaw.text: After reading negative reviews I was a little nervous to try it here - however we had nothing but a great experience! Everyone we encountered was great!   Even had a manager stop to see how our food was.  We ordered the Mongolian beef, chinese chicken salad and shrimp tempura roll sushi. Everything tasted awesome I recommend the beef - it was melt in your mouth and large portion!  Would visit here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tempura roll- very good from a sushi lover
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese chicken salad - a little kick but still very good
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian beef - much larger portion than I expected- melt in your mouth beef

D2GSseN6JqjyZVvpahLMjg.text: After writing the first review I was immediately contacted by the Corporate Management and offered to revisit them, so the stuff at the Las Vegas location could show us a better experience in line with the experiences my family had for more than a decade in all the Los Angeles branches.  I took the chance this past weekend to celebrate my wife's Birthday together with the birthday of one of my oldest friend who was visiting from the UK for the first Las Vegas together with his family.  I want to say that the experience we had was great, the branch's management and stuff (Cory, Erick & Chris) were very attentive and the food got to our table at the right time tasting great.  Now I'll always visit them in Las Vegas to have a great meal!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The great looking and friendly hostess!!!

AutrsSM9Tg32NJPHFKyv9Q.text: We were welcomed by our cute waitress Beca! She's very dynamic and has a great smile.. The food is good. We love sushis so we mostly order that.. Chef Soong  from the sushi bar is the best.. very professional and great to talk to.. she knows her stuff and does it with her love of making food for others.. Highly recommend this place!!

zVZGG8ZPHSsecSEaVRG9hw.text: This was my first ever good sushi experience.  I'd only ever had bad sushi years and years ago, so I really didn't think I'd like it.  I'm glad I gave it a second chance.  We were pleased with all the sushi rolls we ordered.

GojsS_hEB0G3MAOfTY7jpA.text: The average of three stars for Chin Chin seems about right, as we had a party of four here and we were split with two of us loving our meals, and the other two a bit unimpressed, so your experience here might be a little bit of a roulette that depends on what you go for. (Those that didn't love it complained their selections were over-salty and pretty greasy.)  We all found the staff really friendly and on top of their game though, and loved that (like most anywhere in Vegas) we could bring in outside booze we were consuming at the time and finish it with our dinner. Food came out quick too, which was great as we were time sensitive about to shoot off to see a show.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CM1rX1gL6tNvMa8dTczCYg.text: Newly renovated and I'm loving the new ambiance, as well as the food. It was great at first and it doesn't disappoint till now. The bloody mary is awesome here.

J7VTEuJP5BhCWn_AyhoQmg.text: Came here with my husband based on Yelp! reviews. We were not disappointed with this restaurant. The customer service was outstanding. Our waiter was Scott B and he was very knowledgeable about the menu and drinks. He explained everything so well that we had a hard time deciding what to eat because everything sounded amazing. We decided to try the orange chicken w/ white rice and Mongolian beef w/ noodles. They were both extremely good. No soy sauce needed. I highly recommend this place and ask for Scott B!!!

JyiVC3e4Nj0SMP3Cx6y-Ig.text: We have been to Chin Chin on several occasions while in Vegas and we are never disappointed. The variety of food is great and portions are huge. I normally always get sushi but this time hubby and I split some pork fried rice and it was great! Sure it's "gourmet" Asian food but hey it's Vegas. Defibrillator stop by. This time our server was Cesar and he was super nice, friendly, funny and helpful. He is the one that recommended the pain killer and it was really delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top is the fire dragon roll , bottom is a spider . Drink is a pain killer, rum, pineapple juice and something else
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top is the fire dragon roll , bottom is a spider roll.
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A painkiller

l6CXWPYPKELti1V_zkmE9A.text: Felt so welcome right from the check in desk. I ordered my meal to go, was invited to sit at the bar while I waited. Ordered one of the best Moscow mule's I have ever had and was offered a glass of water I could take back to my room with my dinner. The wonton soup and pork noodles were delicious. SO delicious that I returned to plate 3x until I finished the entire thing. I look forward to my next trip to Vegas as this will be one of my go to spots.

ngccqJLb31bhaf3gs_HcJA.text: It's pricey but everything is in a touristy place like Vegas. It is so good. I had the Assorted Pleasures and a Miso soup. It was plenty of food for me. I don't know what's in that gift wrap chicken but it was amazing!! And the miso soup was just right for a late night dinner is Vegas. I recommend this place in a sea of pizza places. I ordered take out and it was ready in 15-20 minutes. I recommend the assorted pleasures. It's a 8-piece appetizer, so you can get a little taste of different things. Like their egg roll, wontons, and the gift wrap chicken - which was soo tasty. Enjoy!

W24l0rsUURwt_0Q3xAXIuA.text: Avoid if you have tastebuds!!!  We ordered 3 things on the menu and all were disappointing.   Eat at shake shack around the corner instead.

zVOzGaDGYyOI0KF0k4c8Bw.text: Food is terrible, service is slow! Soggy nudges, cold baked shrimp, chewy rubbery chicken.

6xCaQ1gT4wexK6WX-xqWbw.text: Came here before seeing Zumanity. Chose the location based on proximity to the show. Portions were large but quality was so-so. Our group sampled many things and there wasn't anything absolutely outstanding, either good or bad. With so many incredible restaurants in Vegas, we will likely will not eat here again.

I_2O6m2NF_pGiye_Q0ODPg.text: Nothing very exciting.  We were hoping to get in on the lunch buffet, but at 2:20, we were told it was closing down.  Service was good, our waitress was attentive and pleasant.  Food was average.  Wontons were burned. Pork buns  were fine.

vPHv6HI4MkXpABuAOyPBaQ.text: We ate here for breakfast two days in a row as we stayed at the New York New York. The buffet was good with a good variety of food. The omelettes were made fresh and you were given a choice of many add ins. I got crab meat, some veggies and cheese- really good. The coffee was good as well. The service was great as well.

C_i7dTq4keOUdOuKh6JjDQ.text: Ok so with the name you wouldn't think breakfast, but that is where you will be making a huge mistake. M-F 7-9am they have a bogo breakfast Buffett that is really good. The Buffett isn't as large as the main buffets in the casinos, but they have really good freshly prepared options including a made to order eggs/omelet option. Non-alcoholic drinks come with your meal and the OJ is fresh squeezed! Make sure to get here by 8 or 8:30 that's when the line starts. The service is over the top great

BALapgfNr4V97Ih14CdK5w.text: This place has a nice ambiance. My husband I had the buffet, and boy was it filling! I do wish they had more sushi options in the buffet, and especially the menu. Oddly enough, out of the sushi they did have available, the California Roll was the best one. Prices are a bit high for the quality, but when one is in Las Vegas it's expected that you'll be spending money anywhere you go. The staff is really nice, and are very attentive when it comes to taking empty plates and rubbish off to make space.

v5d0vLrCbwNmgCfph3aSkg.text: This restaurant is a bit confusing to me when I first walked by.  But the nice hostess explained to me it's a breakfast/lunch buffet and regular dining at night.  We came for the breakfast buffet and didn't have much expectations.  However, all the food were great and they have some unusual offerings like fried rice, velvet pancakes and nice desserts.  Staff were super friendly.

UfyrQYqid4glFWQF-LGDUQ.text: Chin chin did not have many options for the buffet. They had two bars of food. The salty fried rice and chow mein only had chicken in it & they were found on both bars. Not really asian food. Chicken strips, mac n cheese, french fries, and an "asian" salad that is shredded lettuce + chips is authentic?   They offered sushi but each of the 2-3 trays had very few pieces left to pick from. I'd say the items that were good were the desserts. The cut fruits were fresh and ripe.   The spring rolls had been sitting out for a while because the spring roll wrapping was hardened when my mom ate it.   Everyone was very polite and welcoming but the service was kinda slow. Our waitress disappeared for a while and we were waiting for our check.   It was about $24 per person for lunch and our bill for 3 people + tax + tip came out to be $87.   They also have a regular menu that you can order from but i don't think we'd be back to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. holy moly look at this spring roll

DqPykpclaPHF3l5OA-q34A.text: We literally stumbled on Chin Chin on our first morning in Vegas and had breakfast. And came back two more mornings for for breakfast as well. My suggestion - skip the buffet and order off of the breakfast menu. We did the buffet the first day and it was good. But it was the typical $25 and we don't gorge ourselves so we didn't feel we got much of a return for our money. The next two days we ordered off the menu. Great $10 omelletes that come with toast and a choice of potatoes or fruit. Very filling and much more wallet friendly. The service was top notch.  We go to Vegas every year and Chin Chin will be in the rotation going forward.

zX8EPDlCi7rdQKW4VfyEbQ.text: We were starving and had 30 minutes until the show opened.  The awesome staff here were the most friendly and spectacular staff that I've ever experienced! Jordan had us in and out within 30 minutes.  We're coming back to enjoy the food better next time.

EGPVAicHoQGZp4z0-EFMkA.text: Service is good. Food is not tasty, fried rice is no favor, orange chicken is very sour and salty. Sushi is ok. It is little pricy for this kind of food!

lvPcz41ZxKpxY9laU1w6IA.text: Great meal and excellent service.  Dexter gave us his honest opinion on ordering and did not lead us wrong.  Large portions!!!  Decent prices. Nice variety of menu items.  We will go back next time in Vegas!

1Hy1FrFbMLT6S_rbtlrBag.text: I'm staying at NY/NY  for a game. I stopped by Chin Chin for lunch and breakfast. The staff (Andres) and mangers gave top notch customer service.  My breakfast highlights: red velvet pancakes, French toast, carved ham and salmon-caper eggs Benedict. 2 for 1 before 9am.  Lunch Highlights: mostly everything, I love Chinese food. Although, for  $30 (including tax and tip) price I probably should have tried a place with an upscale ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Line to get in before 9
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vQAQ1NP3Bglq6pTE_b8IhQ.text: What a place! Is a must try if you in Vegas! Hands down some of the best customer service thanks to David & Maggie! There food was amazing everything was very tasteful! Thank you for the great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

es9huDo1z8tQCFs8ZaR9bA.text: Very friendly staff! I'm from south FL and not used to friendly service! Food was yum. I did the regular chicken lo mein but made spicy. I tried the Sichuan dumplings. But they came out with a cilantro pesto sauce vs the red sauce it typically would have for Sichuan. But it was tasty. I ate at the bar solo and the bartender Jodi was store nice and the hostess at front with long blonde hair was friendly and nice!  Bill with tip came to $43

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken lo mein ( made spicy upon request)  and Sichuan dumplings

2MJyR71sBKVrxfVut7I1_w.text: Chin Chin is located inside New York New York. had walked past by Chin Chin during my last couple of trips to Vegas, and I've always been curious.   Hubby and I decided to try this place out for a late night dinner on Sunday (thank you hunger and alcohol!), and I was impressed. I decided to try and keep things healthy since I had stuffed myself the night before at a buffet, so I opted for the California roll with brown rice (kudos for having brown rice available) and hubby got the broccoli beef.  The portions here are definitely huge, both the roll and entree. I thought the roll was good, nothing amazing, but good. Hubby thought the broccoli beef was also good, just wished there was less sauce. That's on us though, we should have asked for light sauce.   Our server was nice and attentive.  Of course this place is a little pricey for the quality of food, but what in Vegas isn't overpriced.   I would come back if I'm hungry and in the Casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California roll with brown rice, and broccoli beef.

XE3qMsydEUq0ji8v3NScgQ.text: Stopped for breakfast on our fist day here.  We have been here before (2 of us) and it was wonderful. This time I was alone and had terrible service.  They sat me at the bar so the bartender was only interested in asking my drink choice and never again.  I was never told about the made to order omelet, which I was really looking forward to.  Scrambled eggs were one notch below a 1 star hotel grade. 35$ with tip for that level of service and attention was not what I was hoping for.

ufr_IEG7MB2PFFZ5LEH9aA.text: I`m giving 4 stars because this was the best Chinese food I had on the Strip.  The hostess was very friendly.  The server was friendly and attentive.  I had the chicken chow fun for lunch.  It wasn't SF Bay Area authentic but I relished it because I had some pretty bad Chinese food at othrr places.  You are paying Las Vegas prices so be prepared.  I had the chicken chow fun and one beer.  Out the door, with a tip, $36.00

rYwZlq2a3TDY5ElK34tNQQ.text: We came here because it was one of the only sushi restaurants still open later at night. This sushi was good, though pricey. Big menu and friendly service. We tried the salmon crunch roll and the yum yum scallop roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lKXJdbO1cx7bANo0Qxxtpg.text: The best waitress in Vegas.   The food is great but u gave to have Yvette as your waitress.  She is fabulous.   Got to try chin chin in NY N Y invagas.   She is the best!

c_59MkcpQhcuVW8X3_XoRQ.text: Totally recommend this place. We were here for lunch buffet and they have a great variation of dishes to choose from. Only $25.00 per person. Totally worth it. Deserts  were amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ymRUZHNl4gkCo7HTnKzqFw.text: Good food  Great service  Thanks you the staff that greets us so kindly year after year

AqzFcu-Aov2eXeIfe898ew.text: Chin chin must mean take all my money for horrible made Chinese food....asian guy asks where we want to sit, i said booth and he stops talking to us like we were ghosts, walked ourselves in and sat ourselves...finally created by a female host that was cool, she was awesome ...told us our waiter would be on the way...like seriously I eat at Chinatown being so close to New York City, I feel like a random chef who never made Chinese food made our meal....the Cali rolls were bomb, you get your stars for good sushi rolls and service..the rice that came in small cups wasn't even hot, seemed old and not even steaming hot....we asked for shrimp n broccoli, we got something else lol...if you cook chinese food and don't know how to make that...you defiantly ain't a chef of asian cuisine...the shrimp i must say was fresh, noodles could have used more flavor....pretty dry....all in all we had a great dining experience because being anywhere with my wife is a awesome time... thank god forthe monito but man, I understand casino restaurant but the food quality could been better, definitely going to try the Chinese restaurant in Paris casino next time because it looked better all the way!

mbfWCxH8iJXFd0zxB0hXZg.text: I am reading the reviews on here and I am shocked.  Also, to the people who are upset and saying that they are disappointed that it wasn't authentic Chinese...Chin Chin doesn't promote themselves as authentic Chinese. It is americanized Chinese and it is delicious.  I went to the sunset location in Los Angeles for many many years.  Coming to this Las Vegas location is difficult because it is on the strip, but it is 100% worth it. I usually just get their Chinese chicken salad and Szechuan dumplings.  I get extra sauce on the side because that cilantro sauce is like no other. I can literally eat it with a spoon. Occasionally I'll order a cup of soup and Mongolian beef.  This location also has a buffet option and sushi options.  Sushi is fresh and delicious.  I would recommend using the buffet for sushi because there is a lot of option. Overall Chin Chin is great and I recommend it to everyone!

zxFfI_X5x_4zQzCGIlIwkA.text: The buffet was so so, but it was the service that drew us in. All the way from the hostess to each and every server that served us.  We would go back in a heartbeat and try a meal or sushi just because of the way we were treated. Vegas can be hit or miss with good service, and Chin Chin did it right.

lP9qwz3avqnh87BYxMJnMQ.text: I'm really surprised at how bad the lunch buffet is.  It's like I went to some crappy strip mall Chinese buffet.

9fwFYA5Ky_3SjgI5iJW6eA.text: If you want NON Chinese food, lousy taste and lots of "fillers", this place is for you. Unfortunately, it's not for me. The following email was sent to the management at Chin Chin. There was no response. I emailed the corporate office - still no response. Finally, I called "food and beverage" at New York New York . They contacted the Chin Chin manager and she called me say she regretted our experience. She also said she would add more meats next time. Too bad there won't be a "next time".   This is the email I sent:  While staying at NY NY in Las Vegas, my son and his girlfriend  treated me and my wife to dinner at the hotel. It was convenient and we were in the mood for Chinese food. To the point, it was the most disappointing Chinese food we have ever had. The Sushi was awful, the Chinese chicken salad was almost lacking of chicken - there was hardly any there. The King Pao chicken/shrimp[/beef was little more than a pile of chestnuts and peanuts. There were only a few shrimp, and a few pieces of beef and chicken. The tuna tartar was also disappointing. Our dinner was a sham. You are charging enough; you don't have to skimp with fillers. If it were just my wife and me, we would have walked out, but we were guests. In the end, you have 4 very unhappy customers.  Any other Chinese restaurant in Vegas would be better (and much cheaper) than Chin Chin.

EJqyNh3hID9q7lN_kVRQdw.text: Terrible food.  Soggy pork dumplings, tasteless Asian chicken salad, and the Pad Thai had an odd burnt flavor.  STAY AWAY!

-tZk32-ZpuGi0CCyQdHUIA.text: Wanted to treat family members to a nice dinner, but was so disappointed!  The beef-broccoli had inedible mushrooms; they were like shoe leather!  I had to spit one out in a doily that was under a teapot (didn't want to use my cloth napkin for this).  I couldn't even cut it with a knife!  The noodles had a bad texture and flavor; they tasted old & gummy.  The orange chicken was pretty good, I stuck with that & my rice, which they charge extra for.  Most Chinese restaurants include rice with their entrees.  Our party of four had a bill of $66.97 & that was without drinks (only 1 in the group had a pot of hot tea).  I wouldn't have minded the high price if the food was good.

HXFlIO3d8qPeCNvpTQpRbw.text: Chin Chin can also mean "penis" in Japanese.  Great marketing staff over there!

3DmSBe7RzYs4LbwyAQ4Jqw.text: I've been to Chin Chin a couple of times and I've yet to be disappointed. The drinks are always strong, the wine is never old.  This time we ordered the Wonton Soup and Anthony's Special Noodles. The wonton soup broth was amazing, light and complex I could taste a lot of white pepper which was great. The wontons were flavorful and tender. Anthony's Noodles were also very delicious, the flavor was lightly spicy and heavy with the taste of cilantro.   Far from traditional, but that's not what you're here for (traditional can be found on Spring Mountain, the chinatown plaza). Portions are huge, the grease is great for building up the required barrier in your stomach required for heavy drinking! Will definitely be back for more when we're back in town in November.

7k9Jbw0j-ETJkq0ntrlPtw.text: Sat at counter and ordered sushi. Waiter was so nice. Sushi chefs made us an extra couple pieces to try in addition to what we ordered. Order 2 rolls get a hot saki. Rolls were pretty good. Not best I've ever had, but pretty good. Sushi chefs made me a cat out of an orange.

ocjF3jm04VQhFo4yZUYcvw.text: Dined in a chin chin. Food was amazing! Everybody that I had was mouthwatering. My server Jordan was so friendly and kept checking up on me. I came in during the lunch buffet and my favorite dishes were the California rolls and beef and broccoli. During my meal I was greeted by the managers Linda and Kyle who are extremely friendly. I would recommend this place in a heartbeat if anyone asks. Amazing food!! Wonderful service. Awesome staff.

wUOVl9tStOhsbD2_YiPBQw.text: Very pretty and convenient restaurant. Our waiter was very attentive.  The food was a disappointment, though. The sushi was supermarket grade at best--stay away from it! Wor wonton soup was unorthodox and bland. The Mongolian beef, however, was pretty good. Hot and sour soup not bad if you like it BLAZING hot. Verdict: OK if you want spicy meat dishes; avoid the place if you're inclined to order fish.

laE4zJqL1JJT1ED5YVdReQ.text: Excellent service, average food. Restaurant prices are very high on the Strip. This Chinese restaurant in New York New York, has more reasonable prices. We had dinner there twice. Nothing was outstanding but nothing was subpar. I would have driven to Chinatown but driving in and out of the Strip is onerous.

LxTe0gwKr9W4BgFgfiS1fw.text: My partner and I were craving Asian food as it is easily accessible in Australia so decided to go downstairs. I don't mean to bash but this place does not serve authentic Asian food. Please note, I am Chinese myself. I'm no masterchef but this is by far the worst "Asian" restaurant I have been to. My hot and sour soup was extremely peppery, too thick and not the correct colour. Our beans and chicken dishes were covered in salt. Our summer rolls were not fresh. I could tell it was taken out of the fridge and cut up to be served. The rice was dry. I have never been so reluctant to finish my food. The only thing that was made right was our spicy tuna sushi. Nonetheless, the customer service was good as it always is in America. We reluctantly told the manager when asked how our meal was. When asking for the bill, we received a discount for the dishes we were particularly not happy with, which was nice. Need I say I won't be returning?

XIZV3M_3UdqwBxFDZKspKw.text: Yang Chow Fried rice was REALLY good, but they use the cheap small shrimps instead of the jumbo shrimps. We also got the chicken egg rolls, which I didn't care for and the Mongolian Beef was just OK. It tasted more like Teriyaki to me. We asked for the calamari and ended up not getting it because the server didn't know they no longer served it. The manager offered to comp our food but it's not a big deal. The guy at the bar could be a little more friendly though, he didn't seem like he enjoyed working there.

2yAcM7ILrOMwCC3Wl6sfJg.text: I am just reviewing some of my. . well, reviews. . .and wanted to say this place is still my fav Las Vegas Chinese food.  It is just delicious and my mom and I still go there,  split the orange chicken and enjoy every bite.  Perfect amount for the two of us even though we often feel compelled to order more.

lz27qhS0tNXstNeILQt9Sw.text: Great service great people great food. I always come here for the same meal. Bbq pork, Chinese chicken salad, zechuan dumplings, & shrimp fried rice. If your looking for good Chinese food this is the #1 place to come. It's alil funny how they keep changing the restaurant inside.

peK7f3znBxIRKCwqYc90KQ.text: If you're ok with take-out quality Chinese food at Vegas casino prices, this place will do. If you want sushi, avoid it. The sushi was flavorless, rubbery, viciously overpriced. Their saki menu is limited to $40/bottle low end stuff and $16/bottle pink stuff. Not a Japanese restaurant. I've had supermarket sushi experiences that trump this by a mile.

OW8QuW30sjoovbKttBydfQ.text: Really good sushi happy hour and regular priced hand rolls. It was so easy to walk down stairs, order and take it back to the room while we got ready to go out. prices decent but they do need to update their on-line menu

rMGZUfwMaLv0izD3LLwGLw.text: I wish I would of found this place before my most recent trip to Vegas. I have been to New York New York many times and never even knew this place was here. It is kind of hidden. Let me start out by saying the food was fantastic and the service was just as good. The wife and I shared the Generals Chicken  and a Las Vegas Roll which were recommended by our waiter Jordan. The food was delicious and just the right amount. Jordan was very attentive and a pleasure to talk with during lunch. The highlight of our lunch was Jordan bringing the Wife and I a slice of cheesecake to share in honor of our anniversary we would celebrate the following day. The cheesecake was delicious and a pleasant surprise to say the least. Just want to thank Jordan again for the awesome service and we will be back for sure during our next trip to Sin City!  Peace!!!!

s8ysq8Zn7Ybci7a0LLdQVw.text: Very impressed with this Asian food available on the strip ! After a couple of nights of eating out my body was craving veggies done home style aka Chinese.  We had a plethora of dishes, all were extremely good and not too expensive.  Three people, one person had wine and the total was $80 with still some leftovers (which of course does you no good when you're in Vegas with hotel rooms with no frig or microwave.)  Service was really good, waitress was very thorough about letting us know the prep and cook times for dishes that took longer.  This place has been on the strip for a while and I can see why, it satisfies that Chinese food craving without a lot of pretention.

0RDv98ZQP2jyWl5XqM_lHQ.text: Jordan was fantastic and very friendly.  We came for the breakfast buffet.  Wonderful food.  The only reason I did not give 5 stars is they ran out of plates and bowls and we had to wait a bit for clean ones

lPBuefj6jsRas__XWTV2CA.text: My husband and I ate here after a show and really enjoyed our meal. I haven't had the buffet as the pictures show, but we really enjoyed the menu. There were lots of options for both meat lovers and vegetarians alike. The cocktail list was also amazing and we enjoyed trying a few new things. As Joanna K. said, the ginger martini was amazing!   As for the food itself, the prices were very reasonable ($10-15) and the portions were plenty big. I would certainly recommend to anyone wanting Chinese food that isn't greasy and won't kill your wallet!

IT6njdws5ETRBC89ze8GUw.text: Went in for lunch at chin chin. I ordered the pork wonton soup. It's so clean and refreshing. Simple ingredients chicken broth dumplings and spinach.  I also had the orange chicken.  Really good sauce not traditional and sweet it was tangy. The waitress penny was awesome. She was very attentive and actually recommended the dishes to me!  They were doing a fundraiser for saint baldricks for children cancer.  I won a free dim sum! Linda the manager was so friendly! Definately making this place a regular lunch spot!

qCkGPAipPJfU0HHW_MlHyQ.text: Great sushi! The sushi bar is open later than the restaurant which made this the perfect place to grab a late dinner after our show.   The service was excellent, which is pretty much expected on the strip.   If you're getting sushi, be sure to order the Philly roll - it was delicious!

mFed6-txKB4MKiScSu59qw.text: This place is overrated and overpriced. Came for a breakfast buffet. We were seated a few minutes past nine, so we didn't receive the 2-for-1 discount. Paid $23.95 per person. The food choices were very limited and there was no sushi. The waitress told us sushi would only be available for lunch buffet starting at noon. Cookies and cakes were too sweet for our taste. We left the place with empty stomach and great regrets.

tSXRnCouyfGc8eCottKzOQ.text: Koong is an awesome sushi chef! The sushi she makes are YUMMY! her friendly customer service as was very awesome as well! Thumbs up!

L2f7di9-A66MwDKZ77skgA.text: Staff was nice, didn't appreciate how they didn't give us the coupon like they did other guests. Mongolian beef was awesome. Sushi was so-so. Won't be going back here when we come to Vegas next year. Glad we tried it though.

9OMXR0TP-mEqfFZSL8qo3Q.text: Love this restaurant! It is on our "Must Visit" list! Wide variety of food, fresh, delicious!! Their lettuce wraps are delish!!

u0mqbUN7pkjt53xP9_ZjQw.text: They woulda gotten only one star if it wasn't for the locale.  Salty, greasy and overall pseudo Panda Express. Yes even panda is more authentic and that speaks volumes.  Service was slow and servers lack knowledge of food on their manual.   Yang chow fried rice was somewhat eatable.

nkHiW0714-7jprOOM16JBg.text: This place was amazing the service, the food and breakfast buffet  The buffet was small but worth it delicious food, better than any place in the hotel!! I highly recommend it ! With the breakfast buffet you get a free mimosa or Bloody Mary so good !

NU6-3S005IaowpLIqdqggw.text: My sister and I were in Las Vegas this past weekend and ate at Chin Chin in the NewYork, NewYork Casino.  We loved it!  I had sushi which was great!  I also have to give a shout out to an employee that was super nice! Thank You Kooney for the advice for tired sore legs and feet!

f60cDNRea3p5KcfPNIj5GA.text: I just can't remember the last place of business I have visited when absolutely everyone is friendly. Everyone at Chin Chin is just so pleasant.  Plenty of warm smiles, gentle conversation, and lots of attention.  Menu is reasonably prices with tasty selections.  Service was great.  Food temperature was perfect. Food was delicious. Our server was spectacular! I am coming back with my family. Chin Chin, see you soon!

C8z2PLQqVypi9thg1yhxHw.text: We had a sushi roll and the Dim Sum and then Sum with the slaw salad, fried rice, and Hunan chicken.  Both the roll and the combo were good.  Not incredible, but good.  What was not great was the pork belly.  This was mostly because it was not pork belly.  Trying to pass off a fatty piece of loin was pretty disappointing as everything else was good. Free refills on tea and soda and the service was fast and friendly.  But seriously, that "pork belly" was bad.  Bad enough that I only took two bites, one excitedly and the next one to make sure that yes in fact that was totally tasteless pork loin they were trying to pass off as pork belly.   Bad enough to only give Chin Chin 1 star.

NJsg9vja9_ugjKoaBUjMbg.text: This place sucks! Everything is soaking in sauce and whatever is suppose to be spicy is sweet. The peanut lo mein us awful!! Just like eating a jar of peanut butter!

o29KlT66GU7Yo4WPqtsIEw.text: Our last day in Vegas ended with a GREAT breakfast buffet here. We luckily saw the sign for it as we exited the yorker elevators after checking out of our room.   Glad we decided to eat there because the breakfast menu was excellent. From 2 types of eggs Benedict (salmon and crab) to different styles of potatoes and everything in between, this was a million times better than the crappy free brunch buffet at the Monte Carlo.  What made it even better was our waiter, Jordan. Not only did he take it upon himself to water down my son's lemonade for him (because it tends to be too sweet), he also took a few minutes to stop and chit chat with us. He gave us suggestions for things to do suitable for my 6 year old. So cute! :)  The manager even offered us to stay and try out their lunch menu (at no extra cost) because we arrived late for breakfast. I was pretty full from what I had already eaten, but did try a bit of their Chinese food lunch buffet. I tried the orange chicken, sweet and sour soup, and egg roll which was also yum yum yummy!   Great service + great food = 5 stars!

jCLawT0NxGS01JctHtpG0A.text: great customer service! waiters ben and dexter were very helpful when trying to make decisions about what to order for a large group party. also very helpful tips for ordering vegan. i had the pad thai style rice noodles with peanut sauce and tofu and it was delicious!

gyz1IcYjU81K7B9zC1iKGg.text: Celebrated Valentine's day lunch here. Food was delicious and the establishment wasn't really busy for a Saturday lunch which was surprising. My husband and I ordered sushi, the Red Dragon and the Lucky Seven along with a side dish of Sweet and Sour Shrimp. We also ordered Mochi Ice Cream which they decorated very cute in celebration of Valentine's day.  The only complaint was that we got our appetizer after our meal which was the Assorted Pleasures.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet and Sour Shrimp, delicious!
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Dragon Roll (on top) and Lucky Seven (bottom roll)
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mochi Ice cream

bmi6q2aqOzkRfa3AtlaGUg.text: Always a great dinner at Chin Chin. Food is great. Fresh. Tasty. Never disappoints. Oscar M gave us great service as well. Would highly recommend the Godzilla roll!  Not always on the menu but you can ask for it!!

PVZ9MFWDQqyWW78miXbCOA.text: Chin Chin is a small little sushi restaurant in New New York. It is, by far, the best sushi restaurant in Vegas. The staff is very personable and make you feel very welcome in their restaurant. It's like you're at a small town eatery and not a big city restaurant. If you come, ask for Cesar. The best server I've ever had!

6Mhon_pMSnj2bZBWYvM09w.text: I just had lunch here with 6 other friends on New Years Eve. The Yelp Check-In deal was perfect and very well accommodated. We essentially had 50% off our entire bill!  The food was tasty and varied. But most impressive and appreciated of all, the service was fantastic! Our party was constantly checked up on and the staff was extremely polite to us. Thank you very much!

-ElUh_eekNRnSEhjIJuPSQ.text: We had lunch here and it was delicious! The mooshu pork with lettuce was spot on. It was to our surprise that the head chef was only 21 years old!! This Asian/Chinese food was on par with the ones in LA. I will definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch buffet and good deal
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy cookies

8FraWeqHqZkWCBmw5TviLg.text: Such a great place to have a drink and hang out at the bar with their staff . Sat at the bar and had a few rolls made by an awesome chef name Koong . She knows her stuff I tell you at . She ask what I like or don't like and just made some of the best tasting rolls I've ever had . Next time I come back and visit I sure will be back her sushi again and again. They really do take care of their guest . Also l the bartender name Victoria was such a sweet heart. She serves the best cocktails .  Thank you chin chin for wonderful time !

QQvnTeybp6pSg14YBL6ttg.text: AMAZING! I came in for my birthday and was a bit reluctant at first but WOW I am so glad we came in. Food was great, customer service was excellent. Our server, Dexter, was very attentive and knew the menu and had great suggestions. Will definitely come again and refer to friends and family.

u2p3lvOJEyoxxokbtZq0Dw.text: First...the bad. One of the chairs was broken and when my wife sat down a piece fell off, the chair shifted and pinched her hand to the point of drawing blood.  Never a good start but it did go better after that.  The staff was sincerely mortified and got us the requisite bandaids and towlette.  So on with the meal ( a little blood is not gonna get between us and Sushi).  We ordered entirely from the sushi bar so I can't speak to the Asian fusion kitchen.  We ordered 4 different rolls and some Hamachi sashimi. The Hamachi was fresh and fileted into elegant ribbons.  It looked so beautiful I almost felt bad about eating it.  Until I took the first bite.  After that it could've been the Mona Lisa and and I would've scarfed it down frame and all. There was not a bad roll out of the 4.  The rice was spot on Sushi grade.  Crisp veggies and fresh fish.  The flavors were carefully balanced to keep the focus on the ingredients rather than bury them in sauces.   Service was outstanding ( but the whole bleeding thing kinda makes for attention afterwards). I don't normally do desserts  (just not my thing).  However, they brought us complementary cheesecake and chocolate cake by way of apology.  I don't tolerate sweets well and these were so rich and decadent I was only able to do a few bites.  Well, I may not like sweet and rich but for those who do I highly recommend both.  I'm quite sure the cake will be outlawed once the government finds out about it.  It is the opium of desserts. They do need to pay closer attention to the condition of their furniture.  They are aging and honestly we had a sense of humor about it but it could have been really not funny. Despite that we all enjoyed the meal tremendously and spent the next few hours in a Sushi induced coma.

sPsYv6n1V1GE25CGssVHBQ.text: Last night after the Journey and Def Leppard concert we stopped at Chin Chin for dinner the service was outstanding considering the high volume of people post the concert. Our waiter Dexter was on top of things very knowledgeable about the whole menu and drinks and recommended some items from the menu which were very delicious. (Chin Chin chicken salad, fried rice, vegetables, paradise roll etc...) all was great and we will be returning on our future visits to Las Vegas.

lnajlTkrmUjt6HoWkXmfhg.text: Love this place from Sunset Plaza in LA.  Not so much the Vegas location.  We stopped in after the U2 concert.  We should have walked to another restaurant.  Everything was over cooked and lifeless.  The waiter was great, but the food sucked.

AqxPvmRNMfZi-JWTSMSXQw.text: You can get better Chinese food by going to literally any other restaurant- it doesn't even have to be a Chinese restaurant.

LFNdU7hvXp51DidywWMU3A.text: The customer service is excellent food a bit pricey for a Chinese  and there foods is too salty

nmDzfL5SNKOpkZrXyfeuVQ.text: Not bad. Just a little bit pricey, like $25 ish for a Sushi roll. The Shumai and Asian signature salad were yummy and also came with a big portion.

Sv6tWI-G_CUls_YpzSUN1w.text: Ugh. My wife and I had been here for diner in 2015 and it was actually really good. Decided to come back for lunch this trip.   What a mistake!  Got talked into the lunch buffet. We should have checked it out first. Absolutely pitiful. Dishes had zero flavor and most were lukewarm at best. Selection was terrible. And most items were pretty close to empty the entire time. Keep in mind this was at noon!  Gave 2 stars due to fine service. Other than that stay away!!!

n6z9-rEbSE6EcP03muv2Xg.text: Our server, Latasha was kind, friendly and attentive. I gave 5 stars for the outstanding service but as for the food, I would say 3 stars. The hot & sour soup had too much starch in it and too much thick batter in the orange chicken.

TKnYJS1mM2f7UmuiZM-QZQ.text: Tastes just like home!  While roaming the Las Vegas Strip on our last day, we wanted to eat somewhere that was close to our comfort food. Being away from the island for about a week, you tend to miss food from there. In my case, my type of "local food" isn't a spam musubi or loco moco. I actually wanted to eat Asian food. Walking through New York New York after visiting the Hershey Store, I wanted to steer clear of the oily, fast food pizza and fried delicacies.   Thankfully, one of the Chin Chin host/hostess were outside holding up their menu. Can't miss them. They are strategically standing right in front of the "We're still open during construction" words on the wall. We perused the menu and when the hostess said they mainly serve Japanese, Chinese and Dim Sum I was sold.  We walked with her to the entrance to the restaurant and waited a few minutes for a table to get cleaned. Our waiter Rob was really punctual and energetic. He showed us where the beverages were and the libation menu too. We settled for non-alcoholic drinks. Yes, I know....BORING but we were catching a flight that night and I still needed to pack.   After contemplating the selections and reminding myself that my eyes were bigger than my stomach, we decided on the Szechuan Dumplings, Hot & Sour Soup, Pepper Steak, and Peanut Noodles. It wasn't long until our soup was sitting in front of us, waiting to be ladled up. This soup was delicious. Being of Asian descent, I feel like I'm a bit more particular on my "Asian" foods especially away from the motherland. The soup was the perfect amount of spicy and sour. It was very well balanced in flavor and we just wanted to drink it all up.   Next on deck came the Pepper Steak. Now this might not be the most praised review on the Pepper Steak because I'm not a fan of bell peppers. This steak was oh-so juicy and the spiciness of the steak was minimal. There was so much bell pepper flavor that it overpowered even the onions. This was definitely my husband's favorite of the four dishes ordered.  The Peanut Noodles and Szechuan Dumplings were delivered at the exact same time. Let's talk dumplings! If you've had dumplings at a dim sum place, they are not usually covered in the sauce. Well, these were not your usual dumplings. The size of the dumplings were the same but these things were smothered in a cilantro sauce. When taking the first bite into the dumpling, you definite taste the cilantro but you also taste something sweet. Very unusual for dim sum. These babies were the highlight for me. Because of its unique taste, it will be forever remembered.   The Peanut Noodles can be ordered with either chicken or shrimp but we felt like going plain jane with these. At first glance, the noodles glisten with the peanut sauce. Be careful of that first bite, it's thicker than it looks. If you want something filling, then order the peanut noodles. They will quickly fill you up but only order it if you love peanuts and or peanut butter. That is really what you are eating. These weren't that spicy. I think if you can stand a little heat, like a tease of heat then you should be ok.   It was great discovering this new restaurant on the strip. I can't wait to go back and see it after the construction/renovation. Be daring, be bold and try Chin Chin.
