xkn9g2fyOBTf2SkN-D6tQA.text: This place was awesome and our waiter was awesome, Pedro.  We ordered the orange chicken, Kung pao three treasures, chicken lo mein (awesome), beef chow fun (least fave of the entire order, flavor not so good), fish with ginger...all of it was pretty darn good.  Alcoholic drinks were yummy, had mojito and Lychee love drink.  We loved it here

9H4o5vhrOqQhk5wibumnzA.text: The food was expensive and they are not using a professional chef.  The fried rice was under cooked (like steamed rice) no flavor.  The Chow Mein had no flavor and was extremely salty.  I will not be returning again. The service was good though.

2iYsAOQgXGP2uhs2-K_RBg.text: Not sure why only 3.5 stars, but service and food were excellent! Peanut noodles and pineapple fried rice were on point, as was our server. Very pleasant surprise! I rate this a 5 Star experience based on price, quantity, quality, flavor, and service. Nice job Chin Chin!

RY7-aqMmrdgO5lwis686tQ.text: Awesome breakfast menu for $10.  Great ommlet and asian style bao breakfast dishes.  Comes w a huge bowl of fruit, all for $10.  This place deserves more stars!

dkCam8g5jyGLN9oi41pEbA.text: The food was great! Efren the sushi chef was also very nice and friendly. That being said, a bartender or server named Maegan was cold and frustrated with my party of 4 for simply no reason. I would understand if it was busy, or if she was the only one working but there is no reason to slam a checkbook down and roll your eyes at your customers.

xdKv6rpXF_kVtPa4HvRiMg.text: Best dumplings since I was in Beijing.   Food is always great.  They can adapt for restricted salt diet!!!!

BfGROf9nT-7O8lmtM6Fepw.text: Food was good and the hostess were nice, but the service was awful. Never saw our waitress more than 3 times and waited 45-55 mins for our food. Actually didn't even get to order till another 40 mins of wait and the bill took about 30 mins to arrive. Honestly,  the place was really not busy enough for the wait.  However , there were a great selections of vegan dishes ( for our friends )

eXtIbgXWhL40T-VQ2KuDEw.text: Fast & friendly service, gorgeous presentation & absolutely delicious! I got the yum yum scallop roll & my friend got the volcano roll, they were both very good so it's hard to pick a favorite. Would definitely eat here again the next time I visit Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum Yum Scallop roll was definitely yummy!

IjCrtXWHPiD7-1WpkxiL4g.text: VEGETARIAN'S NIGHTMARE!  I ordered fried rice, egg only! As I started chewing, I bit down on a fatty piece of chicken! I quickly spit it out! I wanted to vomit! The entire serving was made with chicken. A manager said she would replace it... out came the rice with scallions and NO EGG! I let them know AGAIN... fried rice, egg only! Out comes the rice AGAIN... rice only NO EGG! Are you kidding me?! In an effort to not waste anymore food, I said I would take it home and add my own egg. Then came my family's "to go" order (salad, dressing on the side). Of course, the salad was tossed with the dressing. I don't want soggy salads as I have a long drive home. Now comes the bill... They were charging me for every order of rice that was re-made! As I spoke to the manager about the extra charges and complained, all she offered was to remove the rice charge! Beyond disappointed, as I've been eating at Chin Chin restaurants for 20 years!

FPJGxJBhSuYez_7DERGj-Q.text: Celebrated my birthday here recently.  Food was delicious, server was great, everything we ordered came timely and fresh.  Our server, Oscar, was just amazing!  He new menu off the top of his head and recommended certain plates for us.  He did an excellent job with our table.  I even got a complimentary dessert to share with my family!  Very nice dinner!  We would definitely eat there again!!

6KoVnu2341cw1KcH9jG8yw.text: If you've never had Chinese food or sushi before then you may find this place acceptable. The spring roles are frozen and partially defrosted before being served. They are truly awful. The sushi you get from Safeway is higher quality. The only reasonable item was the bok choy with mushrooms because you only have to heat them up and serve them with a bit of sauce on top. Skip this place and save the money.

c0K65UMVdfhl0bWEJjlXSg.text: Very good service and decent selection of food! Limited on sushi options but still very tasty! All in all will recommend and its $20 for a buffet!

C2mjYr7ctKsKGZ16RW30wQ.text: Great customer service. Our 3 year old ate for free from the buffet. Manager Alex was very helpful and professional. Great food every time we come here. It's a must every Vegas trip. Great tradition!!!!!!

oVWCArHvqFFjgQDQgnFE0A.text: Dana was the best server. She makes a mean bloody Mary. We love you! You're our favorite!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary&#39;s!!

uzGn9JPEFnaCUTlnhsM-ww.text: Not impressed, nothing special.  Stopped in here for dinner after Cirque Du Sole since it looked like a nice place to sit down and eat, but this is one of those instances where you don't judge a book by it cover. The service was pretty bad i'm pretty sure our waiter forgot about us at one point. And as for the food, nothing special I actually would consider it below average Chinese food.  The verdict, don't bother unless its a last resort not worth your time!

Xc8e4spHx675x4FZTajfow.text: As always, the spicy tuna tartare with avocado on fried wontons was excellent.  I hate that I have to travel 1000 miles just to eat this.

hWAvMeQm_eTEZW5oMAByaA.text: This is the only buffet in NYNY.  It's only for breakfast and something of an odd combination.    For starters it was $30 for two, not bad for a Vegas buffet.  That is until you see the offerings.  Strange pairings of eggs so firm they were more sliced than scooped, with BBQ pork loin for breakfast?  There were unusual items like pot-stickers and egg -fu-yung on the breakfast buffet.    The strange and small assortment of items left us not wanting to return, and we didn't.  The 2 stars instead of 1 star was solely because the staff kept our cups full.

MEPDlGmjvzdzTel6yPVb1g.text: worst service, I have ever received, I realize your in a casino but food and service both was bad, which I guess is why they are always hiring

IM5mGclnT_t0O42hWojV0g.text: Excellent Food, Courteous Service. Ate at the breakfast buffet. Reasonably priced, well stocked buffet. Waiter was very courteous and attentive.

5kkMqiFYtoIMB50UMEHtcg.text: Went there for the breakfast buffet as I read that there was a Chinese twist to it. It's wrong, except for the Chinese fried rice and lychees in the fruit section. But the food was good. And the bar tender very friendly.

mkQtTBlaa1NCKfyAzYJZ-A.text: Great breakfast buffet, clean restaurant  and friendly staff . Our waiter Pedro was awesome this morning

U7vzg_VHiHgDVpQKeEZKnw.text: Some dishes better than others. The service was bad. Poor service! Our waiter thought it was more important to buss a table than to get our forks while our food was already at our table. Do you expect me to eat Meat with a spoon? Luckily the manager saved the day by bringing everything we asked for.

x9J-8mi2N1gsH7ledRn60g.text: Most vegetarian-friendly of all the restaurants in New York New York.   The edamame was fresh and the veggie spring rolls were delish, especially with the accompanying  apricot dipping sauce. I was thrilled to see that they could substitute tofu in place of the meat in any dish on the menu. I ended up with the vegetable fried rice + tofu. Definitely hit the spot.   Tip: The entree dishes don't come with rice - you'll have add it to your order. (My one order of veggie fried rice was more than enough for me and three others to share.)

sUoxbwrDJnkg4PZv9qI2aw.text: 5 stars is not enough, this person, lady who helped us at NYNY Chin Chin was phenomenon . She put us first with consistent unforgettable customer service. She was very entertaining and fun but yet professional. Her and her staff at NYNY  represent friendly and energetic staff who knows how to attract and retain loyal customers.  I will definitely tell my experience to my fans when I am on stage doing Stand Up. BTW, her name is Yanira Torres and she was wearing a red rose shirt. This type of employee makes a fine example of a contributor who will be a great asset to any company.  She surely stood out with distinctions in service, experience, and professionalism.

vnZvmBUVCD30A6bCdsxVsQ.text: The food is still good but the entire menu pricing is up at least 35% compare to my last visit a year ago! 1 order of rainbow sushi, 1 steak beef rice bowl, 1 Pepsi and 2 glass of wine(1 glass=1bottle@costco) the bill $68. I refer Todai instead!

NwrG5src1jJ5S9b7z0t_jg.text: We had a fantastic meal at the Chin Chin lunch buffet on our most recent trip to Vegas!  They have an incredible selection of the most popular Asian dishes, which is great for someone like me who can never quite decide what to order.  I was able to have a little of everything!  If you happen to be traveling with kids who aren't crazy about Asian food, they also have macaroni & cheese and chicken strips to keep the little ones happy while mom and dad feast on sushi (veggie rolls, Philly rolls and California rolls) and tons of Chinese favorites.  They have the stuff you crave as well as some really healthy choices if you've already put a little too much Vegas in your Vegas trip and you need some veggies.  On the opposite end of the spectrum, the dessert bar is incredible, too!  We will definitely be back!

gB2sQNoNSnlKll81IHxJQg.text: The food was excellent! We started off with the wonton stars (crab wontons) with a delicious Thai chili sweet sauce for dipping. Unlike most places, the wontons were packed with cream cheese! So good! For dinner I had the Tomato Garlic Chicken it was DELICIOUS! So flavorful with a lot of chicken, water chestnuts and green bell peppers. The others I was with ordered Kung Pao Chicken, California Rolls, and Lo Mein. Everything was excellent And our dishes came with a choice of brown, white or fried rice. The service on the other hand was slow as molasses.  Not to mention our waiter was just completely rude, I would say however I would come back for the food, but they need to do something with their staff!

tTwo7UvGtBUUDV0mkLbn7Q.text: I stayed at the new york new york and this thursday I had one of the best dining experiences.  I sat at the bar and was greeted by the sweetest most authentic person named Dana. She was courteous and kind and her service and conversation was just wonderful. Then if that wasnt enough I ordered sushi and it was wonderful. Naty's sushi creations and artwork were absolutely Beautiful. He made my tuna sushi look like a pepperoni pizza!!!! and the quality of the fish was fresh. Both of them had great smiles and personalities and I would def recommend dining there alone or with a group.   P.S. I had the pleasure of meeting Mr.Chin and was able to shake his hand and tell him what wonderful employees he has :-)

BniVXOnF0cYASDOkU3yE4g.text: This is a great Chinese restaurant in the New York - New York Hotel & Casino. My husband and I grabbed a quick dinner here before a show and it was a great choice.   The service was really friendly and incredibly fast. We ordered the chicken won tons with apricot dip, pineapple fried rice, and hot and sour soup. All were great.   I would definitely go back there!

1h3cHUu88KRWuudEtLm97A.text: One of my favorite restaurants. Really reasonable prices, fast service, fantastic specialty drinks. Great bloody Mary!  Haven't had anything bad here! I love the mushu chicken and orange chicken. It's typical high end chinese food, but pretty authentic, and not greasy.  Every time I bring people here they thank me.

dy6uH3LuaTjZ007x03N6ZQ.text: First impressions generally tell me what the future will hold ... with this restaurant, it's unremarkable.  I ordered the pineapple fried rice, which is mixed with cashews and shrimp.  The shrimp are tiny and the pineapple is small and few as well.  The whole meal was marginal at best.  There are so many other places to eat in this city.  Skip this place or try their sushi, and go somewhere else.   PS: Service was friendly and affable.

lLZlYmiAxloyXbYtHDP1YA.text: Great breakfast buffet options! The red velvet pancakes were oh so good!  Free mimosas! The sushi is fresh and plentiful. I appreciated the amount of seaweed salad I was given, which is delicious!

jnVGgJCgt-FlDRznZmfr0A.text: This was right underneath our hotel room and it was delicious!!! Way better than a lot of Chinese restaurants, and New York New York has some gross places. Or people that just don't care. So this was a great refresher!

dx-dnMZ6cPTqRNvirwvQUg.text: Service was good, group of four were seated immediately. Actual food itself was not really all that impressive. I'm a sushi "freak" quality of the fish seemed decent, the rolls themselves were just not the quality that I have become accustomed to having from my favorite spots in Denver. My girlfriend ordered the Mongolian beef, and in my opinion it wasn't bad but the steak was really thick, and was only served on the crispy white rice noodles, with nothing else.  Overall, maybe not bad for a pop-in type situation, but I'd personally probably find someplace else if you wanted a better experience.

UX5g_V6yIM-At_TKX46IYQ.text: This place is amazing! Great food great drinks and great service. The Manager Jason was awesome! I highly recommend this place!

m7w4RfsKM1SRUQ96dVC7xA.text: The food was decent but I loved the service. They have such friendly hosts, bartenders, and servers that are so attentive and very helpful. This was the first place we stopped and ate at after landing. Jordan was our server and she was fantastic!!!

-lFyM1u-Po7e0fac0U8z1A.text: Amazing service! Peanut noodles are my favorite, but that Yang Chow fried rice and those giant chunks of bbq pork. Can't finish all the food in one sitting but they are definitely worth taking home for later

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Singapore noodles, peanut noodles, and yang chow fried rice

TkxrFj6bC4Jq_J5YHA2lnw.text: The food was OK. It's not very good but not bad either. The best part of this place is the price. Pretty much every restaurant in Las Vegas are expensive so this is a cheap place with a lot of food in your plate.

zX8f5NS127mcJ_uQunMoNA.text: Chin chin is affordable, because They give you an insane amount of food. And it's super fresh and tasty. So many options and the staff is super helpful. Their Buffett 12:30-2:30 is a great option as well! Also highly recommend their dragonfruit mojito.

87_4BO5kWFkOgIS9xAxiBg.text: Very pedestrian and underwhelming.  Ripped seats, fortunes and plastic wrappers on floor. Food was okay at best.  If you are in Vegas because you are from the Midwest and not used to the lights of Sin City, you will be fooled into thinking that Chin Chin is worthy of your money.  Don't make that mistake.

f-kLjeMaGZVZaiYiqXkNGQ.text: Next time someone says to go to Chin Chin, I'm probably gonna have to say No No, unless I'm adamant on having something resembling Chinese food and am physically unable to go elsewhere.  I had eaten here for dinner a couple years ago and would have said it was A-OK.  You're looking for Chinese food on The Strip at a restaurant and it's not like there's lots to choose from. There's the chain PF Chang's (which is better than Chin Chin actually) at Planet Hollywood, and Pearl at MGM (which is a lot more expensive and you get less food), but not a whole lot else.   On my recent visit, I was trying for a lunch under $20 and it's possible here.  Many of the dishes are about $13, like the Chicken Chow Fun with Black Bean Sauce.  It was ok, I've experienced better, but it's not like I struggled to eat it. I'm a critic of noodles these days, so accepted them for what they were.  As for the har gow I ordered for $8.25 (you get 5 of them) it was the worst dim sum I've ever had.  I don't think I've used such terminology in a review before.  I know I was spoiled in SF Chinatown the other week, but this tasted nothing like dim sum.  I couldn't believe it, it was pretty terrible to the point it's hard to describe it.  It almost had a sweet taste to it, and not in a good way.  Major regret, I would've been better off just getting the noodles (and would have managed to get out for less than $20) but when I see dim sum on the menu it's hard to resist.  After having that, there's nothing I could do now but resist it.  I'd tape my mouth shut to prevent it from ever getting into my mouth again.

z6PvFroHVIhJZYWyh5DNUg.text: Great breakfast buffet!    Chin Chin's doesn't say on the website that they have a breakfast buffet.  But it was good.  The previous day we had gone to the breakfast buffet at MORE in the Luxor.  Chin Chin has the superior buffet when it comes to quality of food.  The selection was very good.  I would recommend this buffet.  The service was very good as well.  Jose was very busy but he kept us stocked up on coffee.

An87OGUaX762MpOysWOqfg.text: We had delicious experience at Chin Chin at NY, NY in Vegas. We were seated immediately after a very welcoming greeting by the hostess. We started with two very tasty drinks and then tackled an extensive menu. Rodrigo was our waiter and guided us on selections with thoughtful precision. His suggestions and guidance were spot on. He had a great laugh, very attentive and engaging. Our food - from appetizer to a scrumptious chocolate-maple cake were perfect. The velvet corn soup and tangerine chicken hit the spot. Servings are large and perfect for sharing. You can easily over-order. Prices were very reasonable.  Overall a delightful dinner.

WxzOo2HbUJRaaTrKW7twAg.text: The food was ok overall.   The potstickers were delicious. I do not eat pork and both fried rice dishes contained pork, so that was a turn off for me. My husband liked the lettuce wraps and California Rolls.  We dined on buy one get one free deal, so I was satisfied. This place is not worth $20 per plate.    The servers were friendly and the restaurant has a cool laud back vibe.

YeN4BSgjFaiDJW0Qh4tc_g.text: The coffee is terrible. It's like brown water, but the service is great. Pedro is the best server, very attentive and funny. The breakfast buffet has something for everyone. The chocolate covered strawberries and fresh whipped cream are delicious. They even include a make your own omelet in the price. I highly recommend.

a75HbyYDQ7vf8fCohtlE4g.text: Came here looking for a nice Chinese restaurant, and happened to choose this place in the sea of Chinese places on the Strip. Our first warning should have been that this Chinese restaurant carries Sushi....thinking it would still be good, but slightly un authentic, I took my family here.  i If you want unauthentic, overpriced, and cold chinese food, come to Chin Chin. I watched our entrees sit by the kitchen for about 15 minutes before finally being prepared and taken to us...they were needless to say, cold. Our bill was refunded, however the server insisted on having us pay for the drinks. The manager came over and let us leave...still being hungry we went to a fast food chinese place, better than this garbage at Chin Chin!

tNdcGhxhEbS79lR0IyooYw.text: If you're thinking about getting Asian food... Don't eat here! Seriously one of the worst Chinese food ever!!!!

ITFhWRNLTyotC25pX3TBlg.text: Vegans...dine elsewhere....they use chicken base in EVERYTHING.  CAN be made vegan upon request but ya gotta know what to ask for.   Non vegans: yummy!!!

ePQZ42fcggakX3af7nPWkA.text: What a difference a year makes. I've enjoyed this venue on many of my Vegas trips but it has changed drastically. They remodeled since my last visit and the space is now incredibly bright & loud/noisy. The brunch menu has changed with less selection only having signature omelets or build your own. Speaking of menus, they handed us menus that were filthy. We sat at the bar and the staff seemed disorganized. The omelet I ordered never arrived, when I asked about it they promptly brought something that I didn't order. I ended up just eating off the buffet. Their buffet has always been "OK" with typical breakfast items but felt their strength was the menu. I have always liked their $5 bloody mary's. The manager did comp one of our meals since mine never arrived and asked that we come back to give them another try. I don't think I will be back not just because of this meal, but the space is not as quaint & quiet as it once was.

CTq4Yat5n3-G6CQLkN-STQ.text: Awesome buffet with great service..!! Totally worth it if using the coupon on yelp (2 for 1). Food is descent even for this hardcore Chinco.. ! ;)

VBP4jH51658h4suYuvfSWw.text: Our food was amazing, but the service was even better! We came for the breakfast buffet and had an omelet prepared by the cook. Seriously. delicious.

OS2XNFQcXBAOwv3m8qS4Nw.text: Well waddaya know, a good breakfast, a good waiter, omelette was well cooked and the coffee cup was kept hot and full. I gave this waiter (no name tag) a good tip and yesterday's tip that should have been left at the South Beach Cafe (are you reading this South Beach Cafe) will probably re-visit during this trip...

Bwl4n9YHh_fFKH20BcjwNg.text: We wanted some good old fashioned Chinese food and we got fried rice and general Tso. We were pleased with our choice .

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant

t8aRiMKRlTg1xx20GVFSmw.text: Chin Chin Cafe is located at the New York New York Casino. The staff there are extremely friendly. I came here on two occasions. The first time I came here, I had the assorted rolls specials. The assorted rolls were cucumber, philly rolls, spicy tuna rolls, and crab roll. I could already tell by biting into the rolls that they were not fresh. However, my waiter was very efficient and attentive which made the eating experience pleasurable. Then, the next morning, I had their breakfast buffet which was also okay. The selection of their buffet was quite limited including the traditional fare of eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns. These items were okay. As for appearances, the breakfast was not too appetizing. Also, they had two choices of cereal but there was only actually one available. Also, they only had whole milk. Again, at least my waitress was quite friendly and attentive.

WXir6l7xwju-_n1-y8IaMg.text: Sushi was very tasty. Mongolian beef was cold and not flavorful. Hibiscus tea was great, as well as the silver sake.

7aPhcNwh0p5xMzRyqxJ_RA.text: Ate here 2 days in a row for breakfast.   The buffet was great,  plenty of selection.  The French Toast was delicious and eggs Benedict 3 ways. .what's not to like about that.   Would've been the same price as eating off the menu next door and I'm sure it's the same food.  Very clean and well kept.  The service was excellent.

0dEt3WUJWlh_eaLLoXne-g.text: Chin Chin in New York New York is a great restaurant! ! Excellent food, amazing service and our waiter Alex was truly an incredible example of what a great waiter should be!! And the manager was also amazing!

XYfcdURuLYvkTbbe9E28LA.text: In NYNY Casino. I ordered a dirty martini with the money brain (spicy tuna stuffed inside avocado "shell" with eel sauce on top) and salmon sashimi. The drink and food was pretty good. Not the best but good standard sushi. Service was fine and prices were fair. Casual setting. I would return if I happened to be in that casino and was in the mood for sushi but wouldn't seek out a visit to this restaurant specifically.

FI5pQr5_--__kW6h0chRCg.text: Went to Chin Chin for the first time and boy was I impressed! The breakfast buffet was excellent as was the server and manager. Our server Jordan was extremely attentive and was there before I even knew I needed something. He was talkative and very energetic which in the field of hospitality is a much needed asset. Linda was the manager and she visited the table and was very kind to myself and my girlfriend. Can't wait to come back next time.

Enbcx3wwkuQF0ovpv_lTjg.text: I am writing this review because of our great server, Sean.  He was informative, efficient, solicitous and funny.  The food was good and served promptly.  The rest of the staff we encountered was very nice, but Sean was outstanding!  Thank you for making our night so much better!

U3MRw2K30310j9JgYCJjjg.text: I was slightly underwhelmed by this place. I had mistakenly ordered their Monkey Brain, which turned out to be a hollowed out avocado stuffed with who-knows-what... When I informed the waitress that I anticipated an actual roll, she gladly provided me with the menu so I could make a selection of something I'd eat but neglected to remove the Monkey Brain from my receipt, which I did not eat any of. It would have been nice if she would have informed me that I was ordering something other than a roll, obviously not being from around Vegas.. SO that was $9 wasted.  On a positive note, my cup of hot and sour soup was pretty delicious and the second item that I ordered was the NY Roll.. It was okay - I was only able to eat half of it by the time I finally got it to the table.  Drink prices were insane, so we skipped on those.  Overall I feel like this place is way overpriced for mediocre food. It'd be a hard sell getting me back in here again.

UgrjltxXxNa4nka0dU2BVQ.text: This is just for the breakfast buffet and service.  They charged my 7 year full price.  Why would they not have a kid's price?  Service was awful.  The girl was somewhat nice, but was so artificial?  What is the word?  I don't even know.  Food was a 2 1/2 stars.  All the females there were so trashy.  Nice, but trashy.  Service was sooooo slow.  Didn't come by and when she did, it appeared to be a major chore for her.  Too bad.

sclHHwV5sJCRZWoBTRkA4w.text: You don't come to New York New York for the Chinese food.  But if you find yourself needing some, this is probably the best and only alternative within the hotel.  Located right in front of the New Yorker Tower is Chin Chin.  Now it can be a bit confusing to see the name then to also notice the sushi bar inside is kinda confusing... so you would think this place is fusion themed but it's not. Service was great!  Our waiter knew to match our vibe and he was spittin out jokes and was pretty entertaining.   Onto our dishes: Sweet & Sour Pork - Very good!  I actually found myself eating the veggies more than the pork which is unlike me.  The veggies were fresh and crispy!  Just the right amount of sauce and rice is oh so good! BBQ Pork - Always a favorite of mine.  This was juicy and tangy just how I like it. Tsao Chicken - This is always a crowd pleaser.  The tanginess and tartness of this dish just goes so well with any rice dish.  Probably my favorite dish of the bunch. Shrimp Fried Rice - Talk about an abundance of shrimp.  There was literally 2-3 shrimps in every spoonful!   So I give this place a solid 3 stars.  For the location and convenience, it's definitely something to consider.  The price for each dish ranges from $8 - $15 which is reasonable given you're in a Las Vegas hotel.  If the portions were only a tad larger, then this would've been 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gmMSatfFDWTHQEl6jQE6sQ.text: I came in with no expectations, and I ended up finding the food very good. Nice sized-portions as well.  We started with a large bowl of Hot and Sour soup, which was enough to feed four people. I found the taste above-average and very enjoyable.  We also had the pork steamed dumplings with sauce. This dish was pretty much like any steamed dumpling I've had (not bad). The garlic soy sauce was very good.  For my meal I had the peanut noodles without chicken. They were delicious! I've always like peanut flavors in Asian food, but this was the first dish I've tried that was centered around it. It's a simple-looking dish and the flavor just stands out. There was enough for me to save as leftovers.  I was impressed with the food here. I really didn't know what to expect at a Chinese-fusion restaurant on the strip, but it was delicious and I expect to go there again next time I'm in town.

QgPltvlo7ovlPRF8Ic6l5Q.text: Anita and Jordan are excellent waitstaff. Very attentive and helpful. LOVE the food too!

JHPq8TsiAmFbbZeI4U2M3A.text: Chin-Chin was our last choice for dinner and it wasnt that great.  I have had way better chinese and definitely better sushi.   If you can afford something else in NY, NY,  go elsewhere.

aSOtdvOY9xtwgEP1Vswv9A.text: Best Asian food I've had anywhere.  Very accommodating too and they have plum saki too.

vzrtBMamRz9RcI0T4SJgXw.text: The resturant was great! We got the sushi and Chinese food which was spectacular.. I'd recommend anyone come here if they want an upscale Chinese/Japanese dinner or lunch.

qq14tKDuJfKEu4uT9frlfA.text: ChinChin seems like a Chinese restaurant. However, mm....... This is not Chinese food, not even close, period!

u6c08myv15JyahaImxf9tQ.text: The food and service was great. We had Dexter as our waiter and he did a terrific job. The food portions was more than sufficient and the prices was very reasonable. highly recommended!!

N-azoCgygdiGteut499dcw.text: Chin and Chin is the best restaurant in Vegas that we've been to according to my Mom who has cooked Chinese food for over 70 years. This is an outstanding compliment that surprised me. Their service and pricing and Staff make it so relaxing. They have the best servers (Rodrigo,Whitney (Sp?), Cory, and Beatriz) are the best We've ever found. No were where have we been treated so well. We are not big eaters and only get one dish, which at some (Not all) Asian restaurants on the Strip would give us a bit of an attitude for ordering so little. Not so at Chin and Chin, they were all so welcome to us which is why we will come back and vote Chin and Chin as our only restaurant.

ozYEak7rqeZ2g1uqlBCaUg.text: Our waiter had a great personality and was very friendly. We ordered the Singapore noodles, kung pao chicken, dim sum and more and the chicken & ribs platter. It was enough food for all of us to share.

CqrQyrwrifcFgriv640jMw.text: I had a wonderful waiter. People were very nice. Enjoyed the food. Wasnt the best I tasted while in Vegas but it was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef lo mein

emOQ2sJlApN8zsFf8VJfLQ.text: Came here an hour before closing right after seeing Zumanity. It's a decent little place although i'd say the prices are definitely inflated especially when it comes to the appetizers (everything is about $20)  but it is the strip.   Ordered two apps, the salmon tartare (our waitress RAVED about it being the most delicious thing there) and the szehuan dumplings. The tartare came in a molded tower and the szehuan dumplings looked stuffed to the brim. While we loved the flavor of the dumplings the tartare on the other hand needs a lot of work. It literally tasted like a salmon dessert. There was scallions and avocado in the tartare but all we could taste was sugar. Never in my life did I think I'd eat a sweet tartare. Remember in the movie Elf where Will Ferrel pours syrup on the spaghetti? That's literally my experience with this tartare. Never again.   For our entrees, we ordered the peanut noodles (again raved by our waitress so now I was freaking out), the yang chow fried rice, and the kung pao three treasures. I thought the peanut noodles had a nice flavor and I appreciated the heat but nothing to write home about. I tried a one of the shrimps in the fried rice. It was BLAND, no flavor at all. The color of the rice was also very light. It needed some soy sauce. Lastly the kung pao had lots of flavor although there wasn't really any POW from the kung pao which i thought was a little weird.   If there's anything that I actually did like was our waitress. Reading the reviews here after eating here a lot of people complained about the service here but our waitress was sweet and very attentive. Besides the one bad recommendation, I would go again if she was our waitress (i'd steer clear away from the tartare though).

1ro_DZ9dNV0oXssvmJls4A.text: Whatever you do, don't.  Don't expect good service. Don't expect edible food. One of the worst meals I can recall. Didn't even eat half of it.

yvfAwAiMvl273RH-URLkAw.text: We were wrapping up at our hot slot machine, and craving noodles, and rising from the casino floor I saw the Chin Chin sign. we headed over and were greeted warmly by hostess, seating us at the bar.  I may have discovered the BEST food value on the Strip. We ordered the Dim Sum and Then Some set, pick 3 half orders for $23. I ordered the Szechuan dumplings (3), cold noodle main mein salad, and fried rice. It was so much food! The noodle salad was loaded with chicken, and the fried rice loaded with shrimp and bbq pork. This was a great midnight snack to wrap up a winning night.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Main mein salad, fried rice, dumplings

H4iH9BxtROED46JCIiUc8Q.text: We recently visited Las Vegas, and as usual, we stayed at New York New York.  We always eat at Chin Chin during our visit.  This trip we decided to go for lunch.  Arriving around 11:15AM, the bartender let us know there was a buffet that was transitioning from breakfast to lunch and we could get sushi and a bunch of other favorites as they removed the breakfast items.   We thank Mauricio, the bartender, for letting us know about the buffet as we had no idea that Chin Chin had anything other than the regular menu.  He was very attentive and friendly and added to a very nice lunch. The food was very good.  I was happy to see summer rolls on the buffet along with spring rolls.  I also ate very tasty orange chicken, beef with broccoli and lo mein noodles.  They had quite a few very appetizing desserts too.  The buffet included a non-alcoholic beverage.   We Love NYNY.  Kudos again to an outstanding employee - Mauricio!!

PjrbtNN-s86N98jP4_9OcQ.text: I had $60 in comps I needed to use before they expire and I love Asian food so why not this place.  Just like every restaurant on the strip, it's priced high but this was probably some of the best pork belly I had.    I always love gambling at NYNY since comped drinks are quick to come to you and Asian restaurants on this side of the strip can be difficult to find.  I decided to come here on for late lunch before I get started for a heavy night of drinking.  When I started ordering food of the menu and the waiter told me I ordered way too much food for 1 person and suggested the 3 for $26 meal. So I ordered the shumai, pork belly, and bbq ribs for the 3 dishes.  I also added the shezuan dumplings and mushroom with boychoy.  Shumai were very standard and overcooked. The ribs were big and fatty and has good chasu flavor to it.  The star of the meal was the pork belly.  The sauce looked dark and salty but it was not even that salty at all. The pork belly basically melted in my mouth and it was so tender and fatty.  The portion size was good and I couldn't believe that was a half order.  After I finished those dishes, I was still waiting on my other 2 dishes and the waiter could not believed I wanted more food.  The mushroom was very fresh tasting and has a good crunch to it. I thought the dumplings were just okay, cilantro on dumplings does not taste asian at all.  Overall, I would definitely go back for the tender fatty pork belly.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom with boychoy, shezuan dumplings
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shumai, pork belly and ribs

XGfLBrZWEp8kJ9tm12NYwQ.text: Great customer service!!! Good food.  General Tso's chicken is delicious. They gave me a free beer because they was out of the one I ordered. 5 stars

bpc0me2p8DY_mUiBHqCRfQ.text: Chin Chin was a place when you do not want to go to another vegas buffet.  What we hoped for is authentic Chinese/Sushi bar, but what we got is another Americanized Chinese place. We ordered quite a few items from here, because we went in a big group. And the big group is mix of vegetarians and non-vegetarians and that caused the mix up with the order. Every item was just OK, nothing stood out other than few.  Pork belly inside bun was great, Sliced BBG pork was great too, tofu chow Mein was decent. Other than that, nothing is impressive. One Item which I will order again, "if I go there again" is  KUNG PAO THREE TREASURES, Yumm.   Location is very convenient, its right in NY/NY and close to the strip entrance.   Downz: No restroom within the restaurant Not authentic Chinese, its American Chinese

Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chin Chin Menu

cDmk3IqrwIR80xEtdQEf2w.text: We were looking for a place to eat before the show and since we stayed in NY NY, it was easier to just eat in the hotel.   Chin Chin is an asian fusion restaurant with pretty big serving sizes. They station pretty girls outside of their restaurant to lure the men in (no joke) and it seems to work pretty well lol.  The food itself its alright. We ordered the beef Chow fun and mongolian beef. Definitely not your traditional chinese versions of these dishes you would find in a hole in the wall, but not bad for a casino chinese restaurant.  I'd say if you have a hankering for chinese and don't want to venture far if you're staying in NY NY, then Chin Chin is a good choice. Otherwise, venture further out to get your chinese fix. The prices aren't exactly cheap either..

gOX9CWU7dH-K4FZFMqS68Q.text: Really enjoyed our meal here. We were a big group so we ordered many plates (even one that was not on the menu - garlic noodles) and they were all yummy.

creA-iGXdPNPSlbnFXH5tg.text: The food was so bland. I felt like I was eating in a nursing home,  my dinner companion said maybe it's because it's located in Las Vegas they had to dumb down the flavor. The service was very good but they should have noticed with us ordering spices and dressings and sauces that we didn't enjoy the food since we left 2/3 of it behind refused take-home containers. $88 plus tip was a hard lesson to learn and I will not be back to the Las Vegas location definitely want to try the other locations just in case

Ekgw5xpsoKnfoCIyglG9QA.text: Hostess was inviting. Once in for take out, service sucked. Food for take out took way too long. Expensive. Food was decent. (Simple rice and noodles)

F-ICm-2TKcXsMzTjz8XVtQ.text: Outstanding service and food!  Michael (Mikey) is attentive and very knowledgeable of the menu. The Wor Wonton Soup is amazing (feeds 2)! Worth the trip to New York New York Hotel/Casino.

3fAdRNKzOyT7bj43GVuJ7g.text: Amazing service and amazing food!  Also had gluten free options, and my Sakitini was awesome!

AHzi71krZxhCIDjYPSD6gQ.text: Food was okay. A bit too salty.  The raised seating against the wall was extremely dirty. I have to sit on a napkin.

Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jTGFJCbWMTlckgrMc1-Hxg.text: Came across this place inside the New York-New York hotel and I must say this place was an excellent choice. The kids were happy as can be and they are not easy to please, plus they have complimentary ice cream for kids meals. We enjoyed the hot and sour soup, chicken chow fun, generals chicken, and white rice. The kids meals were lo-mein  noodles, vegetarian style and orange chicken, the portions are generous. Our server was Austin, he did an awesome job on serving us and recommending what was good and the differences between similar plates. 5 stars alone for him! Also the manager came by our table to ask how our meal was and she was just as nice. Great staff! Will definitely come back and try other dishes.

o4Jv5JsljCyjXmzDsYMeUQ.text: Was at NYNY for business trip, wanted Chinese and this was close with decent reviews...ordered carry out since I was by myself. Asked for recommendations for spicy dishes; was told General Tso's is good. Cost with rice came to $24. Seriously the food tasted just like Orange chicken from Panda Express! For that price I'd expect much better quality! Then you put the portion size into the picture.... I would not recommend this dish to anyone. Hopefully they have better options and I just had a bad choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. General Tso&#39;s to go, Wallet in picture for size reference.

wTT51O94mFRj5gXiOAwDPw.text: Chin chin was hands down amazing. Our last night in Vegas we decided to here. The food was oooo sooooo good. Our waiter was a cool guy from queens ny. Me a brooklyn girl. Guess he heard our New York Accents lol   He told us what some of his face on the menus where. But I knew exactly what I wanted. A cucumber avocado roll. And Chicken Fried wontons. They were the best I've had yet! Fried so crispy. With this delicious sweet and sour sauce on the side. Hands down my fav off the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X81e4kQ7BXtW25ly5cADKw.text: Ate here 3 times during our stay in New York New York hotel . Exceptional service , beautiful hostesses and food was outstanding . Breakfast Buffett was great ! Never actually had sushi as we were trying other things on the menu ! Open really late ! Food quality is excellent and price is good for the strip !

gx9JTmMlKwsAfQKhyQ5sbw.text: Wow, complete garbage. If you like Chinese food, don't go here. The menu is standard crappy Chinese food staples, sweet and sour pork and fried rice.   The food was not even decent, in fact I'd prefer Panda Express (and Panda sucks but at least it is priced as such). The entrees were goopy and overly sweet and sour when not appropriate. I ordered Kung Pao Chicken and thought, how could you screw this up! It was very tangy and sour as if they added far too much vinegar. The sauce was goopy and NOT tasty.   The worst part for me was the rice. It cost $3 extra if you want a side of white rice. It says it is steamed rice but it was more like yesterday's Uncle Ben's instant rice that was microwaved to reheat. All that, and I haven't even mentioned the price!  The price is expensive even for a casino when you consider the comparables. $18 entrees and $3 extra for rice? That's just NOT ok if the quality is complete garbage.  Overall, the only reason to go here is if you need to appreciate your local crappy Chinese place more, this place will make it look like a 5 star restaurant.

93BATc8ZqWIt-2YbrUpQLw.text: Walking down to get a bottle of wine and also sushi- my Riesling - which is a cheap bottle of wine- was overpriced - like everything else - the bottle was 40- this sushi was over 100 dollars- they do roll it up on front of you-like every other sushi restaurant I have been 2- there is no bathroom here- this place is kinda like an expensive food court- you pay 100 dollars for sushi- get up an it's left then left again  for the restroom - not sure if that's the directions - but keep walking through the smoke you will find it -

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firecracker-  shrimp lovers- shrimp tempura

saWIwbjmek6Yji6mLh-AIg.text: Best thing about Chin Chin - SERVICE BABY!  These people know the True meaning of it!  When you pass by the restaurant while walking through NYNY you will usually find the hostess at Chin Chin standing out in front with a big, welcoming smile!  We sat at the bar and chose the Deluxe Wanton Soup and Pork Potstickers.  Both were really good.  I had two glasses of a Malbec wine which was very tasty (the only Malbec on the menu - forgot the name).  We have eaten at Chin Chin both times being in Vegas!  They've gotta be doin something right to keep us coming back!

p20qbyOGakwnFkFPrn5gZg.text: Walked into Chin Chin in New York and was immediately greeted by friendly hostesses ready to seat us. Karina was our server and was friendly attentive and offered wonderful suggestions that made our mouth water. The omelette was truly one of the best I have had. Coffee was great and could not have been better. Make sure you stop here and ask for Karina!

ST6djyJdC9C3vAK0O3VKhg.text: I went to Chin Chin in New York New York hotel and Casino Las Vegas this evening and our service from water Oscar was incredible. He was very personable and polite. My boyfriend said "if I ever come back to Vegas it will be because of the great service we had here". I got the Vegas roll of course since I was in Vegas it seemed fitting and it did not disappoint. I was celebrating my birthday and Oscar and the rest of the wait staff brought me an amazing complimentary cheesecake. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary birthday cheesecake was amazing.

PxK_bqI6BsDhVlTQwMNCEA.text: We were in Las Vegas and I wanted sushi.  My husband's usual sushi spot was desolate so we decided to try some place new.  This spot was fantastic!  The food was amazing and the service was incredible.  I was able to enjoy delicious sushi while my husband had some Chinese food.  The simple pleasure appetizer is a must as it gives a sampling of a little of everything.  The Volcano sushi roll was dynamite.  Pedro was our server and he was impeccable.  When we gave him accolades on outstanding service he was so very modest saying that he couldn't do it alone and that the cooks, bartenders, and even hostess do it all together.  After being in the service industry for many years, I was truly impressed!  Looking forward to our next trip back so we can visit this establishment again!!!!  I give this 4 stars instead of 5 ONLY because if you are looking for an upscale dinner and atmosphere this isn't the place (extremely upscale as this is pretty casual). Other than that, I would highly recommend this place.

RBzgXYYAH33UU1DaifkHVQ.text: This is our first time here and the service was horrible. Never really saw the server, when he brought the food out without silverware or plates we had to ask. Then didn't bring all our food out. When we told him don't bring now as we were done with the rest of our food he just blew it off. Not sure we will return here. The worst part the food was good.

IqFNeVjMXNbC6874cbiC1g.text: I always like coming here in Vegas when I can. I love the food, but this time the wait sevice I received from Pedro P. , was exceptional!! I took my Mom to Vegas for her 60th birthday(best son ever, I know)....maybe I can win son of the year this year!!   Everything we ordered was really, really good, from the pork pot stickers to the young chow rice and the spicy honey shrimp. That last plate is very spicy, so be ready!  Pedro P. was there often and running around the place like a waiter who cares about his tables! When a waitress or waiter hustle like that, it shows extraordinary service and that's exactly what we got from Mr. Pedro P.! He even surprised my Mom with a birthday treat of cheesecake, berries and chocolate syrup!! He even sang a note or two from the happy birthday song to my mom by himself! Not much of a singer, but one hell of a waiter!!!  There was also a nice young manger lady with great energy and great service as well....didn't catch her name, sorry.  So if you want great food and even better service, this is the place to get BOTH!! If you're lucky enough to get Pedro P., then you'll be in great hands. He truly was one of the best waiters/waitress I've had in a long time....and I eat out a lot!  Thanks Pedro P!!...good looking out homie!

L9P7vaYDnR4pF8HzWi2g-A.text: I absolutely totally love this place they have the best dumplings you will ever have in your entire life I was with my girlfriend from Brooklyn and she ordered the spicy tuna roll with yellowtail and we got a whole bunch of different things I remember ordering a more traditional Chinese dish but I will tell you their steamed dumplings are absolutely incredible my mouth is watering right now just thinking about them and we had a waiter who coincidentally was from North Bergen New Jersey which is my hometown it was completely freaking me out.   If you are staying at New York New York this is a definite I also love the Chinchin in Los Angeles

DlHfqc_Y2LzMRbyxGpskoQ.text: From 7/8/15   We came here because it was in the hotel we were staying at, and I was in the mood for noodles.   We started off with an awesome server, who took our drinks order. We got a bottle of sake and perused the menu for what we wanted. About 6 mins later a guy appears and said he would be our server because her shift had ended.   I ordered the Pad Tai and was pretty disappointed- the flavors were to citrusy which is not what I am used to, it's generally a more savory or spicy kind of dish. The dish also lacked shrimp. However, there was an abundance of chicken which I could have done without.  When I explained to my server that I was not happy he seemed very nonchalant about it then told me if I wanted more shrimp it would be extra. I did not add more shrimp since I felt a bit turned off by his attitude.    When he came back and saw me taking the chicken off my plate, moving things around on the dish to try to make it better he offered to take the chicken away. I ended up giving my chicken to my boyfriend. I barely finished my Pad Tai; it was too intense for my palate.   Normally, I hate writing a review like this, but this was one of those situations where my server could have changed things around by rectifying the situation. Plus a better attitude could have gone a long way.   Maybe this isn't the norm for these guys as far as food and service, my boyfriend enjoyed his dish, but I don't think we will return. At least  I enjoyed the sake!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Tai
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fuji Apple Sake

MIsf7X4hoW6uwWvzSTmolw.text: Amazing Sushi!!!  Really enjoyed our meal. Staff is VERY FRIENDLY and knowledgeable. Sushi is very fresh and tasty.  Wish I could eat here everyday!!!!

prgD7FSKZiBBTI7x5sLwbA.text: It was a well welcomed find after being disappointed around the area for breakfast almost every morning.   For the price that SB's was charging for a large coffee and a bagel, you can go to Chin Chin and get a fantastic breakfast buffet.  If you make sure to grab a ticket, you can get one free bloody mary or mimosa when you get the buffet.     The breakfast selection did not disappoint.   Well, except for the fact that I wish I would have found it a few days earlier.    Fresh fruit, oatmeal, eggs, made to order omelet, baked goods galore, and then very nice helpings of sausage, bacon, and ham.    Bottomless coffee and juice... it was well worth it, after being treated to the normal craziness that Las Vegas had to offer by nickel and diming you everywhere you go.    I will be back next year!

1Cm-OZIsv26eRmv9S4rZLA.text: Food was awesome, fresh and lots of great selections. Scott was a great waiter, will be dining here every trip to Vegas! Don't forget to tip on the price of the meal before the discount!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SEYDXDLHrwNi-7LjYWmJxQ.text: Nice place for a moderately priced meal.  Shrimp spring rolls and peanut sauce were really good.  Sushi rolls are good.   They care a lot about guest perception and check on your satisfaction several times.  Update: chin chin gets another star for a quick response to my review.   They care!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Lovers Roll

dwSbw0uLnE1tAuuuyvT7tw.text: We went here for the breakfast buffet, which was really good.  They have design-your-own omelettes like you'd expect, but you order through your server - so you don't have to wait around in a line.  The meat lover's omelette was particularly good, and not overly gigantic so you can still try other stuff from the well-varied buffet.  We got here early enough for the early-bird-special, so it was a great deal and barely any line to get in.  The service was super friendly and just the right amount of attention.  So really everything I was looking for in a Vegas breakfast buffet!

zYTbI4Tbdz8NBdKw-nhM0w.text: We enjoyed coming here right after a Lakers game to eat. We ordered the shumai, the wonton stars, chow mein and the Mongolian beef. It was all very good. The two sauces that came with the shumai was a very spicy mustard and a chili paste sauce that we weren't the biggest fans of but you really didn't need the sauce anyways

VRKinrVoX7h2OYE2h5oGiQ.text: These guys rock 'n' roll diem sum please  try the mein mein salad, I have been going to Chin Chin's for over 15 years in Los Angeles, CA try them in the New York New York hotel & casino during your next  Las Vegas stop. They finally have a mein mein salad with peanut sauce and shrimp toast apps which are way  fabulous as they have always been in studio city location ! 13.00 on salad is monster salad and super cheap great for 2 to split!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8fp5jlcWknnpp4RlR9RANA.text: Worst Resturant! I showed up and they said kitchen is closed in 10 mins but sushi still open. Ok I took sushi and ten mins later ready to order the most sushi I ordered is warm one and they say their oven is broken! What kind Resturant running business with broken oven!

sV43zQ9j0iJvCuawPQVtuQ.text: The food was good and the manager Ester was very nice. We ordered Mongolian beef, chicken fried rice and Szechuan green beans. The Mongolia was very good and the fried rice was good but slightly to greasy and the green beans were good as well. We also ordered the chicken pot stickers which were ok but the apricot sauce made it delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian beef, chicken fried rice and Szechuan green beans.

FyEXItnWGHpqZlxCS23ivA.text: So bad service in my life.  The plate was so dirty. We asked to change, but came same one, so we asked again. Also, we was waiting 30min just for white rice.

YZPywitlKxb-eyj43-Lavw.text: Went to dinner here. Saw the reviews and gave it a shot. Food was delicious. We ordered California rolls, pork fried rice and or orange chicken. It was good. Service was good and food came out quick. Asahi beer on draft was not cold enough but overall the food and service was great.

l5atfOJj36Sxn3D-1-u8jA.text: Great selection of food for the lunch buffet. Staff is really nice and makes sure all the customers' needs are met.

oGZb5fgtqlGKYmE1d4zXow.text: This place has excellent Chinese food & the buffet breakfast is as good as it gets. The breakfast is awesome. You have to have the mini potato pancakes, and eat as much of the bacon as possible. It's cheaper then Starbucks. I get 2 venti ice coffees & 2 breakfast sandwiches as sometimes I can't eat lunch at the trade show. Breakfast at Chin Chin is about $20.50. Starbucks is $26. The dinner menu covers all of Asia. Sushi to general chow chicken which is excellent by the way. Ask to sit in Kyle's area as she is an excellent waitress.

-j8SCN5zBwvJvjUQOu7P1g.text: Came here everyday while visiting for my 21st birthday  and loved it everytime. So thrilled to have come back four years later for my 25th and everything about this place is still better than ever. Great service, the sushi chef even recommended a pho place in Chinatown to help aid my cold, which ended up being awesome!(Pho Kim Long) Thank you to the team at Chin Chin for being a reliable & enjoyable place to visit every time in Vegas. Looking forward to visits in the future.

-61jJ6epJTNSC34Ox_JGVw.text: Bad customer service.  Server forget my napkin, he didn't come back to even ask me how's my food. I have to asked the hostess for my check.   Not coming bank and won't recommend to my friends.

Gd7eVqjc6wAAqK22ua0Ksw.text: Come to this Breakfast Buffet in NYNY.  One of my favorites in all LV.  Omelets made to order, but given to your waiter and brought to you. Thank you Cesar, our great waiter. No need to stand in line and wait.  Eggs Benedict made three ways, traditional, salmon, crab cake. Fruit was incredibly fresh. Over 50 items and just great.

FGqQjYHM02sIz8iNjE125w.text: Very efficient and friendly staff. Great value for money! A selection of fresh food and salad and great for somewhere if you're trying to be healthy. We got the buffet but it's not tacky and restaurant is very nice inside. I would definitely recommend it!

6D5zYXWJm6XsVt-OF9l5yw.text: One of the, if not, best sushi I have ever tried.  We shared the shrimp tampuri roll, red dragon and caterpillar.  All were fantastic.  A great place to try a good variety.  The service was good and the food was overall excellent.

nZedY0rlvBzTuT1BKMBZ1Q.text: Only had the breakfast buffet here. We visited 3x during our stay at NyNy. The price was very reasonable for all that they offered. The servers were excellent as well. One morning, we had cesar as our waiter and he went above and beyond. He deserves a kudos! Will definitely be back when we return to vegas.

5C47yW_NCH_He6z3vFbmxQ.text: After 10 years of being loyal to this Las Vegas restaurant, I think I am breaking up with it. The hot and sour soup that I dream about wasn't "fresh" any more. It tasted like Prefab gelatinous boringness. The sweet and sour shrimp were so over battered and not stir fried with the vegetables. Came out super dry with cold veg and sauce on the side. So different than every other meal we have had. The new format is not working, and I won't be back.

yXqg9I3EOlfQ4HUNTNI5VQ.text: I loathe you, Chin Chin. I loathe that you were the closest breakfast option to my hotel room on a work trip to Vegas. I loathe that I ate at the horrendous breakfast buffet for 4 days straight.   I hate that it takes forever to get a check considering that everyone orders everything they can possibly order within 30 seconds of being seated. I've ordered coffee and your 16 dollar plates of dry eggs, fatty bbq pork and undercooked fried rice, what the hell else can you possibly charge me for? Just bring the check and get rid of the pretense that I'm somehow sitting down for a real meal in an actual restaurant.   Oh yeah, and about the breakfast buffet fried rice? I'm onto you. Fried rice is traditionally made with cold day old rice that's had a chance to let the starch set up so it doesn't turn to mush when fried. You're trying to get around this by undercooking fresh rice, but it doesn't work. It just comes out a little crunchy and unpleasant in the center. I couldn't tell if the lump in my throat was barely edible fried rice, or tears welling up because I was forced to eat here again after working until 2am the previous night.  After trying the other breakfast options I ended up getting this bacon fried rice for 4 days. That says all I need to say about the other breakfast options.   If, for whatever reason you end up here for breakfast just pile a bunch of scrambled eggs on your plate, cover liberally with ketchup and call it a meal. It's really the only sane way out.  Fortunately I expensed the eightygodddamnedollars I spent here or I'd be really pissed. Oh, and the fruit is sour.

MQ9lwg-0khrxJRusqTCQ7g.text: The food was good and the service was excellent! Also the yelp deal is a real bargain! We paid $85 for 7 people AYCE buffet for lunch with the deal. Super nice staff and very accommodating!

h5aABGf0ilqWjHVShx3s7w.text: Just checked in to NY NY for SEMA 2015, and first bar stop is Chin Chin! Matt and Koong are the BEST  bartenders ever!!!  Everyone needs to have a drink at Chin Chin!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ALoXXwdrxgLLz0LBzDCwgQ.text: Hubby and I went to chin chin and it was incredible! We had fantastic sushi rolls and some outstanding cocktails. I drank a dragon fruit mojito that was delicious. Our server was named Dawn. Dawn was outgoing, personable and she was always smiling. She really made the experience 5 stars. This place is great. We will be back

UJ7-9mk7YV8-Lp-g4AJA-g.text: I wasn't sure about this place but it was agreed upon by the group for a convenient place to grab a quick bit after we saw Zumanity.  The sushi rolls were pretty good, but my mushu was way too salty and wet!  what cook doesn't drain the filling before wrapping it?!  It was sitting in so much sauce I had to eat it with my fork.  Just imagine eating your burrito that way because it was swimming in sauce!  Too bad.  Our server was awesome tho, man I can't remember his name!  But he was a cutie and gave us very good service.  The only reason I didn't send my food back!

-IAraOB7GC63GL0OrCXGWQ.text: Best Chinese food and service I have ever had.  The staff made us feel special and were spot on with their service.  The food was amazing.  We shared the chicken fried rice, peppered steak and dumplings.  Highly recommend these dishes and sharing.  They give you large portions.

LxN4h83SJpryEc_isL530w.text: Just great   Try Anthony's Noodles and Chinese Chicken Salad.  But here's a secret - order 1/2 order chicken salad -- It's plenty!

9xfCiXGgTn2uHC9yO4nHCw.text: Worst food and service ever! If I'm paying between 17 to 18 dollars an entree plus pay an additional fee for rice, it better serve it's price. Took a really long time to get our food. Asked for water and no water served. Ice cream was not served when it's part of my children's meal. My food was also cold. 73 bucks later, Huge Disappointment!!! I do not recommend this place nor will I ever enter this place again. If I can give a no star, totally would.

iqS5n0VxXN4Cti1jZZ6TyQ.text: We hadn't been back here in many years due to a bad experience.  But we were so glad to give them another try!  Absolutely the best Asian food on the strip.  Can't wait to get back!!

Fu1qoy2E60FYFBjP3Z8_Ow.text: Must say that the service we had tonight was one of the best we've had in awhile. Our waiter CORY was awesome. Top notch service. Was very polite. Provided all that we needed and was on top of everything. He should definitely be looked upon as what waiters should base their service on.

eqjsOnd20K6pHP2iEmdCHw.text: Maybe NYE was just a bad day for this restaurant.   They were quite busy, but I don't think the food would have been much better on a different day.  We ordered seaweed salad and the pork bun appetizer.  The seaweed salad was probably the best part of the meal.  We also ordered a Salmon Lover sushi roll and a Wor Wonton Soup.  The waitress brought the wrong sushi roll to the table and the replacement took longer than we had waited for the first one.  The Wor Wonton Soup was just ok.  I've had instant noodles that I would choose over this item on the menu though.  We were told and and were ok with the fact that the pork buns would take 15 minutes to prepare.   When they arrived at the table, the bread was soggy on the outside and undercooked on the inside.   At first I thought they did some fusion thing and added cheese in the filling but it was just uncooked dough.  I have not tried the breakfast buffet but would be willing to give it a shot the next visit.

iBbq6XC3ibm1q2uetLabVg.text: Ahhhh I love this place!!! I ate here 3 days in a row! The Sushi is amazing here. It's right by the elevators that go to my room so it's perfect.

h3kX1QZ7NmhCf2g6eioZUg.text: Oscar was great and the entire staff worked as a team. Great food had the wot wonton soup and the crab with asparagus fried rice, both were excellent.

8FjpK_QZhuNyzXQy2pTncg.text: I tried three different dishes and couldn't finish any of them. You can find much better food at panda express. Pathetic.

cclksv5Ni4wOxIOugMCJYQ.text: Great breakfast buffet. ....tons of variety and good eats. ...our server jordan was very friendly and attentive.    Major recommendation for breakfast!

HglbPKSBHQMepiZb2F1BSQ.text: I was in here for dinner while on vacation.  Having stayed at NY NY at least two times a year for the last 15 years, I know the restaurant well.  For a Friday night, I was amazed how empty this place was.  I agree with many of the posts here that Chin Chin has "lost its way" over the years. The menu is insanely large.  I had the crab cakes as an appetizer and had a sweet and sour chicken along with a large plate of fried rice.  My guest had a chopped chicken salad.  While the food was O.K., it just wasn't worth the final tab (including two cocktails) that was over $78.00.  For that kind of price there are simply better options while in Vegas.

RowO5Mo7TwGmmuOnZsw4OA.text: We showed up hungover as a cliff with one thing in mind. Eggs Benedict. We were told that the breakfast was until 12 noon but as we arrived at 1135, they were already transitioning to lunch. Bummed. However, our server, Jordan, and the manager, Linda sensed our disappointment and despair that no benedicts were available and made it right for us by having the chefs prepare 6 of some of the most delicious and satisfying bennies I have eaten in a long time. The smoked salmon and crab cakes were fantastic!  Very content.

MB4U35ufP79VZfnv4A36hA.text: Had a fantastic lunch today. Even though the buffet was closing they brought food out to our table. Penny and Linda were fantastic and very helpful.

wDIp8R75FIqYWf5S_dSDow.text: They offer sushi at this location, but I would not recommend it. The Chinese chicken salad is amazing, but I was not impressed with the hand rolls.  Service was ok.

YOPeVO0XrUAC0KwM-ZUQfg.text: Good service from our server pedro. Wide variety of food. Red velvet pancakes was new to us.  Very good enthusiastic environment. Bloody Mary's were tasty and it's free with your breakfast buffet if you sit at the bar. Price wasn't to bad considering everything you get in the buffet. We will definitely come back next time we're in vegas.

uCFySxI_mYlcAiCHqSsPRw.text: We were searching for a breakfast buffet and found a hidden gem.  Chin Chin, in New York hotel and casino in Las Vegas, is a quaint little place tucked away in a back corner.  We were greeted immediately by the hostess and she was able to accommadate our special seating needs.  Our server, Pedro, was excellent.  He came right over to our table after we were seated to take our drink orders.   He saw to our every need from drinks to special requests like items on the buffet.  I especially liked the potato pancakes.  My friend, Karen, said the sausage gravy and biscuits are better than Cracker Barrel.   We will definately dine there again while we're in Vegas!!!  I highly recommend Chin Chin.

NmIaDtqp_lPxmd-Mg5Tx0A.text: Had dinner here back in February during our stay in Vegas. We came here as we wanted to have a quick dinner before heading to Luxor to see Criss Angel.   We weren't sure about this place as we always passed it when we were heading to our room and were continuously asked if we wanted to look at a menu - it always looked more on the empty side and it seemed as though they were looking for business. We were craving Sushi though so we decided to give it a try and it was actually very good!  We had the shrimp tempura roll, philly roll and singapore noodles which was more than enough food for the two of us. Everything was great except I found the singapore noodles a bit more spicy than I was expecting but my boyfriend really enjoyed them. Service was very good and quick!

tKYBjAzvWcYtdZC_n8Izzg.text: Wonderful service and amazing food!!! Our server Jordan was fantastic attentive and friendly :)

Ua4i3sYW3abDcIAZxBN5HA.text: Went here for dinner and drinks one night while on vacation ... amazing !!!  I am a super picky eater and i don't have a single complaint.   Sat at the bar and the bartender Dana is the best.  Makes great drinks (and recommends good food) ... she has a great personality ... outstanding customer service all around !!!  I wish there were more people in the service industry like this !!!  I actually have to say that we liked it so much that we went back for a second meal before we left to come home because there isn't a Chin Chin in Seattle !!!

9rNMpuknBLJafDBLYBOF7w.text: This place is bad. Breakfast is very similar to what you would get at a Mexican Resort, except much less.  The food quality is fine except it is limited to a few items. The service is awful.

nOFkhxvqsGunKltoeT1OOQ.text: First time having the breakfast buffet and was extremely pleased!! Great food, excellent service and priced well!!! Very much suggested for everyone to try at least once! Definitely eating here again!

KLrrDq3XdAzNpMsl2Xv-Ow.text: Chin Chin has redeemed itself in my book.  After a disappointing visit a few months ago, we gave it another chance and were treated to a tasty dinner and great service.  Rodrigo was a very attentive and friendly waiter. The Chinese Chicken Salad (which has kept me coming back to various Chin Chin locations over the years) was as great as it always has been. My husband enjoyed the Dim Sum and a bowl of Sushi rice. I highly recommend giving Chin Chin a try if you are in the mood for Chinese food and a fun atmosphere.

QcVBc4zUWpMEWP4denjukQ.text: Very DISAPPOINTED! Went with my wife a two kids. Lettuce wraps were delicious. After that all down hill. Orange chicken was good. Noodles, fried rice and Mongolian beef was cold. Not warm. COLD! The server was working multiple stations and could not provide adequate service. This was a Wednesday night with no crowd. Manager came by and after I expressed my disappointment she took $7.00 fried rice off the check and offered a free desert. Check came $106.00 but no desert. So exasperate we left and did not even wait for my daughters free ice cream. Only reason I gave one star is they can't go any lower. Lost my business for a lifetime. Not one aspect of our visit was enough to ever go back. If your in Vegas there are many other Chinese restaurants that have to be better in every aspect. Not only thumbs down but a whole hand, arm and entire body DOWN.

b0YL1LQHL05ILb7AoxE5YA.text: Im a sushi nut. This was just mediocre. Service was good.  Food was fair but overpriced. Highly recommend looking elsewhere for the money

yQVdCnQz-tyjEtasjhiSqg.text: I am absolutely obsessed with this place. I ate here on my first trip to Vegas a few years ago and got hooked right away. I've been making this a vegas tradition ever since.  Their spicy cilantro lo mein is ridic. It's a fusion of asian and peruvian - althought it doesn't advertise itself that way. But having grown up on peruvian food I recognize the ingredients they're borrowing.  They also have some over-sized beer bottles that will make people do a double take when they see you walking around the casino with it.  I'm a fan. And since I took my wife there this year, I think she's one now, too.

IbUg-Sa7xMrmEKVBXQWWmQ.text: Had their breakfast buffet. It was a mix of standard American and Asian breakfast. Good was good and the service was excellent. Our waitress was awesome. Wish I could remember her name. The price was fair for the strip.

WBOdckdhUEzmEQp4jyyg8g.text: I must say that I'm not a big fan of eating in a casino when in Vegas but tonight I went to Chin Chin inside ny/ny and it was great. I had the Mongolian beef which was delicious. My server was Beatriz and she exemplified quality service; she was the best! Also, the manager Mike was great. He stopped by several times during the meal and really was interested in how the dining experience was. He went above and beyond and is truly an example for his staff to follow. Great dining experience with excellent food and service. I highly recommend Chin Chin if you want great Chinese food on the strip while visiting Vegas.

7iJ399CYH2NEwPNrnjYo2w.text: These people really know how to make you feel welcome. The breakfast is amazing and the restaurant in itself is very classy. The Dinner was absolutely fabulous. I had a great time at the New York New York, and the Chin Chin had a lot to do with it.

isgx5F3xOLZ-fk0ulg14Gg.text: Service was fantastic.  Our waitress was extremely busy running the bar as well as waiting on our table and she never missed a beat. Pretty talented. Unfortunately the food a Chin Chin is below average for the price you pay.  I understand it's Vegas, but value of product against its price want the best. We had the won ton stars as an app, I had the spicy seafood noodles and the wife had Orange Chicken (which that is what she eats at every Chinese restaurant). The spicy seafood noodles was to contain shrimp, calamari, and scallops in the noodles.  There was not one shrimp in the noodles. For $18 probably better not skimp on the shrimp.  The orange chicken that my wife had was $17 plus $3 for white rice and she said it truly was average.  By the time the damage was done it was a sub par $65 meal.  I'd suggest saving a couple bucks and head to Panda Express. Atmosphere was great though and service was great. Food was not the star of the show.

ZoPLSVTzmVTBLFM60tjEhg.text: During our weekend rendezvous here in Vegas, New York New York was the hotel we were staying at. We actually had a breakfast buffet here. For only $14 for each person from 7-1pm, that wasn't bad at all. The food was very good. I actually liked their triangular hash browns-reminded me of the ones that were given when I was back in  grade school. The wait wasn't long at all-we were sat in one minute after arriving. It was a very peaceful time we had here. The staff were very courteous and always refilling our drinks for us. I have yet to try their lunch menu, but for my next trip here,I will be sure to.......

KzMOc1HONJjRZGtEtDJBbQ.text: We went with a group of 14 people. Nothing but friendliness. Imagine a restaurant in America where the waitress brings everyone water along with other drinks - thats pretty cool.   Velvet soup was recommended to us by friends and was great order a bowl and share with atleast 6 people. The Anthony's noodles and General Tso's chicken was superb.  menu prizes are very very reasonable - Don't miss this place

nknMUhpTGxT8i6j2Actg1A.text: I had a horrible sushi dinner a few nights back while staying in Vegas so I was bound and determined to get my ahi tuna fix before heading home in a few short hours. We walked by Chin Chin a few times and circled back and walked into a little slice of heaven.   The hostess warmly greeted us and sat us quickly. Our waitress came right over and I promptly ordered a Bloody Mary. It was really good. I perked right up.   The menu was extensive on the Chinese fusion food side, smaller on the sushi side.  But there, in the middle of the specials section were the words I was looking for - Spicy Ahi Tuna tartare on won tons topped with avocado! Yes!   I immediately took a picture of my plate when it arrived, it was gorgeous and contained a huge portion of tuna. So much so that I had to save one piece for later. The tuna melted in my mouth and was the right amount of spicy paired with the crunch of the wonton, it totally won me over.  Now I'm sad I have to wait to return to Vegas for more. The side of cucumber salad was super good too, the vinegar dressing was perfect.   The waitress was great, the decor nice, the space was quiet for a Sat afternoon and the price totally worth every inexpensive penny. Found the needle in the Vegas haystack!

CimEZA0T8W4H9vTBxlR5Aw.text: YUMM! YUMM! YUMM! The best lunch buffet, lots of choices and dessert too- great for the price. Our server Penny was delightful.

YlkQJHHwUkvXrepZc3mgnQ.text: This is a must in Vegas!!!! We have been coming here for years and always had great service but Cory is the man! His service was amazing and they were super busy yet he stayed calm. He checked on us periodically to see if everything was good and needed anything else. Also my fiance got a sushi roll and he let us know we could deep fry ANY of their rolls! Nobody ever told us that in the past.  We ordered our favorites the Mongolian beef and sweet and sour chicken for dinner.  It was amazing and generous portions too.  I always sub out the Crissy noodles for lo mein noodles it is out of this world!!!  Maria the manager came over to the table and checked on us too. She was very nice and made her rounds to everyone!! Also my fiance spotted her carrying out food to tables a few times too. They remembered us from the night before too!!  Don't let the 3 stars fool you! This place is delicious!!!!

6uGcHZnnC_65heWHALxLsg.text: We had the Peanut Noodles which are spicey, but not enough to stop eating them!!! Yummy. Peanut flavor explodes with the very first bite and is delicious. We ordered a heat offset with Moo goo gai pan which had freshest celery ever eaten.we would go back again in a heart beat!!

3_iEFMCYA-ZCAnm9Xgzpgg.text: Great breakfast buffet just 13$ with a drink. Huge variety eggs pastries meats. Must try it's a great deal!

hDrPe3o1pu0E4dBGM5jkiA.text: The worst wait staff I have experienced in a long time. Felt compelled to write a review. Need new management!  Hurry!  Not worth visiting. A shame - my experience with this chain had been good...

hpmOi2UKqjBoCoj_VG5KsQ.text: This place is awesome, the food is very fresh and good compare to what you pay for! It worth the try and the serves rock ! Andres did an amazing job to take care of our loud family

fRQcQ3jLZ7Q7CMltXv7NFg.text: Service was great, food was delicious.  Spring rolls to start followed by Mongolian beef, chicken and broccoli, peanut noodles and pepper steak.  Everything was great and we appreciated the fast service.

gOFGbzyXQXz22BGnhocDNg.text: After being in Vegas for two days, I kind of wished I would have know about this place a little sooner. The food is awesome and the desserts are off the chain! Great place for a reasonable price.  Thanks to our waiter Jordan he was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert was great!

f525yb4gh9R-LWMaoPVBbA.text: My family and I greatly enjoyed the breakfast buffet.  Amazing cooked to order omelet. Our server,  Jordan,  was very friendly and attentive.

gPRrKbla6LxL-Xb5mw3_qQ.text: I've stayed twice at NYNY and I went once with my hubby and sister in law and it was NOT authentic CHINESE food but watered down American style...  I mean hello have you guys ever heard of GINGER or GARLIC?!?!?  I went again with my parents this past Feb and my mom was craving rice ( go figure :p) and I took em there.     * EGGPLANT Hot and spicy blend of Japanese eggplant, purple onions, scallions and garlic.  - The eggplant was pretty good, it had much flavor and I think they actually put garlic in this one..  .. TEMPURA SHRIMP / shrimp tempura / avocado / cucumber / burdock / radish /  =  The sushi roll was delish.  In Canada, this is called Dynamite Roll but is the US Dynamite is always something different in every place I have been to.  Rice was nice and fresh, shrimp was a decent size piece and veggies were fresh. Nice sauce on it as well.   SHRIMP WITH SWEET AND SOUR SAUCE - Plump deep fried shrimp, red bell peppers, onions and pineapple chunks with sweet and sour sauce. This was normal and typical.. the sauce was bleh... just sour lol

UNWSSnvdHRArKpMygCiFPg.text: Great food, wonderful service, and thank you to the hostess named princess that recommended the restaurant to us!

0paPdSAvOr-4J2gmgZNXyg.text: We had a very good meal. Service was excellent. Orange chicken was chicken breast. Great quality and flavor. Very good fried rice. Big portions .

7l5_zVu43azZN3MAwUzLGg.text: I was staying at NY NY for a work event, travelling alone as usual. So I pulled up to the Chin Chin bar right after the trade show I was working for a quick dinner before going upstairs to my room to crash.
