The bartender was wicked friendly, and made me the most delicious ginger martini ever (I needed one!). There was another guy at the bar who had just received his meal, and it looked AMAZING. I just gestured over to his order and said I'd get exactly that!  Brown rice, tangerine beef, and steamed mixed veggies... YUM! I was only able to finish off maybe 1/4 of the rice and maybe only 1/2 of the beef, and it's too bad there's no fridge/microwave combo in the rooms or I would've totally gotten leftovers, but it was so worth it! And oh yeah... I had that for dinner at least 2 more times during my week there!  Not the best Chinese food I've had (the food came out waaaaaaaaaay too quickly to be made fresh - the "crispy" beef was soggy!), but still really good for a quick dinner. And the bartenders have always been really friendly!  And the breakfast buffet isn't bad - fried rice and bbqed pork for breakfast, yes please!

cy7hDb4cK5vmANF1DBb-vQ.text: Had the lunch buffet for about $22 and it was shockingly good. They had a wide variety of options and they all were fresh despite it being later for lunch and very few people in the restaurant. They had a few sushi varieties which were good. I'm not a big sushi person so i can't say how they compare to most but as far as buffet goes I thought they were good. Lots of dessert options like cookies and pastries but they were all a little on the dry side. Chocolate covered strawberries were awesome and they had other fresh fruit. Service was great.

s8W0sbEYuCilSsQ8URki7Q.text: I was feeling hungry and it was pretty late, but Chin Chin was still open. The hostess was super sweet and seated us right away. Our waiter was great. He was genuine and very attentive. I got the bok choy and black mushrooms. It was seasoned well, however the mushrooms were a little tough. The SO got the Chinese chicken salad which was delicious. The dressing has a lot of ginger in it, so if you're not a ginger person you may want to choose something else. They have so much other yummy options I want to try.

Cbor2IF8lHb-hHU3wt6VBg.text: Good food for a sit down restaurant located in a casino...much like being the skinniest kid at fat camp.  Chicken lettuce wraps were as expected. War won ton soup was enough for two.  My favorite part was the coconut cream tea!  Not much for ambiance and located across from the piano bar.  Pickup some Pei Wei and play some bad karaoke, you'll save yourself $75.

xV8j_VvC3vTbgJd_iRAXgg.text: Service was ok. steamed rice was very dry. Mongolian beef had a good taste.  Mushu chicken was very bland and had to ask for plum sauce to be able to eat it.  Would not recommend.

U268VUKSGECMHbaweu4RCA.text: The buffet is clean and there are are a lot of different choices which is always a plus. The sushi bar is good but not the best sushi I've had but Ok for the convenience if you are staying at New York New York.

2wI9mWqClR0TaZ2F7pgG_w.text: Do not.  As a local. I will not come back. Slow. And over priced. Let the tourists pay those prices. Nit me. Mediocre food too   Stay away

drQoNLK-FtagTPI2G17DQw.text: We were a party of three ladies that were out celebrating my friend Suzy's 60th birthday.  We called and spoke to Tres (actually, we called 3x's) to make a reservation and ask questions.  Tres was so welcoming and helpful to us and came over to introduce himself when we got there!  What a great manager you have!!  We all had a truly fabulous meal and our server Shanna was beyond the best!  I would highly recommend this fine establishment to anyone looking for great food and the best service ever!!

4c_PT9YFF0lQ3KZDHAWc_w.text: We had the best wonton soup ever. But as good as the soup was it didn't compare to the excellent service we received from Rodrigo!!! Thanks for making it an even nicer experience then what we expected.

eTxGetxJiqPRUNZJ6eFogQ.text: Wow the quality of Chinese food is horrible. Service was fine. But Your better going to a food court in Vegas and getting Panda express and save your money. We ordered the hot and sour soup which had very little tofu and meat and way over soy sauced and corn starched. Jean longs noodles had no flavor and the Mongolian beef was way over salty. I can't speak for the sushi since we didn't order it. Look for something else if u want chinese.

p-w_GWU_Kzl0kxy63o_5Jg.text: Well worth the price of admission. At 17.99, you have two buffet lines. Several varieties of eggs Benedict all perfectly cooked, an assortment of breakfast meats, fruit, fresh scrambles, waffles, pancakes, French toast, fruit and yogurt, chocolate covered strawberries, fresh fruit, cereal, granolas and breakfast fried rice. We were concerned it would be Asian since we were in the mood for traditional but it was American standard. They will also make eggs and omelette to order. We wished we had decided to try it earlier in the trip. They also offer you beverages to go with your bill when you're done. Very happy. Easily got our money's worth.

Ms4CAwnQXd5Tkp94Ii_UVQ.text: Honestly this place gets overlooked in the back corner of the New York New York Hotel Casino. It is always easy to get a table and the servers and hostess staff is always excellent. Got the chance to meet both managers this past Saturday, Linda and Lisa. They were super friendly and professional.   I have not had a dish I did not enjoy and my husband I come here every time we are in Vegas. I, personally, think the buffet for breakfast is not good, just not the kinds of choices I like. They do a bang up business though. For me, I want Chinese food when I go to a Chinese place. :)  Now, here's the big advice. Try out their Asian pear martini from Dana the bartender. We became fast friends this past weekend, they are so delicious, light and crisp. A little to easy to drink ;).  I had the entire casino trying them by the end of the weekend! You will LOVE Dana, she is so sweet and fun to chat with!

5u9WAuY878BH0gWA3jvYhQ.text: Food took forever even though the place was empty. The menu has multiple typos, including the description of the spicy tuna roll is apparently the same as the rainbow roll. We ordered it without realizing it and instead of honoring the price the only option they gave us was to take it or pay for the rainbow roll price. We asked for the rainbow roll and she trashed that roll. When we finally got our food, the rainbow roll was really tasty but the ribs/chicken was salty too. Too bad...

cxU_ZKpQPJaR1xamUcTClw.text: We visited her recently. I ordered the Orange chicken which was pretty good. My husband ordered Cashew chicken as he usually does when we visit Chinese restaurants, and he said it was tasteless. I tried it to see if it really was that bad and it was dreadful. This was probably the most tasteless meal we've ever had. It was that bad, he didn't eat it all, he finished mine instead. I can't believe the chefs put that food out. It was like they missed ingredients from the recipe to make it so tasteless. To top it off, the menu is completely over priced. This was such a disappointing experience.

crjUAMk_xvHHLQ4hD2Q8Ew.text: Just average.   Good service buy the sushi rolls were nothing special and prices high for what they were.

RbBVKqHC5XIuBz3e9G9lOA.text: Every time we come to Vegas we come here.   The breakfast buffet is delicious and the prices are very reasonable.  Today we had Kate as our server, and as usual,  she was outstanding.  All of the staff here are very warm and friendly.   This is a great place!

37iX1Ty55aQbl8jqR8a5Aw.text: Smaller but quality buffet at Chin Chins Chinese restaurant in New York New York Hotel and Casio in las vegas Nevada.  Ceasar and Linda were incredibly helpful as waiter and hostess for our lunch date which was made so special for our 8th year Wedding anniversary.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent Sushi and delicious deserts.

a_7A-xR811qFUuSUoJX8Iw.text: Food was ok--service was terrible. Waiter was nonexistent; he forgot my wife's tea, then made some lame excuse about it steeping. He forgot the condiments for our food, was not available to bring us the check and provide a to go bag. We then called the manager over and asked for the to go bag, and HE FORGOT TOO.  There's just too many choices in LV to put up with neglect. We go to the chin chins in studio city all the time and have never had this kind of experience.

SZ-hkWZhcb0Ue1VfBUuOQQ.text: Not sure why everyone on here is hating on Chin Chin.  I've been twice and both times it's been solid.  When eating in Vegas, I am always ready for the food to be pretty generic (unless I'm eating somewhere super fancy, which never happens!), and pretty overpriced.  That being said, our group of 4 ordered 2 entrees: the dynomite roll and veggie spring rolls.  We also ordered 2 entrees: peanut noodles, and sweet and sour tofu.  The 4 of us had plenty to eat and got out of there for $60 total.  Not too bad.  The sushi roll and peanut noodles are my favorite.  I've had the peanut noodles both times I've been.  They are filling, spicy, and full of peanut deliciousness.

ZdTtDA5j_Tz43YDle6JECw.text: Not good at all. The service was awful. We got wrong drinks delivered. We had coupons that were not applied even after the manager approved them. I am hoping it was like this because of the construction. Manager stood in the corner the whole time.

lI5VDo5-xaS53Y02spvlVg.text: We stopped by here while we were in town for CES. Our waitress/bus-boy were very friendly and fun, but the food took forever to arrive and it arrived cold. However, the food itself was pretty good - I had the beef and broccoli (the white rice tasted weird though... Uncle Ben's? LOL) and my husband had soup. Overall a perfectly A-OK place to get lunch/dinner!

vX7P93y3RsvV7m_SC0sodQ.text: Always hit this place up while in LV. Food was good and the server was nice. No complaints.

M5fbz5cCtm0MnjsDG1Dx1g.text: This was the worst sushi I've ever had, and I live in the midwest, which isn't well known for sushi. It lacked flavor, fish and any recognizable sushi ingredients. Save your money and go elsewhere.

i0MiwBHY7C53fyd7Q-0Jmg.text: Honestly, it's your average over-priced hotel restaurant joint. Rolls are expensive, and they kind of suck but the chicken potstickers were good. Our bartender Louis was very accommodating and provided excellent service. These three stars are for him!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I got the veggie roll, my boyfriend got the Japanese lasagna (warning: comes with creme cheese; does not say in menu)

z5zDmJzNICIN9jhJkX4JxQ.text: The restaurant is inside New York New York. The service was attentive and friendly. The menu is extensive with family style Chinese entrees and sushi. We didn't try any of the Chinese dishes but the sushi rolls were surprisingly pretty big and good. Overall I was fairly pleased by the menu and the dishes. Not the best I've had but not bad at all.

iF4N8Jdmvi-cNcBgiIPQiQ.text: Absolute worst dining experience of my 7 day trip to Vegas.  Thank you Chin Chin for ruining my last night in Vegas! My waitress was distant and rude. She rushed us.  So I ordered the orange chicken.  Then when I tried it, I saw that it wasn't cooked well.  I wanted sushi instead.  The waitress then blankly stared at me when I told her, "I want Sushi." And she asked me if I wanted to see the menu. DUH! I don't have your menu memorized.  She definitely stopped for dramatic pauses.  She is a diva. I was complaining to my husband about what happened when a white male probably a buck 40 came up and passively asked if everything was ok only to try to de-escalate the situation and not to actually help.  The situation didn't need de-escalating. I'm just a minority woman who was not happy with the rushed horrible service.  The situation did not need tending to. What kind of trash establishment is this??? Won't be back. I have a biannual conference in Vegas and many people love going to Chin Chin. Will make sure we ( company of 100) never visit your racist restaurant.

Nwl9RZbRIr9Jde3m4wv8KA.text: If you like very bland Chinese food then this is the place for you.  Ordered the steam pork dumplings and the spicy seafood noodles.  Neither had any flavor, except the flavor of salt.  Service was good and attentive, but the food let me down.  Ended up paying almost $40 for two things that I had to force myself to eat.

Wey1ZF6d8MB7z3-Z0V-WMw.text: Food was great and our waiter Dexter was awesome.  We chose the dishes he recommended, Honey prawns, Noodles, Kung Pao Chicken and a sushi role (I forgot which one).  I'm picky when it comes to Chinese food and I thought the food was great.  I'll definitely go again when I'm in Vegas.

r0i6tYY8ezcs6fO4WiiS7g.text: Came here for the breakfast buffet. Was pretty crowded that morning, but it was easy to get to what you wanted.   Many choices of things to eat. All the go to breakfast foods. Bacon, sausage, pancakes, cereal, etc. They also had more specialty breakfast items like red velvet pancakes. I will say one thing not good was that the eggs with steak inside of them... Didn't have any steak. The best thing was the omelette. Tell your server what you want, and they will do it. You can even get shrimp in it! Try it, it's very good and the omelette was cooked perfect.   The price for the buffet was outstanding for Vegas. You can that along with a drink like orange juice for under $20. I was shocked when my bill came to see that. Can't go wrong with the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette with shrimp!

0_5b4OHr0uK6HxxekRxuPA.text: Food was good.we ordered the miso soup,  rainbow roll and a couple different hand rolls and some fried wontons. The sushi was very tasty but we didnt care to much for the wontons.  The service was just ok, it could've been better. It was a bit laggy.

Xm5YjrwK4J5yD65EO17RVg.text: Naisha was our server. She was new but what can I say amazing service and great addition to Chin Chin. They are very lucky to have her. Pedro her training officers was helpful and there to help her. Food was amazing and worth the price.

qou-OTnJGf6JTLJxRW-sTA.text: Out with family in Las Vegas..decided to skip a buffet tonight and came here.  Food was tasty...servers good.  Very noisy because of superbowl.

CoxnVGbTBiHexarDWg5a8Q.text: Shawn was really awesome!!   We got the baos, chicken chow mein, beef lo mein, and shrimp tempura roll. Food came out relatively fast and our server was prompt and always made sure we were taken care of. He knew the menu well and was prepared to help give recommendations.   Atmosphere is really nice, it's not too loud or too quiet. Price isn't terrible for Vegas when you factor in that the meals can be split family-style or amongst two.

WWtyHk9eGytLGC6Ao1crrQ.text: Food nasty never come back am never see buffet like that in Las Vegas pls don't waste your time and money go find some place else eat

2vwGe2PMmvt9U_m0d7Sksg.text: Great Price. Good Food.  Incredible Service.  Came in for breakfast buffet and left with lunch and a very happy heart.  The American breakfast selection was sufficient.  Made to order omelets with shrimp and crab was delicious. Coffee and juices included for $18.  But the best thing about this place is the synergy amongst the team members. We were serviced with endless smiles and happy attitudes from start to finish. A shout out to Oscar and Angel for an outstanding service.  Thank you, Chin Chin, for restoring my faith in good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Freshly made omelets,  eggs benedicts, bacon, sausage and whatever drink you want. Wow!

M2_KKMu5vq9O0nmxseubwA.text: Two and a half star American zed mostly Chinese restaurant in New York New York Hotel and Casino.  The good: affordable (mostly under $20 for entrees), edible (if you like a lot of soy sauce) for the most part  The bad: expensive appetizers and weak cocktails  Without the appetizer and my husband's drink, our tab for 2 satisfying meals and a pot of tea would have come to a little over $50 with tax and tips, which is pretty good for the Strip.  Would we go back? Maybe if we're in the vicinity and if we can't find more affordable dining options.

BwIZ8wEHep_51H2svUzifg.text: Breakfast and Lunch buffets are awesome! Staff is great and shoutout to Anita as she made our final meal at NYNY amazing! The $19 per person is DEF worth it folks!  Breakfast: We enjoyed this buffet over the MGM grand!  - Bacon/sausage links were good. - to order omelets amazing! - scrambled eggs and crab Benedict nice touch and flavorful! - coffee and OJ was great... Anita even hooked us up with to go cups... Well needed! - fruit and chocolate covered strawberries were fruit and sweet!   Lunch: - had sushi as we were full from breakfast. The California rolls were awesome and this place also rolls em fresh!  We had a late start so were able to enjoy breakfast and lunch for the same price as we happened to dine during shift change! We will definitely return if and when in Vegas! Enjoy folks.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon, pineapple and chocolate covered strawberries ... Yum!
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anita is wonderful! We need more people like her in the world! Excellent service

rr7CSsHPKqhBX-cKHzr5bg.text: Absolutely amazing service! I love the yang chow rice and Anthonys special noodles. Family style eating and generous portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anthonys special noodles
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yang chow rice

64emCFSuK89S71HGz4KDCw.text: I loved their breakfast buffet. Everything was fresh or either made to order. Hostess and cooks very professional, and restaurant very clean. I would really recommend this buffet.

iI32-5C1Sbju_xH2RD1tCQ.text: Closed for construction 11/19/16. Thanks for the walk. Beware if your wanting any of the raved about dumplings...

iFHt-7oUFpPoFi1bZ0989w.text: We had breakfast. Omelet is good and the bacon. Coffee is not, water down. The coffee mugs are not clean. Server is great.

aDjZyhLOc1G818W_2YVuWg.text: Great place. Sat at the bar and they gave us free dim sum  so that's a plus. I don't normally drink Fufu drinks, but this was so good I couldn't resist ordering one. The sushi and entrees we ordered were all delicious. The staff was friendly and very attentive. Definitely will visit this place again when I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hibiscus
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Roll

rqugqoqWzKMbLsgbDiu8pA.text: My co-worker and I came here for a late lunch. It wasn't very busy when we came so we got seated right away. The staff and servers were attentive and friendly!  We both ended up getting the lunch buffet, which I think is the most bang for your buck. It was only $25! $25 for an unlimited variety of choices plus sushi vs. ordering 2 items for $25 or more, you pick which is the best deal!  It was a pretty typical buffet I'd say, lots of options for all types of eaters.

oUjbJ4R42Vb8jzW63QpNHQ.text: I came here for breakfast buffet around 11:40 and they switched to lunch menu right at 12:00; I got to try both for the price of one. Even though, their buffet menus are comparatively smaller than other places in Vegas, but the quality, taste and service make them far better than those expensive buffets.  - Freshness of the ingredients just pops in your mouth and your taste buds just go crazy!  - Staff is really really service focused and very very friendly.....before I could even ask for anything, my server already had that thing on my table......its like they are constantly reading your mind and assessing your needs.   - The price is totally totally fair for the quantity, quality, ambiance, service, and the whole experience.  Highly, highly recommended!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelet with onion, sundried tomatoes, mushrooms and peppers. Ingredients were extremely fresh.
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

In_Z__x28a5do4bNfjIzmw.text: Ian and Steve are the best!  Always order the sushi here, they tell me that their sushi is flown in daily, and the quality definitely shows! I always love coming to Chin chin!!

rrJH2cpLImNCeB2orPAz-w.text: This place stays crowded. The sushi was good overall. The spicy tuna was more spicy than normal (here and other places). We ventured out and ordered the monkey brains, which was tasty (spicy because of the spicy tuna) but a little different from a texture standpoint.

uSK_UR5ljLYD1f_tOeGh-w.text: We visited New York New York on a recent visit to Las Vegas. After a day of rollercoasters and games we ran across Chin Chin. The staff was wonderful. The food and drinks were delicious.   The waiter who noticed that my daughter just celebrated her 21st birthday surprised her with a slice of cheesecake with Happy Birithday written in chocolate. She was extremely surprised and the staff went above and beyond.  I would highly recommend Chin Chin!!

C1AGIBEMoX1mdIlLI--UiQ.text: $10 breakfast! Enough said! The service was a little slow, but the food was decent and reasonable in price.

hXEHZJyPoW6GyiZFYNbpMg.text: This place was amazing and the food was the best I've had in Las Vegas.  Our server TJ was awesome and super friendly, ask for him ... you will be happy you did.  Super cool guy and gave great advice on good dishes to try.  The Mongolian and General chicken was unreal.   The Chinese sesame chicken salad was great.  This place is 5 stars all the way.   Parking in the garage was only 9.00! :-)   Highly recommend...

M_Hzqh4qGbL4bZYESQgMCg.text: The food was mediocre. Our waiter was a real tool. He dismissed us when we asked him to split checks at the beginning. At the end of the meal, he brought out the ticket....not split. When we asked him to go back and split it, he said his manager was too busy. We ended up paying on one card, just so we could get out of there.

xN90gmwf-sLpSO0K36U6Sw.text: Las Vegas Baby!!!! But we still hold True for our love for and of NY. We are in the New York, New York Hotel & Casino. Enjoying Sushi NY style, ChinaTown.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backside wall.

vv-UdgaYqu2tkn5rMtoeNg.text: Visited Chin Chin for breakfast. When visiting the city of excess, sometimes it's nice to just have a non-buffet meal that won't hurt your pocket book. An employee of the hotel recommended Chin Chin. They had a buffet special for mother's day however there was also an option to order from their $10 menu. I ordered the build your own omelet breakfast with up to five toppings. Honestly, for $10 that is really affordable considering it's Vegas.   The meal came with toast and potatoes, and you can either have six egg whites or three eggs. I did get the five toppings and was hopeful that this omelet would taste great because in my opinion it's hard to mess up an omelet. Unfortunately I didn't find the omelet as appetizing as I hoped for because the entire meal tasted bland to me. I never add salt to my food, but in this instance I had to for flavor. Even with a little salt it was still bland.  The roasted potatoes were great, and you can't go wrong with sourdough bread toast and jam.   If I visit Chin Chin again, I'll try something else from the $10 menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast for $10 @ Chin Chin. Build your own omelet with up to five toppings!

hzAGWZ1uTruxqa3D-mr7Ug.text: Had the breakfast buffet this morning and it was a pretty solid breakfast for the price! They have a pretty big variety of foods and they are all pretty good. They let you have an omelette and I got the garden omelette trying to be healthy and it was a bit to healthy for me but not bad tasting. The highlights of the buffet were the ham, the french toast, and the breakfast potatoes. Everything else was pretty standard and others were pretty bad. The red velvet pancakes were more like cakes and was kinda chewy and very flavorful. The service was great. They were quite attentive. The was no wait and it was maybe half full at around 10am. It is a pretty decent breakfast buffet to start your day!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garden Omelette
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb Omelette

SRESnDrkH3d7hSsweTrGwQ.text: I came here for breakfast buffet and loved it. Came here two days in a row. My favorite was the smoked salmon Benedict and stacked my plate with bacon and sausage. You can order personalized items like omelettes or over easy eggs but I just went for self serve.  To top off that experience, I was fortunate to be served by Karen both days and she's an absolute delight. She was very attentive and sweet. I was super tired in the morning but interacting with her was like a breath of fresh air. Thank you for making it such a pleasant experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe and Benedict self served at breakfast buffet

EFbjaN-iJEkaaZMO1C8dAQ.text: Chin-chin was in the right casino when we needed to eat. Being in Vegas, obviously you're going to eat out. We hadn't had any Asian cuisine as of yet and I figured it would be worth it to try. There was a sign that said ask how to get free dim sum. We did: eat at the bar and get an entree/roll. So, we sat down and there's a few gentlemen at the bar. Ian greets us, doesn't take our order and continues "training" some dude with REALLY greasy hair... Charles asks if we've been helped, Ian chimes in that he's got us. Charles continues the task at hand. Later, he sees we still have menus. He asks if we've gotten our order taken. We tell him Ian said that and bounced! So, he takes our order, I selected the YumYum Scallop roll- FREAKING AMAZING! Fresh ginger, it was all I had hoped for after day drinking. LoL! My husband ordered Monkey  Brains! Hahaha... a ball of raw tuna topped with fresh avocado. Beautiful presentation. All I have to say is that Charles needs more recognition. Maybe a raise. He's a hard ass worker, and he kept things moving when it seemed to me that Ian was just traveling in circles! Annoying... then he tried to come tell Charles what to do! WTF? He's clearly got a handle on what's going on. I don't know what Ian's purpose is.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Fried Potsticker and their coconut sauce. I don&#39;t even like coconut and it was DELICIOUS!

4q9cjMgGv_olrhMIy0mRfA.text: This is a 3.5 star rating. Chin chin is most definitely not authentic Chinese food and they don't pretend otherwise either.   We came at 12pm for lunch when most ppl seemed to be having their breakfast buffet which was very continental. We decided to order off their lunch menu. The veggie dumplings we got were served cold which we had to ask them to reheat and it was still bad - definitely skip this item. For the main course we got a spicy lo mein, spicy eggplant, and kung pao chicken. We asked them to make these dishes spicy and it turned out to be really good.   The cocktails they have seem pretty good and we enjoyed the kai saketini and dragonfruit mojito that we got. The waiters and the hostess are extremely friendly and nice!

4_xxPL2Lpg1cRCTZcuS0Jw.text: Went here for lunch today. Angel our waiter was one of the best we've had in a long time as far as service and attentiveness. Was very unexpected and the food was great as well.  Will return

59cVJz2ZmHSMdHS9JqTw5A.text: Amazing service! recommend the lunch/dinner buffet. It's a great deal and delicious.  Definitely a great choice!

TBqqp4dUt6QOFjms9aF8Lg.text: Had the Hawaiian role and Hamachi sushi...fantastic!  Also, the best Arnold Palmer I have ever had...mad with fresh lemonade and iced tea.  Service was great and price was reasonable.  Very large menu.

FPx4dd2XA8G3hwFkOiasZQ.text: Do yourself a favor -- GO!!!!   I already love the atmosphere inside NY NY - and this restaurant didn't disappoint. We were looking for a bite to eat before the 9pm show of Zumanity. We were able to be seated right away and were overwhelmed by how good everything looked !!!!  The Yum Yum scallop sushi was hands down the best I've ever had! It was melt in your mouth good, and my boyfriend and I talk about going back JUST to have it again!  We enjoyed the scallop & shrimp with black bean sauce as well (no spice) and it was great! My martini included pineapple and Saki and was not only delicious, but very different from anything else I've had.   I'm telling you - you'll regret not going here !!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9AuoAZdkQmDk3uLtds7fCQ.text: The food was ok.  The service is horrible .  Save yourself the time and aggravation and eat elsewhere.  My kids waited over 25 mins. To get their ice cream.  This restaurant caters to the convention gentlemen who were treated like kings by the ladies.  Their drinks their meals their checks all on point and in a timely manner, while we sat there waiting for a drink we order at the beginning of our meal and the ice cream that came with our kids meals.  Four tables were turned over before my husband got up to the drink station and asked the manager for our Check.   After explaining the experience we just had, she immediately had our server bring the ice creams and my drink.  She also took us half of the bill, which is the only reason I am giving them one star.

vMPrU1TG9ghtxjjbmSjNHw.text: We had the lunch buffet on a Tuesday.  Our server, Oscar, was prompt and attentive.  The buffet was a good bargain for the money. Nothing too fancy, but it was all prepared well, tasty, and the presentation was tidy and neat. The desserts were fantastic and pretty.  Would recommend for a nice casual bite to eat.

4FEGY694Lilmbk1zvDxsfQ.text: I truly feel bad writing all these bad reviews in Las Vegas, having only lived here for a month and a half, and I don't mean to be comparing my experiencing with restaurants from back home, but hey, Yelp is all about honesty. And as I start exploring Vegas, my new home more and more, I will discover new gems, and I promise I will find great new places to write great reviews about. Until then, there's Chin Chin.  I love walking the strip, as I have many medical problems, and it's like physical therapy for me, but I hate paying "strip prices". My husband had already just had pizza, but having an allergy, we had to find a bite for me, and it being late, we had little choices. We walked up to Chin Chin, and the hostess with the mostest greeted us and struck up conversation. I explained that we moved here, and being that we were now locals, were were not looking to spend a whole lot, and were looking to avoid the tourist pricing. Well, she did some voodoo on us, and we found ourselves sitting down. Seeing that the restaurant was pretty established, having locations in Beverly Hills, Studio City, Bentwood, and West Hollywood, CA, I felt pretty comfortable with that. I looked over the menu, and couldn't find anything that was in the price-range of someone taking a stroll and wanting a bite- maybe she didn't get the point of the 5 minute conversation we had before she seated up. I went ahead and ordered the Spicy Seafood Noodles, and truly hoped for the best. While I waited, the party next to me seemed to be enjoying their food, but they were pretty pissed drunk, and ordered what I wanted to order, but went against my better judgement,and went with the servers recommendation.  When the food arrived, I was shocked the my $18 meal was just splashed into it's bowl, as there were 4 pieces of veggies stuck to the upper part to the rim. I'm not picky...okay, yes I am. How hard is it to take pride in what you put out of your kitchen, because it looked like crap. Now onto the food. It was okay. It reminded me of the Chinese/Korean dish, you find in many authentic Chinese restaurants (I reviewed one restaurant that served it that made their own noodles and charged $7 less called Chef Ping) called Jjampong. Yes, they were not the same dishes. The dish I ordered was a spicy black bean sauce, while jjampong is a fragrant red sauce, but they are very similar in other ingredients. The dish by Chin Chin was one note, and salty, and by the end of the dish, I was craving something more, and a glass of water. I was left very unsatisfied, and while there were an ample enough seafood in the dish, there was not enough calamari, maybe 2 pieces, and they didn't seem very fresh. All and all, I will not recommend, and will NOT spend my $18 on a dish that I could potentially get for half the price in Chinatown for half the price with twice the flavor. I thought I would get something of decent quality from a place that is established off the strip. Plus like I said, it was late, and I didn't have many choices. One, and one last thing. I know it was late, but the place was not closed, but was coming close to closing time, but it was not excuse for the lacking service we received, that just added to the disappointment.

vNauHi6o0Vx3fC1L9XjcTA.text: Came here super late to eat dinner at 9:30 p.m. The hostess was really friendly. The waiter gave us a lot of information on the specials, what was good, etc. He also mentioned that if we don't see something we like on the menu to make a custom order (you rarely hear that at restaurants). Service was a little slow. Warning: 2 rolls of eel is $10. I was expecting more rolls but it's Vegas! Overall very nice place. It's kind of hidden in New York New York, it's too bad it's not in a better / more visible location. I would definitely recommend and come back here again.

1JaRo9B2YUbUo_0TcYikDA.text: Went there today, and enjoyed a great lunch. The service was excellent and the food was quite good!! I recommend this place to those looking for affordable Asian cuisine.

ktsRjbeBAL51uksUSyHgEg.text: Breakfast was ok but to see the way the male managers treated their employees was horrible to watch. Server girls were always with a smile on their face. Not a place i would recommend but would recommend Corporate office in better training their management to help build confidence to their employees not bully them !!!

QQybsviE0zmpIt0bKD2mGA.text: Awesome friendly service.  Had the breakfast buffet.  Which was delicious! We were planning on breakfast at the Italian restaurant,  but missed it. Chin Chin saved the day.

0bbw5-sRsz-rSnAT8caJpQ.text: Very good sushi rolls. Fun crew working. Like everything in Vegas it was a bit over priced.

uG5E4UjwTREHkwlb_ZJoKQ.text: We had the lunch buffet after a long night in Vegas it was a great deal! Jordan was our server he was super chill and made our experience even better! Overall great service for a great price, they even let u stick around for the lunch buffet! Will definitely come back when we are in Las Vegas again :)

hvwIg9DGpHrztZdVZROchQ.text: My favorite Chinese restaurant in Vegas. The service is super good. Especially Emmanuel. Handsome and nice. Food is awesome! Fried rice is delicious!

sIH1aeqlh_uExQCXVDmk1g.text: Had the Breakfast Buffet and it was delicious and affordable 17.00 for adults and 9.00 for children. The staff was very nice and friendly. I am definitely coming back

a4EUshGgn-6xGsBA37HQWg.text: Overall, not impressed. First, I must say I've been to the original Chin Chin on Sunset Blvd and the food was great. Chinese chicken salad is the best. Las Vegas version, not so much. The Chinese chicken salad was ok, but the chicken itself tasted pungent. White meat chicken breast should have almost no flavor and should take on the flavor of the sauce. Not in this case. The taste was just way off. My friend had the cashew chicken which was good, but lacked flavor. Had to add soy sauce to dish to eat. Really good food should never need a condiment. What brought this review to 2 stars were the delicious egg rolls. They were awesome. But unfortunately the bad tasting chicken left a horrible taste in my mouth. Would probably not go back.  Not just for egg rolls.  Not worth the time and effort it takes to get to New York New York hotel.

GUeokRPyjsq8lK4vBnUMiw.text: We ate here after watching Zoomanity.  We had: Tempura Roll, Mongolian beef, Rice, and Chow Mein Chicken.  They all tasted pretty good for NY NY.  But make sure to get the opinion of an Asian server so you know which dish will taste good.  Don't eat the Dim Sum.

qg_WwqkpvDPOUKUPMt5pog.text: Good food.  We did sushi and appetizers.  They have a buffet but I don't do buffets.  I will say our waiter, Jordan, was fun, friendly and a little sarcastic (we enjoyed his sarcasm).

GyBfEJRhwrdsLp2adVFnsQ.text: I had the lo mein and it was pretty darn good, but then again I was super hungry. We also go the plum sake and it was really good. We had a great server that was very attentive, because we were all chugging water. It was nice because they had a few gluten-free items (not many, maybe 5); we had 2 in our party that are gluten intolerant so it was nice to see. I was overall satisfied when we left. The atmosphere was nice and not too crazy but relaxing.

V6cUjJfj5eVNVKBd12NY9Q.text: Let's be honest - nothing in Sin City is cheap. For Vegas travelers on a budget, finding an inexpensive place to eat can be tough.   During a trip to Las Vegas for the 2008 CES, my parents and I had dinner at Chin Chin at the New York-New York Hotel & Casino one night. The three of us agreed on this place as we had been looking for some Chinese food for some time. The prices were generally lower than those of other eateries in the area, so it seemed like an attractive place to eat.   Unfortunately, the low prices were just about the only good thing about the restaurant. For starters, many of the dishes were over-seasoned. Case in point, the fried rice was extremely salty as it was literally drenched in soy sauce. The other items we ordered also had similar problems, and it was rather hard for us to eat the food as we prefer lighter tastes.  The three of us also ordered some raspberry mousse cake for dessert. This, too, turned out to be a mistake as the cake seemed to be extremely heavy in fat and sugar. It was actually so greasy that it caused me to lose my appetite the following morning. I had split the slice with my parents, but even that didn't seem to help.  The quality of service was not impressive either. It took the waitress five minutes to bring us the dessert menu, even though there were few other guests. After we ordered the cake, it took another five minutes for her to bring it to us despite it being a pre-made item.  On the whole, I would not recommend this place. I understand one can't really judge a restaurant with a single dining experience, but my impressions are telling me to stay away from Chin Chin in the future.  -- TL;DR version --  Highs: Prices are relatively low Lows: Slow service; food is over-seasoned and greasy Bottom line: You get what you pay for in Vegas. Low prices aside, there are better options. Final verdict: 2.5 stars (rounded up to three)

E40_thEOZix_RSEsVCGXpQ.text: The service was great. The food was absolutely wonderful. I got the dumplings with cilantro sauce and we also had the Alaskan roll.

lASKwyIiGCqSqbZySiQmDQ.text: Good food with amazing service. While breakfast was transitioning to lunch, the manager Linda and our server Jordan completely accommodated our requests. We'll be back for sure

KdMC984UrX36mPfdQWA9yg.text: First of all we were staying at the Monte Carlo... We first encountered Chin Chin looking for something healthy.  We had. The general tsos chicken and sweet and sour shrimp plus the crab Rangoon were absolutely the best I ever had and I'm 46!  The manager , Linda, was very very attentive and personable. She gave us a coupon for a free mimosa with buffet. We came back the next day and  Linda was there and greeted us ! Our server Anita was an excellent server with a high emotional intelligence and kept our table clean and glasses full. The buffet was fresh, expansive and reasonably priced. Linda gave us a coupon for a free app on our next visit which will be tomorrow !

zcm1aepQ2WqdqI6ffaQ0XA.text: Some would come here for the food, but I come here for the service. Hands down one of my favorite brunch places, not only is there a mean red velvet pancake, but the wide array of benedicts, omelettes, fruit and pastries are what all do it for me. But let me tell you what really shines. Our server Jordan. Not only was he courteous to my disabled mother, he was also attentive and always there when we needed service. Such a great conversationalist. Will be dining here again!

BsGvtMpUEJDxNlQEiH3D4A.text: Absolutely delicious food very friendly staff well priced. It cost me less than $100 to feed a family of 6 I would highly recommend it to any one.

XB3qoytdwkVbCFXQoYrCBw.text: Maybe it was a bad night. Maybe it's because as New Yorkers, we eat some of the best Chinese food in the U.S.   First the positives. The manager on duty was very nice, empathetic and quite good at his job. Our server was also very thoughtful, professional and empathetic. The place is bustling, exciting and abuzz with activity. And by the looks of things, it's very popular.  For my family and me, we found the food was WAY TOO SALTY. That killed it for us. My wife ordered pot stickers that arrived hot - as they should, but were served with some sort of apricot dipping sauce served very very cold. That was a head scratcher. Back home, pot stickers are served with a soy-based sauce with ginger and green onions at room temperature.  I had vegetables in a curry sauce and my son had pork lo mein, all of which would have been delicious were it not for the high sodium content.   The manager on duty took our concerns very seriously and took appropriate action.   I do hope they take a look at their recipes and consider using considerably less salt. I'm sure they've got some talented folks working in the kitchen. Eliminating much of the salt used in the recipes and allowing the natural flavors of the ingredients to come through would be a great service to the skills their kitchen staff bring to the job. I'm sure Chin Chin's patrons would appreciate it too.

hUPhdEud83JyE3DliaZ7Og.text: Don't miss out on this place, you won't regret it! Everyone is amazing from the wonderful bartender who took our "to go" order (didn't get his name) day before yesterday to our server last night Angel S., and Ian at breakfast this morning!! That's place runs like a well oiled machine. Everyone helps everyone else. We went there three times in the last three days. To us it looked like they truly care about their employees and their clientele.   First day: Hawaiian roll was amazing (ordered with pineapple on the side). Pan fried pot stickers: yummy!!!  Second day: husband has the Pokie Roll and I had the Hawaiian (butt of course I stole a couple of pieces from the hubby).  Third day: We had the 2 for 1 breakfast... Holy !! This is the way buffets should be run. All fresh and you could get made to order eggs, omelets, and a couple of other items. All included!! I went for it. Omelette with asparagus, spinach, tomatoes, mushrooms, caramelized onions, goat cheese, and lump crab meat. Yes real crab meat!! Husband had an omelette too but his was kinda boring. All his had was steak, hollandaise sauce, mushrooms, and cheddar cheese.  If we ever come back to Vegas (after recouping that is), this will be the first place we hit. Highly recommend!

YqoK_EbsobbGCnCVujddTg.text: We had dinner here our first night getting into Vegas. Service by Kyle (and his support team) was outstanding. Food as always was perfect.

G4Py8wYpPzRuYuncmTw05w.text: Food was pretty average. Somewhere between Panda Express and PF Chang :) Our server Ben was very cool. Two stars for him! And drinks were outstanding. Expensive but all good drinks in Vegas are expensive. Two stars for that.   Took away one for food. Good portion but nothing outstanding.

R3Uv_pUn0MEe_JBNMBf2Ww.text: The sushi was the best I've ever had! The rolls are very large- one roll is entree size. The orange chicken was very good and crispy. The peanut noodles were the best! The shrimp are humongous! Very good and fresh food!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zlXTIMS1R0X0J5X2QNEwLQ.text: We ordered the star won tons which were delicious! I got the volcano roll, which is probably the best sushi roll I've had yet! My husband got the honey siracha shrimp which is delicious but wasn't impressed by his vegetable lo mein... also the saketini was great! Recommend it for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Ub3gI3CRwzMr4IZnMTIWQ.text: What a wonderful buffet with a great price! Oh, and there was no wait at all!  There are a lot of different Chinese dishes. We got orange chicken, spring rolls, vegetable rice, noodles, beef with broccoli, shrimps and maybe something else ( I don't remember:)) Everything was pretty good but I think beef was over-salted.   I loved their desserts! Fruit tart was the best dessert I had in a looong time. That custard was just magical! I enjoyed cheesecake as well. Chocolate covered strawberries are basically always the same for me.   And now the best part: we paid only for one lunch buffet from two with Yelp coupon. We spent 21 on buffet plus taxes and a good tip = 38$. Not bad for Vegas, right?;)  I'm definitely planning to come back here on my next Vegas trip. The only thing that I didn't like was out waitress. She was good but as soon as she heard about our coupon she changed her attitude. No, she wasn't rude but just less attentive and kinda cold. My husband gave her a good tip so she would feel better about us having a coupon (lol). I'd do the opposite thing! Anyway, don't judge book by it's cover. Btw manager was very nice when she came to confirm our coupon  Definitely, would give 5 stars to this place but service should be improved.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts! Fruit tart ( the best), cheesecake and chocolate covered strawberries

drW1i0wLyLRuL-AuKpBU9g.text: Best Chinese food ever!  So good so tasty so fresh!! I love to go there every time I'm in Las Vegas! Awesome staff very friendly!!  Love to go there!!

wyErUb_EMXpK_t_gk6JIVA.text: Got the Kung pao chicken with white rice. In the mood for Chinese come check it out. Great atmosphere and look.

rOmUGZ-GbpB-t4TJS-vE6w.text: Went to Chin Chin inside New York New York where we were staying and food was bomb and Yvette, our server was very nice. Ordered Sweet & Sour Shrimp and shrimp tasted great and sauce was bomb. Some type of fried rice that was good too. Not super expensive like I would have thought so that was a plus of course. Great place and you can tell they get busy.

qCVFwtfU5hKEEHMdgpBuGg.text: Decent place, nothing special, nothing terrible.  Average food, with above average service.

tmo_546K-UxcVR5u7JZRJw.text: Absolutely fabulous breakfast buffet. Made to order omelettes are out of this world, Take a look!

ytVHfY5IsjwoDr4EvweOkQ.text: We did the buffet brunch. For what you get, it's really well priced in my opinion.  I wasn't impressed with our waitress, we sat at the bar and she didn't offer to refill my coffee until we were finished eating and had me pass stuff over the sushi counter to her instead of coming around (the bar glass  is fairly high & the sushi chef was preparing food in front of me, so this wasn't convenient nor good service). We didn't get asked about the custom omelettes until after we ate the food from a trip through the buffet. About the time we were asked if we wanted drinks (like water & coffee). If that's typical of the bar service here, I'd recommend getting a table.  If it hadn't been for the lackluster service, it would be a 4.  A few items on the buffet seemed like they were under heaters there for too long (stuffed French toast & crab cake Benedict). The biscuit & gravy was good. Eggs were good (scrambled). Rosemary potatoes were yummy.

iayEMcxcmjdmWZrsiJs9Kw.text: I've never been disappointed by the breakfast at chin chin so we expected the lunch buffet to be just as good. Exceeded our expectations! The salad options and vegetarian selections were wonderful, for the meat eaters, you will not be let down either. This buffet unlike the others on the strip has a much more limited selection but not to be interpreted as "less" because everything is exceptional. You will not see sub-par pizza or other random cuisines but you will get tasty sushi, orange chicken, beef entrees, etc that are all delicious. More is not always better and chin chin is proof.

meLF-_dXve9v_q5t17wU7w.text: Amazing service!!! We stumbled upon this place as we were looking for sushi but most places didn't have gluten free options. As we were looking at a menu the hostess offered us $5 well drinks to sit at the bar, we were sold! We sat down and immediately loved our bar tender, Rhyes. He was so fun and knowledgeable. My friend has a gluten allergy so we have to be careful. We asked about all the options & he was so great. He even pulled the sushi chef over to talk to her! They made an effort to make sure she would be able to eat. They modified a special roll for her & it was amazing.   I had the peanut noodles and WOW. They are marked spicy but weren't too spicy. Would recommend this place for sure! Clean, good food, affordable, and awesome atmosphere.

BM5TaSUHOKhlXKZROR8OTQ.text: Subpar Vegas restaurant. Now it makes sense why they advertise so hard with coupons for the breakfast buffet. So first off, prices are out the wazoo for subpar food.  Prices for sushi rolls start at $15-18. And that's for the same portion as you would get anywhere in the US, the flavor not any better if not a little worse than others I have had. Service was okay, we sat at the bar and could've sworn 2-3 different servers stared right at us as they were grabbing drinks and food and said nothing to us. We sat for a while to order drinks and then another while to order food. Then waited another while for the check.... luckily we weren't in any hurry.  Breakfast buffet was honestly disgusting. No idea how this place even gets more than 2 stars. Not a good representation of Japanese food, and not even a good take on Japanese American if that was their goal.  Overall, overpriced for not good food. Would avoid avoid! Happy eating!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Volcano roll

ubnqGRdPGxJBDUKhAoPiKQ.text: My review is based on the complications during and after the meal. The food was definitely delicious, however, the miscommunication from management, and the food preparation deserved a one star. The server was polite, considerate, and diligent. I'm not giving a one star because she was great! Some of the complications regarding the food are bad seafood and undercooked blobs of noodles.   The birthday girl ordered a seafood chow mein which was bad and got it replaced for chicken. My issue is that the chicken chow mein was ringed up like a seafood chow mein (the seafood cost more than the chicken). Aside from that, my lo mein was cooked in blobs or chunks and had an odd taste. I got it replaced and it was delicious but there was still chucks of noodles (not as many and as big as the first one). We did not receive any compensation or discounts for the misunderstanding and bad seafood on their behalf.   One major factor that played a huge part in this review is that I told the server about a member of my party's birthday and received a nice cheesecake but not singing. Might not sound like a big deal but there was another birthday and I heard some servers singing happy birthday to them.   We were planning to come to the breakfast buffet but we have reconsidered and decided to join the buffet at Luxor instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The birthday cheesecake with no happy birthday sing along.
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front dish is a tofu lo mein and the back dish is a chicken chow mein. I&#39;m having my meal with a dragon fruit mojito.

1__uJX41eQbDDCvQK_KQVw.text: Decent for lunch. Great service but the food was meh. I wouldnt recommend the sushi. But the Chinese food isnt half bad. I believe there's an AYCE menu too.

v7OszpcTPEG9Jtn3EHye0A.text: Good Sushi at Chin Chin's. My mom and I came here for a small bite to eat and of course, a drink! I had the shrimp tempura and wonton stars. Man, oh, MAN! These are good. The spoon I received was dirty and my first wine glass but it was quickly fixed and I had a glass of the Chardonnay and it was very oaky but still good. We are in town visiting but I will be back for more sushi before I leave. The bartender and manager is AMAZING! They're super sweet, attentive, and personable. I enjoyed my time here!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tempura.
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty spoon.

XfVb4fOnZJhAAkXDaC1MKQ.text: 3.5 stars. Not bad. Sushi looked like the better option based off what the rest of the customers were ordering.   Service was excellent. Top notch.   Miso was good. Nice mix of seaweed and tofu. Flavorful.   California roll was well a California roll. You can't really mess this one up. It was tasty.   Wor won ton was a mixed bag of emotions.  Good - huge scallops. Tasty broth. Med size shrimp.  Average - pork won ton. Not great not bad.   Weird - noodles. Was the weirdest tasting noodles I've ever had in won ton soup. Tasted like instant noodles on the stale side. It felt like a new cook made this and added the wrong noodles. This really ruined the dish for me. I tried to eat it all but couldn't finish the noodles.   Next time I'd probably try regular won ton. This place is a bit more expensive. I'd rather go off the strip and save the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wor won ton. So-so. Those noodles?  Huge scallops. Med size shrimp. Soft carrots. So-so pork won tons. Awful noodles.
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso. Seaweed, tofu, broth flavorful.

sFxoWmvFMsQx3sYdH95DYQ.text: They offer a FREE appetizer if you sit at the bar, so we sat at the bar. We ordered the crab wontons as the free appetizer and were not impressed. However, the Hokey Pokey roll is fantastic! The seafood pasta is also subpar and made us wish we had just ordered two Hokey Pokey rolls / more sushi instead of the pasta.   The service was fantastic and we had a really wonderful experience chatting with the servers at the bar. I'd definitely return for the sushi!

LoaZ0rfXrOv4a9AjbhSEfQ.text: Chin Chin.   1) Italian (and sometimes French): 'Cheers!' Derives from the sound of the glasses clinking together.   2) Japanese: Penis. Cause of much puzzlement when Italians travel to Japan, or when Japanese travel to Italy.  Italian guy: OK, here's to our time in Osaka. Chin chin!   Japanese guy: I beg your pardon?  Haha.   A Humorous Toast. ... Going out to eat together was also a great passion, and when there was an occasion for toasting, you would often hear us toast "Chin-chin!". "Chin-chin" is an italian toast, (actually Cin-Cin) which I believe means the equivalent of "to your health".   WoW! I went with the Chef recommendation of Paradise Roll & Yellowtail Jalapeno. Knock your socks off good! Nicely done Stephen!  Cheers
