yEbTqOQvvcfdSWGrpje5Kw.text: Visiting New York hotel on the strip and it was dinner time. So we passed Chin Chin and forgives let's try it. They had immediate seating and we had a cute corner booth. The waitress said they were short staffed and was super on the ball. She also warned us the portions are huge! So when our food came we were still surprised! We had ordered way to much food ! The white fried rice was super good. The bbq pork was great. We were so stuffed! Very happy we chose to eat there!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EHFyVqLNkzx1OiL4b-DSFQ.text: Seriously? Anyone who gave this over to stars probably eats out at Jack-in-the-Box on a regular basis. The food was so salty! The only thing tolerable was some of the sushi. There are no other words just horrible.

EXteDH6LGrn53AcPdnlvng.text: Chin Chin is suppose to be this authentic Chinese food restaurant located inside the New York, New York Hotel & Casino. My family was visiting and also staying in the hotel and one night decided to eat here. One thing you should know about this place is...Be prepared to leave here with some to-go boxes because they truly serve you family sized portions on pretty much all of the items on the menu. Our order consisted of:   Spicy Seafood Noodles- Soft lo mein noodles with shrimp, calamari, scallops, scallions, snow peas and red onions, tossed in a black bean sauce.  Beef and Broccoli- Flank steak, broccoli and black mushrooms sauteed in a garlic brown sauce.  Anthony's Special Noodles- Lo mein noodles, sliced chicken breast and shredded carrots tossed in a spicy cilantro sauce.  Salmon On The Beach- Shrimp Tempura, cream cheese, avocado topped with salmon, yum yum sauce, unagi sauce, and scallion.  While the food was decent here I do question the thought of it being "authentic" Chinese food as I can compare this meal to prior Chinese restaurants I've dined at. Like any other restaurant inside of the hotel and casino's the price tag will be up there because of the location and convenience. This place gives portions that make the prices worth it though. The 3.5 stars would be a bit more accurate for this dining experience and that's because the service was spotty and my dad actually found a few pieces of hair in his food.

jp36rVUjZAprBROkc2289w.text: Stopped in for some appetizers last night, food was great, the service was particularly responsive. Dexter waited on us and he was attentive and fulfilled our needs quickly. Very personable as well! I'd go back!

lbOXn6bwiKRounxey8vKBw.text: No wait when we arrived around 6pm on Sunday.  We both ordered the dim sum - 3 half portions of pineapple fried rice, bbq pork, chinese chicken salad.  BF got the yang fried rice, bbq pork, steamed dumplings.  Also ordered some cocktails which were delish.  My fave is the chinese chix salad, but youve gotta love ginger because the ginger dressing is powerful. Luckily I LOVE ginger..the BF not so much so he wasnt a fan.  The food portions were big for a half potion and the food was tasty.  TJ was our server and he was excellent...floor mgrs came by to check on us.    I'll definitely return this place was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 dim sum orders - bbq pork/chinese chix salad/pineapple fried rice &amp; bbq pork/yangs fried rice/dumplings
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese chicken salad - veryyyy gingery

bU8kn1e72geoSCR19psDcQ.text: The short version is if you've ever had real, good asian food, you would never come here. Honestly, I was better off going to Panda Express.  The dumplings....damn, could they be more rubbery, literally when these things got brought out to the table they looked fake, like a display dumpling, on top of that the taste was exactly that.   The fried rice, wholly sweet mother, did I mention Panda Express is across the street. Man, probably the worst tasting and looking fried rice I can recall, I quickly had them take that back.  There was also Pad Thai....which I don't remember if Pad Thai is always supposed taste like sweet and sour sauce....don't forget about Panda Express.  I'm not sure what was the best part, the boiled edamame or the that our waitress left without telling us or a backup waitress to tend to our table on top of not putting our replacement order in for the fried rice....which probably was in our best interest.   The manager well...he at least took the fried rice off the bill and offered a free dessert....but honestly, by this point the damage was already done and nothing food related was going to save this visit.

y_W78eL2VZ3sJmwUkUriHQ.text: I visited this restaurant yesterday for the first time. It was busy on a Friday night. I ordered the dim sum and more option. I got half a portion of three different entrees. The food was delicious and portioned out very nicely. I think for the amount of people inside the establishment the food was delivered in a prompt manner. The fried rice was delicious and full of different meats like shrimp, pork and chicken. The sesame salad was kind of bland and I asked for an additional helping of sesame dressing to help it along. I ordered a $14 Sapporro beer which was well worth the value.

ujxuo1Iys-rEqg_sOCPq5g.text: I have to believe that the people who gave this place a high rating are cruise-ship-type people who value quantity way more than quality.    The pot stickers were thick and doughy with some type of too-sour "mango sauce".  I inquired about the more typical soy-based sauce and was told they only had soy sauce.  The crab wontons were also tasteless and served with a sauce that I really could not identify but was not a good match.  I requested sriracha and was told they didn't have any. Mind you, these apps are $15 each.    For my entree, I ordered spicy garlic tomato beef which was neither garlicky nor spicy.  The tomatoes were not even close to ripe and contained large cores and the meat was rubbery.  Also, get this:  The entrees at this Chinese restaurant DO NO INCLUDE RICE even though they are $20.  Plain steamed rice can be added for $3 or fried rice for $8.    The other entree was chow mein and was just ordinary.   I've  had better Chinese food at the mall.  Our bill was $70.  TOTAL RIPOFF

YbzTxYGZVNxzAGe7YTbqXw.text: We had breakfast here one morning. It was okay, not bad, but not good. We just tried it due to proximity and price. The breakfast was only $10.00. If it would have been anymore, it would only have received 2 stars.

CJIn1fpVUWVBbMG_HJ8fJw.text: We decided to give this place a try since its in New York New York and that's the hotel that we are staying at. As a Asian person I usually don't like to go out to eat overpriced Asian food especially a Chinese buffet. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The food was good. Certain items tasted better than others but the presentation was very nice. The dessert table is beautiful. Specific items that stuck out to me would be the chow mein, the barbecued pork and the sushi was pretty good as well. I had an offer for checking into Yelp and for some reason it wasn't redeeming but the girl that stopped by my table and asked if we needed anything else said it wasn't a problem and took care of it for me. That was very nice of her to do. I would definitely return. Service was good and so was the food.

HjvqWX4dEGv9kxH55oolpA.text: Ech. Tso's chicken was semi warm and chewy and had some fishy flavor. We ate maybe 2 or 3 pieces and then asked the waitress not to pack it in a to-go. Chicken Salad was decent, not a $15 type of salad since it only consists of lettuce, chicken strips and peanuts topped with won ton strips. The dressing was alright. We checked in, so we got an entree for $15... But our bill came out to a lot still because considering we missed out on an entire dish, we still got ripped off from the freakin tea was $5 EACH! Total rip off. Not a place I would return to.

3D7lBl7FQpNHCKa4U1Kedg.text: We had the lunch buffet which was delicious. They had a wide variety of Asian food including sushi! As well as a yummy dessert bar. The service was great and our server Jay was very friendly. I would definitely go back and recommend them highly!

jBos0QkaNF9SQ2UDI5jLFA.text: Food is excellent I they deserve 5 stars for sure. Everything tasted great. Fish is absolutely fresh of its kind.

J_-8G3OTirDbZpyku1Sr-g.text: I enjoyed the breakfast quite well. The veggie eggs with goat cheese was refreshing to find in a buffet. Fried rice breakfast style was different but tasty. I like that they also have plain yogurt instead of vanilla or strawberry but they have quite a variety of sinful yuminess too for the eater that is not so health conscious. Staff was pleasant. Smiled and checked on us periodically.

8492MMwx8C-TnahdT-J6XA.text: Horrible food. Our food was cold and extremely salty. This place is basically a gimmick, just look at where it's located. Honestly you would be better off going to Panda Express.

3llg5ERl9bQ5duxRwc6uTQ.text: We actually had the brunch buffet here which I was fairly pleased with.  There is a plenty to choose from and it is a good deal if you want to avoid the more expensive buffets that are found elsewhere around the Strip.  I enjoyed all that I got and my husband loved that fried rice was included on the menu.

bWyfIYbSBUOWgAT3CBatTg.text: Ordered the pepper tofu and was expecting it to be a nice pepper sauce!!! All we got was tofu in pepper with no salt !!! Could not eat it with rice. Had to ask for sauces and fix it on the table. Thanks but I can eat at home if I need to cook my own food !

lNG5oqy9wfemoJWlhMexmw.text: Pedro was a great server. Very polite  definitely would ask for Pedro on the next trip. The food was amazing. All-around a great experience.

cBdOc68BNy5NrIdYr_pVvQ.text: Chin Chin? No no. I will say that the service was fantastic and that is why I gave it the 2nd star, however the food is so bad. The lettuce wraps were the best thing we had but that's not saying much. The potstickers smelled like ass and tasted plain. The apricot chicken was bland and unappetizing and the house noodles tasted smokey and burnt. It was not good. Find another Chinese restaurant.

4u9uMja5hV-QNAAqh48AzQ.text: We were there about 3 weeks ago.  Cody was our waiter and he was very attentive and efficient.  He communicated very well with us.  The food was excellent!

XnuT4Oh6rcOUW8gY0BGMtQ.text: I stopped by for the first time this past weekend and had the lunch buffet, which was very good.  There is a good mixture of Chinese food, sushi, and a few American comfort favorites, like fries and mac and cheese.  What really made my dining experience outstanding was the friendly staff.  I happened to sit at the bar so bartender Tawnya was very helpful and provided excellent service.  Manager Linda also stopped by to make sure I was ok.  There is a large screen TV where you can watch the game while enjoying your favorite beverage.  I'll definitely recommend to others.

puRPRpc4s38qQOYzS5bxYQ.text: Between two Vegas trips, I've now been here three times. Wish I could give half stars, because I'd up this to four and a half if I could. The prices are very, very reasonable ($7 for pork buns, $6-10 for sushi rolls), and the food is top notch. The service is also great. I was nervous about making a 9:30 show across the street at MGM, sitting down to dinner with eight people a little after 8 p.m. We made it back across the street in plenty of time, and the waiter even courteously split our checks.   Word of warning: I'd stick to the sushi and the dumpling-type stuff. The traditional Chinese food here is just average. That's why it gets four and a half stars instead of five. The sushi and the dumplings, on the other hand, are really good.  The first time I went, I got the mongolian beef. Total meh. People who got other, typical Chinese food (lo mein, fried rice, etc.) had similar experiences.   Came back this year and wised up, ordering a spicy tuna roll, some hot and sour soup and the chin chin bao. All of it was top notch. Their spicy tuna, especially, is among the better sushi I've ever had. I tried a little bit of other people's varieties (shrimp tempura, some specialty rolls) and they were really good, too. The Chin Chin bao? Wow. Three puffy, steamed pork buns that pack a delicious barbecue flavor, served with a REALLY spicy wasabi mustard (good if you're in to that, my spicy food loving friends tell me) and a tasty chili sauce for dipping. The buns really fill you up in a good way -- definitely enough for a meal with just them and the sushi. Had some open-faced dumplings that were really good, too.   For ordering two sushi rolls, you get a sizeable jug of hot saki -- a nice touch. They also knew how to make a good Manhattan, though their bourbon selection was limited. I'll definitely be back if I come back to Vegas. Not only is the sushi a nice, light compliment to other heavy meals I'm likely to have, the prices are very low by Vegas strip standards.

qWZPIIGJZNLTNR3r1xQoEg.text: The service was excellent. Really nice waiter and staff. The God was okay. The flavor was decent on one dish where it was lacking in the other dish. Kinda pricey for Chinese food.

vNbs3EhI8OY2sTDwC-Vr9A.text: The buffet was incredible. Jordan was the most thoughtful, hard working waiter I've seen in a long time. Keep up the good work!

U75jvuUGBTF4wo7y-I-SgQ.text: After making this place my first stop in Vegas every year for 10 years this will be my last. Service and good was way off tonight. I could get better at a Panda Express

_fbs_ppEkAjWwVUdiKnVCQ.text: Food is SubPar!! well below average! When a "Resturant" has Pictures in the menu then you know the quality is not going to be great. We ordered War Wonton soup, and 45 minutes later received the wrong order, then waited again for correct order and both broths were reminiscent of what I would imagine fish tank water tastes like. I ordered the Crab Wonton ""Appetizer"" and after a third time asking they showed up at our table after our entire party was done eating... that is Not Acceptable! The Manager was notified by our waiter after complaining about the soups and refusing the appetizer but Never came over to apologize or offer any resolution ... again Not Acceptable! The waiter took the one soup off and the appetizer while missing the wrong order deduction I had the manager come over. He began to argue with irritability that the correct amount was taken off.  in the end I left  hungry and wasted 1hr45min of my time

i_nShqURNY-eIjtGiGfFVw.text: Great food and Jordan the server rocks. Reasonably priced breakfast buffet with tons of choices. Will definitely come back.

CetShhDFojby2zvJfVrUEw.text: We had a shrimp tempura appetizer in a lettuce cup.  Interesting but don't get this as you get 2 pieces of lettuce off of a head of iceberg lettuce filled with some funky crunchy noodle things 1 piece of tempura shrimp and some avocado (you get 2 of these) and eating it is a bitch!!!  A big waste of money.  Everything else we had was good especially the pineapple fried rice!!  The price was about what you will see at all of the other restaurants in Las Vegas.    The server was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.  Overall a very good experience.

kXenlKY_B31wNrlf460xPg.text: We went there for the breakfast buffet.  I wanted to go for the crab cake benedict. They did not disappoint!  They were great!  They had other versions of benedicts if you would prefer. I think Pedro was our server's name.   He was FRICKIN AWESOME.  He was fast and on top of it and so friendly. He is a keeper and you should give him a bonus or employee of the year or something.  Thank you!

3fzwQeVdTeH1nBSp8oxzQg.text: Experienced both the breakfast and lunch buffet. Breakfast was good but the lunch was even better. Took advantage of the Yelp offer for 1 free lunch buffet. Although it's a smaller size buffet than most in Vegas, the food is all delicious and fresh. A few basic types of sushi rolls and Chinese noodles at lunch and then a few types of eggs benedict and some fresh fruits and other things to choose from including free mimosas!

XahOdzGrAwfZDZbfLOYx-g.text: I just stopped by for a couple drinks before a show and the bartender Vanessa was very welcoming & recommended a specialty drink that was delicious! I was impressed with her skill and now it's one of my favorite hidden gems

gKnvjbEAR5qRVsYpzRbYAA.text: Saw that with check in on yelp you get a free lunch buffet. We called before to confirm this was the case and was told yes. After eating, once we were redeeming the offer with the manager we were told it's a buy one get one free, not just free. Still a good deal, but I object to tactics like this. Food was decent and staff was pleasant, but probably won't return because of the misleading tactic to get us in the door. Had they worded it BOGO lunch buffets, would still have gone and been happy.

iE6xcb9OIb9hQXnlJwAWSw.text: Summary/TLDR - Brunch was good, the price wasn't, service was SPECTACULAR, and they'll automatically add tip for a party of 7.  Stopped here for brunch before heading out to the Grand Canyon. The brunch was actually pretty decent. They had eggs (regular, steak and eggs, pepper eggs), waffles, french toast, red velvet pancakes, bacon, sausage... A LOT to choose from! And the food was good! A bit disappointed that they only had syrup up at the buffet though. It would've been nice to have it on the table, but I'm not going to be THAT picky with my review.  I gave it a 3 star rating because although the food was good, it wasn't $17.95 per person good. The price was a bit hard to swallow (no pun intended... well maybe just a little...). Our waiter Cesar was EXTREMELY nice. He made sure we were filled on drinks and had everything we need. The service deserves 5 stars alone!! The other disappointment was that unfortunately Cesar works for a company that will automatically add gratuity of 18% to a check for a party of 7... Anytime a restaurant tells me what I need to pay in gratuity, that's all I'll pay. If I had calculated the tip on my own, he would've likely have gotten 20%+. Way to screw your hard-working and deserving employees.

8yyW1u11g8DTw_CFhIEZKA.text: late breakfast.  awesome service by Sam.  nice to see a service/operations director checking out feedback from guests.  good food that's was delicious and fresh which I think must be hard to do for a breakfast buffet.  Eggs Benedict a couple of ways, nice healthy options with egg whites and other prepared dishes including lots of fruits and vegs, just an overall unexpected surprise for a restaurant in a busy strip hotel.  the line staff were friendly and seemed to be accommodating all kinds of requests for guests who wanted custom orders. fast and ever present service helped us to have full cups of coffee the whole time.  They even gave us a free mimosa, which helped to kick off our day in style.  Thanks Chin people.  well done.  we will definitely be returning

8muNjjQXpiOU3iWEx5MVkw.text: The previous comment is absolutely accurate. This place has the most terrible foods that I have eaten in my entire life. The prices are way higher than the values provided, and sad to say but Panda Express do taste better than this place.

U6_MTlXtaXMpHxbCYS0DQw.text: tasty and fresh..but not the best I've had.. Piedro was nice and helpful... one meal is enough for two if you are not too hungry...the price for a meal is ok if you share it with a friend

NPkNigqAYAzaBJSX2nSaYw.text: The Yellow tail Tuna Sashimi was ok. But the crab roll 'sushi' rice looked like rice from the previous night. It was dry and didn't taste fresh at all. It was edible and thankfully didn't taste stale at least!!!  The chicken fried rice barely had any flavour in it. The chow mein was the best of the lot but that wasn't saying much really. The sweet-corn chicken soup was ok but was really thick and a tad too starchy.  Overpriced and not worth it. Not going there again.

6214-A_Yc3GUVFh6_jnF_g.text: We came in for dinner on a Wednesday night and this place was empty.  We were seated right away and we got a waitress that must have been new because she kept messing up.  We ordered pot stickers...curry chicken RICE...and peanut noodles.  Yeah it's kind of a strange combination but so what...we were on vacation.  After about 15 minutes of placing our order we get out pot stickers and as we were finishing them our waitress comes back and asks us what else we ordered besides the peanut noodles.  Why didn't she ask sooner...why should she even have to ask at all...I could have sworn I saw her write it down.  So anyways, I told her chicken curry...and then she says oh yeah I remember...so I mistakenly thought she remembered that I said chicken curry RICE!  Another 15 minutes later our order comes out and guess what...we didn't get the chicken curry rice...it was just their chicken curry dish...but we decided not send it back because we didn't want to wait another 15 minutes.  My friend didn't like the pot stickers or the peanut noodles.  I personally thought everything was O.K.  If you order their noodles they are VERY generous on the portions...too generous actually.  Our waitress came back only once and then I had to flag her down for more refills.  It was just an O.K. experience.  If I were really craving Chinese food I would come back.

DdqUUYRJno-ZGhVEWi5rKQ.text: Nice clean place!  food is good and the only issue I had is that they serve more veggies than meat.

jyp7RbnLHFRrl3cXwpisKA.text: This restaurant is my favorite place on the strip to eat and my favorite thing about staying in the NYNY hotel. Not only can I eat my meal in the bar, close to the casino, but the yakisoba noodle dish I order - each and every time I stay here - is bombdiggity.  I know it's weird to like a restaurant this much, over just one dish...however; when you find something you really, really like, you must stick with it. That means, I will walk over from the MGM or the Excalibur (God forbid I have to ever stay there again) or catch the tram from the Luxor or Mandalay Bay to have my favorite bowl of yakisoba. After all, buffets are only fun the 1st day or 2. Then, it's just too much and too expensive (the average about $25 now and higher on Sunday mornings).  The restaurant itself is clean and lovely, especially for a Chinese restaurant. No offense, but Chinese restaurants are usually adorned with dated Chinese decor. This place is modern, light and sparse. Not dark and spooky (at least, that's what the Chinese restaurants in Portland are like).  I don't have plans to visit Vegas in the near future, but can say for certain that I will eat here when I return.

2IVNc_NRO6btWRXTLiyBOQ.text: Chin Chin at the New York New York Casino & Resort is one of the best in Vegas!! It has a pleasant atmosphere with excellent service and even better food. I got the Chinese Chicken Salad, which is to die for, the dressing makes the salad. I had it every day for lunch during my stay. Kyle, I believe to be the General Manager came to my table to make sure all was good, and it was! 5 stars to them! Next time I'm in Vegas, I will be coming here and so should you!!

6WwfRBhHpIHcjXTc_xY87w.text: In terms of quality of food I have better.   Not saying it bad but for the price they charge the food should've been better.  But then again this is Las Vegas.  If you are going there for a fast bit to eat and with a group then you're good to go.   If you are doing the solo thing or a couple thing I would look for another spot.  I'm sure your money will buy you much more someplace else.

nvimtYRRZP9NslTz97ZmDQ.text: My Parents had a comp here and we ordered seven things.  They were all yummy.  We ordered Almond chicken, tangerine beef, sesame chicken salads, pineapple fried rice, wor wonton, eggplant garlic, and sweet and sour shrimp.   All great with less oil.  Next time, maybe I will check out their lettuce wrap.

asBMxWzKW1iASOB43o0aFw.text: My husband and I decided to explore Chinese food in Vegas.... we were pleased to come across Chin Chin @ NY NY. We were seated promptly by our very nice hostess are server was Cory he was prompt friendly and very attentive to our needs.. the manager came and asked us how our dinner was and we had the amazing tangerine beef! Ask for Cory he is a great server and very helpful...

UUzWzNRJ_w8-qgL-MEmcWA.text: Chris is one of the best waiters I've ever had. The food is spectacular although isn't unique. It's just very good Chinese food and sushi. The service is excellent too. Great Food Great Service If in New York New York I highly recommend.

lzv5fAMu8kNJitscDrZVaQ.text: We come here 3x a year and always have a few meals here. Haven't had one bad thing. These are great: veggie chow mein, string beans, steamed broccoli, eggplants, orange chicken, Kung pao shrimp.

O6n-f0B0f71lO5rnFwl-TA.text: I'm in Vegas at least twice a year for buisness and try to visit diffrent restaurants when I can. This time i met a friend at New York New York and we decided to got to the Chinese restaurant. The server informed us that the portions are large and it's recommended to eat family style. We were plesent surprised that the portions were indeed large.  This is odd since most places on the strip over charge for food. I had the Mongolian Beef which was perfectly glazed with green onions nestled atop a bed of crispy white noodles. We also ordered the sweet and sour shrimp which actually came with too much shrimp.  I asked the server for some pepper oil, which arrived a warm in a gravy boat with large red peppers. The food quality was top notch, fulok flavor and plenty to go around. From beginning to end the experience was incredible. I will surely visit in the future.

CMa126VX8BldSIFN9x3rdw.text: The food was excellent. The service was very attentive. The dining environment was very relaxing.

gn3YL6L74FO9Ywebi509kA.text: Sushi was good, but overpriced by a lot. The Sushi chef thought he was all mighty and talked derogatory about the other employees. We were sitting right there not like we could here. Just bad business. We ordered Sushi that was a special order, but the waitress got the wrong order. It was then given to another table that ordered one not fresh. Will definitely go elsewhere.

DO9M30De-_a8TY1aQCHlNQ.text: Are we really putting soy beans on our soy beans when we dip our edamame in soy sauce?  Our waitress seemed to have answers to all of our questions, including how soy sauce is made.  Her friendly attitude, professionalism, knowledge and service bumped up this 3 star food review to a 4 star overall review.  The extra fortune cookie for my daughter certainly helped!    I would much rather eat somewhere with 3 star food and 4 star service than the reverse.  The happy hour for lunch is a good bet if you are on a budget, with an extra hand roll if you buy two.

jMujiCp97AmcaKgHE2aLGA.text: WONDERFUL. The service & food were amazing. The way this restaurant is decorated is very nice as well. Our server was very nice and helpful and very attentive. The food was amazing, it's family sized plates so we ordered 3 plates: Beef & Broccoli, Orange Chicken, & Chicken Chowmein. All we're good and filling. Although I noticed they were a bit skimpy on the meat but still I enjoyed. I will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

bXIf7mkUWmgcsdlJK-Tnlg.text: Its a decent asian buffet style at NYNY hotel, staff are very attentive, friendly as well as their manager. Will come back and try their buffer breakfast.

Dnt107zqfEC4b138JCy66w.text: Second time the charm, had dinner here last night, and what a difference.  First, the waitstaff Oscar and Craig were friendly and professional and made the dining experience even better. The restaurant itself has an extremely friendly vibe, and everyone goes out of their way making sure you are satisfied.  The meal itself from appetizer to desert was delicious and well presented.  The portions are also plentiful. I am very happy that I gave Chin Chin a second chance!  As a Las Vegas local, I would be happy to bring out of town guests here for dinner.

6sSbLs1BuX40KCE46SH30A.text: AMAZING EXPERIENCE!!!!!!!!! FOOD- 5 stars (salt and pepper shrimp) SERVICE- 5 stars ATMOSPHERE- 5 stars  I never would have thought such a good chinese restaurant could be slapped in the middle of Vegas. Will definitely be coming back

CUdu65MQQsv29dVy3uKvug.text: Very very good food and customer service. Our waiter Pedro did an excellent job and was extremely welcoming to us.

TrYhdGzIWRk9bnBrOhuWMA.text: Wow!! Never am I disappointed by service, quality or price.. If you want custom sushi hand rolls or a low carb options the sushi chefs accommodate.  Much thanks to Koona... Every time I have special requests she knows just how to please.   I only wish it wasn't so far from DFW.  See you all in a few months.

mAmaFgMpJcwa0-LyuNUxLA.text: Very expensive breakfast buffet, but there were not a lot of choices. I didn't even find the milk.

quDUOCg0vbC-8_vYhG0Hvg.text: Had the lunch buffet and it was awesome! Great service and great selection. I would definitely go back.

PjvUpvm9xvNjos-7n118Rw.text: The buffet was not that good for a Las Vegas buffet. The passion fruit mojito was good but the service was not. Friendly people but our waiter seemed to of gotten lost to our table or in the restaurant.

QjFbC5WCZ8P7J8kQDyKn-w.text: My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of having early morning buffet breakfast on our vacation stay at NYNY. Our experience was strongly defined by the personable service we received by Pedro. Pedro was professional and prompt in his service. He provided an exceptional experience in a carrying and knowledgable manner. Pedro's unique personable behavior and excellent customer service is what will make us repeat customers in the future.

IbWjC7fJTxQ24eB4MVBkrQ.text: For Americanized Chinese food it was really good the general chicken was one of the best I've had. The hot and sour soup was just okay though. The service was very attentive and the management was very active in backing up their servers. The prices were pretty good for the strip. If I stay at the hotel again or a near by one even I'm coming back.

rRc4DM0atrqYrQUI2_aIfQ.text: Had the pleasure of dining at Chin Chin 3/24/16. The service was great. Everyone was polite from the hostess to the bus person. The sushi was presented beautifully  and tasted great. The entrees were large portions, and exactly as described. This is not a real Chinese/Thai restaurant. it's an American Chinese/Thai Restaurant. - very much like PF Changs. Good food, but no WOW.

RZAkJEk8DNxIqXV-DWy3EA.text: Bok Choy  and mushroom entree with the spicy eggplant sauce. The nice man working at the bar recommended it and said it was his favorite. What a great recommendation! Thank you, Sir!

CwACLJ3cGAIPbh4f3v9B2Q.text: I came here to cure a hangover. To cure a hangover in Hawaii, I would eat pho or dim sum so I came here in search of some great dim sum. Well, you're definitely not going to find it here. The dim sum came in metal steamers which I thought was odd. I've only seen wooden ones before. I soon found out why most places use wooden ones... Because the dim sum sticks to the metal ones, causing all the fillings to come out of the unwrapped dumpling!  I ordered the wonton soup... The soup was so bland that I may have been drinking hot water and I wouldn't have known the difference.   Our table shared some other "traditional" Chinese dishes and they all sucked. To top everything off, the service was one of the worst. He never refilled our water, never came by to check on us so we couldn't let him know how awful the food was and he took forever to bring out the check.   The reason we chose this place? I overheard two separate strangers that Chin Chin had great Chinese food. They serve sushi here too. What kind of Chinese restaurant serves sushi? This kind! The sucky kind!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary

qHa3yyPSFnZ5J3g5b6NWrg.text: The management staff with Andrea at the helm is fantastic.   She is striving to take an already popular restaurant and make it even better inch by inch.  That appears to be her mantra.   The food served at the bar was great served by baby girl and the breakfast buffet was off the chain!!!  The nigiri sake complimented the atmosphere and was the highlight of my night.  But I can't forget the hosts and were so professional and pleasant, especially Sara.   You should visit the place just to receive their great service.  No doubt I will be visiting this joint in the future.   New York New York is where the foodies come to party.

oA07CR3_AOFP4GcMi7BsjQ.text: Staying in New York New York this is a very convenient breakfast stop.  4 of us had the breakfast buffet which was loaded with all of the classics plus a few surprises like breakfast fried rice.  All very good.  The coffee seemed very bitter and had a weird taste, the only disappointment in our visit.  Linda & Johana were very helpful in making our visit a 4 star.  You just can't beat great service while nursing a hangover.  Overall a great breakfast spot, we will have to try the lunch next time.

ksoR7mbRHzFyuDJTur301g.text: THE FOOD IS AWFUL.   Things ordered: - fried pork wontons. Over fried and greasy. The pork was flavorful, but the grease kind of undercut it and made it not great.  - tofu chow mein. To me, chow mein means fried noodles. I got lo mein. And the tofu was cold in the middle. I realize that working with soft tofu is difficult, but that shouldn't mean that you add it in last, leave it to cook for a minute and serve it when it's still cold. - lemon chicken. Fiance got this. Apparently it was typical fried lemon chicken. Can't really go wrong.   They also charge you for rice. $1.50 for steamed rice, $5.50 for a small fried rice and $7.50 for a large fried rice. Maybe it's just because it's Vegas pricing, but it's a little ridiculous.

KL_4fIPOcSUkmNwQkGsZBg.text: We went here for their breakfast buffet.  Wow this place gets mixed reviews from me.  First, he price is reasonable, $18 for a breakfast buffet is not too bad.  The food was actually pretty good, the problem is the buffet is not stocked very well at all, the first time we went up three quarters of the food was empty.  The server was funny and nice but he was very slow and they were busy but the place was not packed.  But when the food was stocked it was pretty good and I left happy.

76lyAe-7HV74RTGV20dY7w.text: Over priced, greasy crap. For $20 per person I expected better. Half the items I couldn't eat due to shellfish being so prevalent. Worst meal we had all week while in town. Never ever again.

t2MYkSv6fzczlGeHfY4YNA.text: Chinese cuisine is something I really enjoy. We had a stop at the Newyork casino in Vegas at Chin Chin for our lunch. It appeared really expensive. Though we were in a dilemma we wanted to have our meal there, and thus went. Not being sure of the taste there we wanted to be on a safer side instead of experimenting. So we ordered a chicken fried rice. Trust me when I say this that this was the best chicken fried rice I have ever tasted in my entire life. Best flavour with best ambience and best hospitality staff. Its been almost 3 months that I had this meal and I still cherish it. Amazing food! I admit that I dint try other dishes but am sure that the restaurant has good flavours in the air. A must visit when you go to vegas! And yes the price was very reasonable. We had one chicken fried rice for 10bucks. One awesome experience! Thumbs up and cheers!

g2mQcSsCMuADdX8b4kLAzg.text: Went with a big group. Our service was very good. I had the vegetable pot stickers and veggie lettuce wraps. Both were better than I expected. The lettuce wraps came with this fantastic fried tofu with so much flavor I thought I was eating teriyaki chicken. Overall this place is pretty casual, a combination of all types of "american" asian food from Chinese to sushi. Overall, the food was not very authentic but, for the price, pretty good.

kAl9iKdPYj1EY_PgevIHbA.text: We had sushi, 2 entrees.  California roll, spicy tuna roll, shrimp tempura.  Pad Thai and Honey shrimp.$75 total bill. It was definitely a poor man's PF Changs. Sushi was very low rated. Pad Thai was terrible. Honey shrimp was ok. Spend your money on a good piece of pizza across the way.

VEnXCokUdeYH8w9BmEjJGA.text: Pretty disappointing. Been in the US travelling for 1 month and this was by far the slowest service of the whole trip. Took 15 minutes to get beer. 30 minutes for our steamed dumpling entree of Shu Mai. And 40 minutes for main. Mongolian Beef was way too saucy and sweet and the Fried Rice actually had nothing in it, just soy sauce rice! Would not recommend to anyone, plenty of other good options at New York New York Hotel.

UZAt14hHAqcotdoX_OOaCA.text: Our consensus: Some of the best tasting sushi rolls and stir fry. We had the red dragon roll and the kung pao three treasures. We split these two dishes between two people and it left us feeling perfectly full and satisfied. The red dragon rolls are huge, beautiful and super tasty with fresh tuna on top. The king pao three treasures dish included shrimp, chicken and beef in a mandarin sauce, both spicy and mildly sweet. Our excellent waiter was Randall and he provided friendly customer service.

LNMTXyES8V-eFDUHJuV3PA.text: Awesome sushi. Ask for crispy flakes and spicy mayo...my favorites. April was awesome and got us in and out quick. Thank you!

lg3Z_9O_0V7m6__0YD6Cbg.text: This restaurant is located right by the elevator to our room.  We stopped by here numerous times before heading up to our room for drinks only.  Here's what I remember....  In Vegas and needed a couple drinks to take back to the room to enjoy the hot tub.  12 oz Bud=$7.00 22 oz Sapparo=$9.00 Vodka soda=$11.00 "Strong"Vodka soda=$11.00  I didn't eat here but got drinks numerous times.  I strongly suggest using the word "strong" when ordering mixed drinks instead of using the word "double."  The breakfast buffet looked average, although we didn't try it.  Will I again?.. No because I won't be staying at New York New York again.  Tootles

-Uzee6PcRZcSjt_p4cQg7g.text: I needed a light meal after a week of food-pounding.  The summer rolls with shrimp at chin chin was perfect.  Light with fresh vegetables.

M2Alw35sX3P_wbHuBKGlSw.text: Consider Chin Chin as a step up from P.F. Chang's, only with sushi. And that sushi was all right; I noticed lots of the spicier rolls included the ever-dreaded spicy mayo on them. Which, by the way, when did mayo on sushi become all the rage? It's gross!  The server, however, was very accommodating and a sweetheart for breaking up checks for a group of 13.

uny77jqxY9JDmZcK8bnISw.text: 3.0 Stars  I was walking through New York New York and noticed they had a Chinese eatery option. I'm in Vegas for a conference so I figured I'd gives this place a try to get some variety from the typical conference food.  To layout my expectations, I grew up in San Francisco where I was actually spoiled with Chinese food that was big portioned, cheap, and tasty.  I decided to order the Singapore Noodles for $12.95.  I noticed this noodle dish didn't have the Hot & Spicy symbol so I decided to ask them to make it a little more spicy for me.  My dish consisted of:  *Shrimp *BBQ Pork *Bean Sprouts *Onions *Bell Peppers *Rice Noodles *Curry Sauce  When the plate came out I noticed it was HUGE. I saw one giant mound of noodles and I was ready to tackle it!    The noodles themselves were done nicely where they still had a little springiness.  It was stir fried in a curry sauce, but I wasn't able to taste much of the curry flavor.  Even though I asked them to make it spicy they actually just added some roasted chili peppers into my dish. My server was nice enough though to bring me some extra chili sauce.   I poked around my noodles and noticed they were really sparing with the ingredients. I found myself actually eating a lot of noodles before I got to any of the shrimp or BBQ pork.  Chin Chin does a decent job of providing traditional Chinese food in a casual cafe setting. My server was overall really nice and attentive.  The price was reasonable for Las Vegas, but in terms of flavor and taste it still made me long for some cooking back at home.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Singapore Noodles
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chin Chin Chinese Restaurant Sign

pZLoRH4oZ0QwnVgyqq_zdQ.text: Enjoyed our crab wontons, pineapple fried rice, and orange chicken. Great service from the hostess and Julianna.

WryhRP13FiI54K0Z8ZUDCg.text: After looking up all the other, more unique, Chinese food restaurant reviews in Vegas, we decided to go to Chin Chin.  I didn't feel like paying 3 times as much for food that got worse reviews than this chain.  I'd been to the one here in Southern California and knew we'd have a good meal.  And we did!  The reservation we made was necessary on a Saturday night, but I think we called an hour before hand.  We both got drinks off their signature list.  They were strong, like we like em'.  I got the orange soda one and loved it!  They also have a full bar, naturally, Vegas...as well as a pretty good Sake list.    The hot and sour soup was a perfect starter.  I hadn't had it since my favorite, family owned, place down the street from me closed, probably because of their C rating, but that didn't stop me...they had a B when I started going there.  Anywho...it was good if not better than the homemade stuff they made.  Our dishes came out fast, which normally isn't a problem, but we were trying to kill time.  Again, it's a Chinese food place, food usually doesn't take that long to cook.  Both our dishes were delicious.  I got the 3 meat kung pao.  It wasn't as spicy as I normally like it but the chicken, beef, and shrimp mix was excellent.    My girlfriend got the orange chicken and I was kind of upset I didn't either. I'm a sucker for it, and they did an excellent job.  Perfect amount of crispy, it's breaded, but not soggy.  Gah! I hate soggy Chinese food.  The peppers were fresh and tasty as well.  Vegas has many options for food, almost too many, but if your craving consistent quality Chinese at a good price, you can't beat Chin Chin.  They also have a good selection of Japanese dishes along with Sushi and Noodles.  So you've got options.

s2itnBb1l2wnvMqblw23Vg.text: My wife and I had a lovely buffet lunch here. I'm not usually a big fan of Chinese food but here it was delicious. Nothing was too sweet or artificially flavoured and everything was very tasty. There wasn't a large choice but what there was was well cooked and presented. Deserts were really nice too, more sweets and cakes that traditional Chinese but all were nice. Price was very reasonable too

7YmGW1_UkBFsvAy_1Lo4Sg.text: We went here for Breakfast Buffet on a Monday morning because we wanted to ride the roller coaster and I knew this restaurant would not be busy.  It wasn't and we were seated right away.  The buffet is a blend of American breakfast items and a few Chinese items.  I was disappointed there weren't more Chinese items on the buffet but it was still pretty darned good.  American:  Fruit, waffles, scrambled eggs, bacon (good), link sausage (good, large, delicious).  Chinese:  Egg rolls, Fried rice, and BBQ Pork that was REALLY good.  Service was fairly good.  Food was hot.  A tad spendy but not bad for Vegas.  Not a destination but good if you're nearby.

nxKa_JIQ75NAcu_fV_7jUg.text: First I like you o know that I travel most of the time by myself, and with that said I,  I had one of the most amazing times at Chin Chin!!! The three people at the bar were awesome made me feel like I was one of their family members. Never felt like I was alone sitting there Dana was one of the most attentive bartenders I've ever met!!! Again I travel for a living and bartenders like that our award winners! I have eaten at chin chins in California most of them, by far this young lady takes the cake of bartenders at Chin Chin, she has a  award winning smile that Chin Chin should have for all there employee! The sushi chef was also awesome Ben! I had a great time to talking to both of them and the third bartender. Chin chins you have 3 great individual people working for you! Hats off to you!!!

MD86P9Oap6WcHF38B-NfMw.text: Great Restaurant next to The New Yorker Tower Elevators and The American Style Breakfast Buffet is Amazing!

vn70oywDcwzdDRnHBu3qEA.text: Their food is pretty average..We ordered california roll and although it tasted fresh, it was just plain average.Their vegetable dumplings were good.Also their Singapore noodles were tad bland and not enough meat or vegetables.Their Flat noodles were the only thing I raved about at that meal.Service is great.There are better places around.
