Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flat Noodles

MpAbzyBKSAmS5q8N5x0JnQ.text: Ate here twice for dinner. There are decent choices for vegetarians and vegans. We had string beans,veggie dumplings, veggie spring rolls and veggie sushi. Food was great and service was EXCELLENT!

0kDpZDuQtPVG2jMkWQ6Gcg.text: Great tasting food! The thing that put this to 5 stars is definitely the awesome service. Hostess was pleasant and very friendly. Our waiter Oscar M did everything to make sure our visit was the best possible! Thank you very much!

i55oVSORxMjkGnIR7ZWeNQ.text: The food was good. The staff was very attentive. Ate here twice on my trip to Vegas.  Had the seafood noodles which were excellent and the sushi was great too.

AUdTcQIY5OxwLsXDTdwyZg.text: Randomly came across this place & enjoyed the atmosphere, service & food. I had a chicken dumpling which was really good & the chicken chow mien which I devoured it was so good, also a huge portion. Little pricey but that's expected from any restaurant inside a casino. I'd like to go back to try some of their sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q8w3ZaU59qt9vT3dYHN0yw.text: The Waitress was great, very helpful and recommended the orange chicken which was amazing with extra spice.  My friend had the walnut shrimp which he said was delicious as well.  As a starter, we had the dumplings with cilantro sauce which I would highly recommend as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Rice
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Walnut Shrimp
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Chicken

tmzLrz8y5pnNGbRNELzMAw.text: Great food and great service.  My 10yo actually asked to spend his birthday at the New York New York.  It's our first night and everything was great.  Our server Pedro was great and full of energy and made it a great dining experience.  Mongolian Beef, Crispy Orange Chicken, Chicken Fried Rice were all great!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ggmTxpwVA2MA5QZpdR1RiA.text: We ate  the breakfast buffet yesterday morning. We got there fairly early and all of the items appeared to have been sitting out for a long time and was cold. I do not recommend this place for breakfast.

QhCMIWNG6DlnEKkXFnrYDA.text: We just love this place- we come here everytime we are in Vegas. We love the atmosphere, food and great staff. Yesterday we had David and he just really made our night more fun as well as was a wonderful server! Highly recommend!

0EQhkSh8vKgCL3YkCAaRSQ.text: My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo next door to New York New York and were looking for breakfast buffets for a big meal to hold us the rest of the day till dinner time.  The Monte Carlo breakfast buffet was OK but we found Chin Chin when we decided to try a different place, and Boy, are we glad we did!  The food was fantastic and the servers were top rate and super friendly.   You can get a custom made huge omelet with just about anything you can think of inside if you want.  My favorite was the Meat Lovers omelet with juicy tender steak, bacon, sausage and ham inside.  I also asked them to put cheddar cheese inside and it was fantastic! They have everything else including regular french toast, french toast stuffed with cream cheese, pancakes, real sliced ham roast, great crispy has browns and tons of sweet breakfast type deserts.  We loved it so much we ate breakfast there for three mornings straight!  For about $22 a person you can't beat it.  Much better than a hotel buffet where the food has been sitting for so long, they made everything new as the food got low, so everything was super fresh!  We will be back there the next time we are in Vegas for sure!

QuFPovlqRvPAim2cs_10_g.text: The sushi wasn't amazing but the waiter Pedro was so nice. I wasn't impressed by the food at all didn't like the flavors in the sushi ordered as well got soup wasn't that great.

mlnIYs3qvi0EILxM3jn6iw.text: So good and big portions! We had the Hawaiian roll, pad Thai and ahi poki. Poki was a little disappointing. Good flavor but mostly seaweed salad a a little poki. But the pad Thai & Hawaiian roll made up for it.

VFyaUEaYMAvM-oM0quHdNA.text: Breakfast was good.  Nice selection and they had two for one today.    We had dinner last night here. Food had a sweet taste so considering all we give it 3 stars

0sx4SgBltM0L5Sehgp5dFA.text: Great buffet with a great price that includes the $5 drink. Gluten free options made to order. Friendly staff and knowledgeable about celiac diet.

KgHDuN16MFx4ffalTbJeVw.text: I've been to Chin Chin on Sunset in LaLa lots of times.  Fun place to enjoy tasty dim sum and a great Asian salad.  Unfortunately, the Las Vegas version is not up to the same standards.    Judging just the food - I ordered a steamed fish entree.  They insist the fish was fresh - not frozen but I don't believe them.  The fish appeared cooked on top but the undersides were grey and cold.  I can't imagine any way this could happen unless the fish was frozen.  I returned it and they removed the charge from my bill, but I lost my appetite after that.  Our one order of dim sum was the shui mai.  They were huge - cooked to order so we had to wait - but it was worth it. The lettuce wrapped chicken was typical of nearly every Chinese restaurant I've been in.  Nothing special.  Service was a bit unprofessional. I think they could cut out the socializing between the wait staff and concentrate on providing better service and a better product. Our tab was in the $135 range including tip - before the credit for the frozen fish - for two, so I think it's fair to compare Chin Chin's service to other restaurants in this price range. If you like being called "you guys" by the wait staff - this is your kind of place.  I left with a bad taste in my mouth - literally - and all other ways.

Co-_WLLo0uyqijo5Mje0Rg.text: Great service, food was pretty good too. We went in for breakfast and chose to order from the menu instead of the buffet. Payed $20 for the salmon and egg bao and chin chin eggs, felt pretty full afterwards. I recommend ordering from the menu because you can get two dishes for the price of the buffet.

9StpIpVnCzA_I1WcUoTmUg.text: Delicious food! Our service was great! Thanks to our server Ryan. The food came out really fast for a busy Saturday night. Would recommend to try this before a Zumanity show!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bpx_DoPjkGoMQazAL0XS_g.text: I like Chin Chin. It's always been by the elevator at New York, NY... I love that I can wake up and eat close by. I usually show up to have the end of the breakfast and then it goes into lunch, so you get the best of both worlds. They have great drinks and good service. There are usually people handing out coupons too. For the 3 of us, plus 2 alcoholic drinks, 2 regular drinks... it was around $100 but was worth it.

I-dRS04NMaPfCsNhuSi4pg.text: My husband and I have walked past this restaurant for years the only reason would be we had no clue that they had more then just Sushi as a main dish.  Well this stop did not disappoint. We were greeted by a wonderful Waiter names Dexter.  He was amazing and made us feel that we could ask questions!!  He started off with a football conversation then explained that he would help us order enough but not too much food with was awesome since we have never been here before and have no room for leftovers.  We ordered a "safe" plate of California Roll Sushi and it was a perfect suggestion!! Loved it. As far as our meal went I ordered sweet and sour chicken and my husband ordered Broccoli and Beef.  Both were amazing the chicken was flavored perfectly not too spicy and very moist.  The beef and Broccoli was excellent also with no fatty pieces of meat and the broccoli not soft.  Perfect experience please look up this restaurant and if Dexter is working request his table!!! Top 3 Server of all time!!!!

CFvbXmIt2AK4xNMIRAgWBg.text: The Las Vegas Strip has kneeled down to The Great Buddha and he's responded by granting  them Chin Chin's at The New York New York casino.  Wow, Chin Chins has been a favorite of mine since the 80's since I started dining at The West Hollywood location. Whether you get the dim-sum combo that gives you get 3 mini choices or should order off the menu I guarantee disappointment is not an option, just tasty bliss. The Chinese chicken salad is a must for any meal. Now some major items worth sampling are BBQ pork, potstickers, Szechwan dumplings ( in a  cilantro sauce ) or Gift Wrapped chicken then kick off your meal. Phase 2 of your Chin Chin journey offers you The honey prawns , King Pao Chicken or Mongolian Beef are excellent choices, so try one  and maybe the green bean dish to balance your veggies out from all flesh you'll eat.  Frank give this place a 10 Star double thumbs up review but Yelp only offers 5 so that's what you get!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Valentines Day Cookies
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian Beef
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange chicken

NVlE3lF3lFzbAWQmkskWQA.text: Food: B Price: B Location: A Authenticity: D Customer Service: C  Chin Chin is located in the New York New York Hotel and it's not by any means an authentic Chinese restaurant.  They serve "Americanized" Chinese food which isn't a bad thing but when it comes with poor service, the experience just isn't that great.  We were lucky enough not to have to wait for a table.  It was a Friday night and the restaurant wasn't that busy so that should have been my first inclination that maybe we should have dined elsewhere.  The hostess was pretty friendly and welcoming.  However, our server was a different story.  She had an attitude and it was apparent that she hates her job.  She kind of rushed us while ordering and basically threw something on there that we really didn't ask for.  She took the liberty of ordering the sampler of appetizers for us.  Even though we knew what she did, we didn't decline as we were unsure of what appetizers to get anyway.    The food was good, not great, and like I said, it is definitely not authentic Chinese food.  Their fried rice was very similar to Panda Express (Chinese fast food chain), so really nothing special there.  The Mongolian Beef was pretty tasty but they overloaded it with green onions.  I'd say the Sweet and Sour Pork and the appetizer sampler were the winners of our meal.  What I thought was strange was that they have sushi on the menu.  I didn't care to give it a try because I don't go to Chinese restaurants for Japanese food.  They have some pretty good cocktails but be prepared to spend some money on them.  What do you expect; this is a restaurant in a hotel on the Strip.  Would I dine here again?  Probably not.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian beef...way too much green onions.
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet and sour pork

5wEkR26f2sBIuGUfno_HUw.text: It's decent its cold taste like microwave but the service was excellent the waitress was excellent but the quality was not

Jr5koFfaRyFZI7Vy5LfXAw.text: We finally went to Chin Chin after passing by it a bunch of times.   I am definitely glad we went in, because we had some great food for the price!  I have a gluten allergy, and they have an entire section of their menu without gluten! They have a chicken dish, gluten free, that wasn't that great. The spring rolls had a lot of basil in them which overpowered the flavor. So at first, I was a little worried about what was to come.   However, their Mongolian beef made up for all of it! I swear it had crack in it. Perfectly cooked, not too sweet, not too many onions, just great. I could eat it any day! They also had gluten free crab and asparagus fried rice. Now, it comes without any real sauce, but they give you GF Soy sauce. Even without the sauce it was great! We couldn't stop eating it! Not greasy, totally hit the spot. They also had a noodle dish that was good too -  a little greasy, but slightly crispy noodles with a light sauce + beef. Yum.   I gave it 4 stars because the food was pretty good, but the service was great too. We brought my 18 month old when we went, and the server was super friendly and kept giving him chopsticks and made him laugh. Friendly, knowledgeable, and all around good experience. We will definitely come here again!  P.S. They are able to do some sushi rolls gluten free too. I got their salmon cut roll, and even though at first I thought it was too pricey, the roll is huge! Tons of salmon, not too much rice, totally worth the price. The salmon was delicious too - not slimy or fishy. Fresh and tasty!

xMIqXrJOBFfuJt-yPXALcA.text: This is a knock off of a PF Chang, just ok , the hostess was the best, she was sweet and held our table for us , the waitress was not good, I had to ask 3 times for my baby girl to just get plain white rice, we had been traveling, checked into the hotel and  we were hungry and tired, the food was nothing to write home about , I have had better. I will not go back here as this is Vegas and SO many other GREAT places to eat, and with great customer service. By the way the rice finally came, after she fell asleep in my arms.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dLjjKWYCokiqG4kxvW4mug.text: Coming for the very first time to Vegas with no idea what to expect but starving after driving all night breakfast and coffee we're the first thing in my mind. We were looking to grab a quick breakfast and when we arrived to chin chins we were just seated, I thought we were going to get o offered a menu but right away a very friendly waiter arrived to our table and  explained to us how the buffet worked.  So after asking the price which is 20$ per person I was kinda expecting something really delish and outta the norm. Ummm...no, the only really delish thing there we're two small cranberry cheesecake muffin bites which those probably come from a bakery. The eggs were either greasy or rubbery just like the hash brown patties, the granola was stale, the coffee was weak, the plates and utensils were still dirty with food stuck to them...the only good thing there was the ham and the service. This was not worth the price if you just want a quick meal, since it was my first time in vegas and had no idea where anything was, no one outta of the few staff workers I asked had told me there was a Dennys around the corner and other more economic choices than this place. *sigh oh well you live and learn right?

ZxZXpfjv7QijHLfJ3C7o9g.text: The breakfast buffet is delicious and if you sit at the bar, your first mimosa or Bloody Mary is only $1. Plus the bartender April is a total sweetie and can make a mean Bloody Mary.

PPfgjEAtRogyAcoqTDFzrg.text: Not sure why all the bad reviews.  I ate at Chin Chin yesterday for lunch and found it pretty damn good.  I think peoples expectations are way to high, this is hardly a restraunt, more like a very nice cafe.  Anyways, I ordered the tangerine beef (which does come with rice, I read a review that said it did'nt?) and my wife ordered chow mein with shrimp.  Both of our meals were very good, same quality as a P.F. Changs. Prices were very reasonable considering it is in a nice hotel, we paid $44 for our meal, that's with tax and tip. All in all, we will definately go here again if we are craving chinese on our next trip. Only reason for not giving five stars is because I only give 5 stars to a place that blows my mind.  4 stars for me is above average.

Jbh9UnrpdC4XGWyZXvPekA.text: meals do not come with rice. way too expensive. get up and leave. wish I did  chicken tastes old. dirty dishes.  I would give it 1 star but the manager took off $5, what a joke.

NGwsk-47Md60qFYZqHyJWw.text: The food here is pretty much inedible. We tried a number of different things and the only thing ok was a California roll from the sushi bar. The low point was the peanut noodles with chicken. It was a mushy pile of goo that tasted like rancid peanut butter. Two bites, pushed it away. Waiter noted that most of the items were not touched and actually asked if we wanted it to go. Really? How about asking "Did the food really suck? Or did you just order a bunch of stuff to throw away cuz your not hungry?" Seriously, I don't think they even realize it's bad. Only good news is that by Vegas standards it is relatively inexpensive, we only flushed about 50 bucks down the toilet....

bKgL6ZZrafNc676tFvZjjw.text: You are really hungry and you suddenly happen of a chinese/sushi restaurant. Nothing to write home about maybe apart from that tuna tartar appetizer.

8qfcgBrXE_lSho6M69zKgQ.text: Our server Terryl was the best server we had our entire trip to Vegas.  the food was great too.  Kung pao chicken was delish.

hiQIQGlpffIeY5J-o0Fyxg.text: Ordered the California rolls, beef chow fun and a teriyaki bowl togo and ate in our hotel room.  Chow fun was bland even thought it looked favorable. The beef tasted a lil sour. Teriyaki bowl was terrible. Chicken was way over cooked and dry...kind of hard. The sauce was did not taste like teriyaki sauce. It actually had a slight sour taste to it and kind of like the beef. Maybe they used the same marinate. My bf and I couldn't brig ourselves to take a second bite and we had to throw it out. The California rolls were pretty good though. Should have ordered more of those. :(

1RSkyUMRBa6gmAfVP3OxJA.text: Great welcoming staff & friendly service.  The sushi was just average.  It need some improving.  Also, there was a mess up on the order that shouldn't of be missed.

ZT0HyU6rEIbxkoGH9Odq6w.text: It's no secret that I'm a huge fan of all types of Asian food. When I noticed that there was a breakfast buffet at this establishment I was instantly filled with all kinds of wild thoughts... what would a pan-asian breakfast buffet be like? This is something I wanted to have in my life, I was sure.  The next morning we found ourselves in the buffet line. The selection looked very interesting and delicious. Sezchuan-style eggs, Egg Foo Yung, five-spice toast, bbq pork, eggs, house potatoes, and more.  Oh mediocrity, how you tantalize with overwhelming promises and underwhelming deliveries. Everything was sub-par in my opinion. The Sezchuan eggs weren't that bad, actually,and the five-spice toast would've been better had I chosen to soak them in the ginger syrup instead of consuming dry.  I was so sure that I wanted this Asian breakfast buffet in my life, but after eating almost everything that was offered, I'm not so sure I want it again. Maybe we were there on an off day, but for now I'll probably shy away.

BDlewLfGgon3qIM082xoVg.text: Good sushi at a decent price. To clarify I'd have to say this is this best sushi I've had on the strip, at a very decent price. Service wasn't bad considering we came around lunch time. We ordered several rolls and some crab cakes. The crab cakes were different than i have had before but enjoyable. The sushi was far better than two other locations I have been to on the Las Vegas strip. All in all a good experience.

faacJs0xYvrXoYpfKRmIgQ.text: Went at dinner time on a Sunday night and there was no wait and we were seated promptly. Wife ordered the sweet and sour pork with a side of white rice, I ordered the chicken and rib combo with fried rice and vegetables. Food came out in about 20 min, and it was ok. Wife enjoyed her food, my chicken was dry, and the ribs were good, but not great. The fried rice was ok, would have been better if they gave you the option to add shrimp or chicken to it, but since it came with the meal that wasnt an option. The thing I don't like is 90% of the sides are a la carte so if you want chow mein or fried rice with your meal be prepared to pay $10-$15 more. Overall you can get better and that's sad for me to say as I'm a big NYNY fan. Our waitress ( who was the bartender helping out) was awesome!!!

_g_r1hyl95xUxFZdUpn8XA.text: I was there yesterday. Service was awesome. Food was crappy. We ordered the tangarine chicken and the orange chicken.  Both sauces were thick and tasteless.   It's a shame.

Xo959jmfT365jH2_XUWuhQ.text: The food and service was fabulous! Cory provided excellent service with a smile and charming attitude!! Thank you for the amazing teamwork that Eric provided! Together we had our food in no time! The food was mouth watering and really satisfied the taste buds!! Thank you Chin Chin restaurant for a great dinner!

ZEXzcNLF-AuOa1JIywmWTQ.text: Very lame. The pot sticker appetizers were lukewarm and undercooked, and served with some viscous orange-colored goo that managed to have almost no flavor at all. The kung pao chicken was LaChoy-ish - no heat, no sweet, and the peanuts tasted like they'd been recycled from a zoo cage. All in all a total disappointment. We will not be back.

AV_gPAHTsTkkvW7V5geqUg.text: Came here for a quick late dinner. I ordered a spicy tuna roll and it was great!! Can't go wrong there! My mom ordered the teriyaki chicken bowl, she didnt like it that much, said the sauce tasted funny, I tasted it and thought it was fine. Oh well! My sister had the broccoli beef, so good!!! Probably our favorite dish!!! Service was nice and the restaurant was clean!! Would come back!!

qkJwru9EqoY2MlXl467Lug.text: With so many food options in Vegas, I would not typically choose to eat here as I always had the impression that Chin Chin's was super Americanized, overpriced Chinese food.    Well, unfortunately I wasn't wrong.  I went with the Chinese chicken salad because that's their "famous" dish.  It was OK but nothing special.  They were super stingy on the amount of chicken, and the ginger dressing was a bit strong.  The har gow (shrimp steamed dumplings) were horrible.  They were some of the worst I've had as they were really soggy, the dumpling skin was too thick, and the shrimp was unidentifiable and overcooked.  And to add insult to injury, I was super thirsty after my meal.  If they're going to use MSG so liberally, why doesn't the food taste better?  Never again!

giZfnjf1pRffSLBMk36F3Q.text: Great food and fast service!! I sat at the bar I wanted to grab a quick bite before i hit the slot machine again. The sushi was great, the fried rice not so good but wonton soup was awesome. It hit the spot. Overall great food and pricy:/

kQAuA4O0JskFF5Q2b0M4_A.text: We had the sweetest most attentive waitress here but unfortunately everything she brought us was horrible. The BF and I ordered the orange beef and Singapore noodles. The orange sauce was too tangy and got tiring really quickly. My noodles were so incredibly dry and had very little meat. It was incredibly bland. The portions are large here but what's the point of having a ton of food if it's gross?

NdVEggMTjE-v5tyOgfs4Mg.text: My friends and I went here on a Monday night and it was really nice.  Pretty mellow and it did not take long to get our food.  Service was kind of impersonal but it's not the worst I've ever had.  The sushi was really fresh and the prices were reasonable.  I'm not raving about this place but if I stay at NY NY again, I will definitely be visiting Chin Chin Cafe.  I recommend it for a sushi (or any Asian food) lover.

cfb9xJszk18ZdUggRRfHog.text: This review is for the breakfast buffet, so no idea about the sushi or other stuff. So, keeping in mind that this is a buffet,  it was really good. So good that we went twice in 2 days. 4 different kinds of eggs Benedict (which were all really good - crab cakes Benedict was the best), chocolate covered strawberries, omelets to order, berry crepes, plus all the normal breakfast foods along with creative versions of those foods (like normal scrambled eggs and scrambled eggs with fresh herbs and goat cheese). Both days our waiters (Pedro and a guy whose name I wish I could remember) were fantastic - both with positive energy and fun that made our dining great without being overly present. Price was just under $20, which seems really reasonable  (for vegas )

cRXagiV9Wnco57hv3gZ49w.text: I received probably the best service ever from Chin Chin when my group of five came here last Monday. Our server was beyond courteous and made some awesome recomendations for both food and beverages!   Service on the strip is normally pretty good.. but this was beyond that.. and to top it all off, the food exceed our expectations as well.  Defintely make your way here if you're in the mood for delicious Chinese food / sushi. I highly recomend this one!

6ssaLzSQ-Zglz08XmEtAOw.text: Was okay. Spicy tuna rolls were promising (we had it as an appetizer) but our main courses were overpriced for the quality. My husband had pepper steak and I had curry chicken. None of it was out and bad...it just wasn't that good. There are better sushi and Chinese places in LasVegas. I wouldn't recommend this spot.

8yc-qIPxju6V_8wqLVCHIQ.text: The food was so delicious! The portions are huge too. My dad and I could have shared an entree instead of getting two separate ones. I am upset that New York New York doesn't have fridges in the rooms so I can't take all my leftovers for later. Oscar was our server and his service was phenomenal! I'm glad I am from LA so I can go to the other locations back home.

TQM1yh7qeZnPFzTMWTIDEw.text: Alex is amazing! Ask for him as a server! The sushi is the best I've ever had in Vegas!

bnT0abUUMshs596_vdnPpA.text: Great value for money! Wonderful and friendly staff. My second visit , will come again!

G0d1NMnIQ7vDSGqswrzWlA.text: Came here for a quick dinner.  I wasn't expecting much, but they far exceeded my expectations based on the yelp reviews.  Between the two of us we ordered the 1) chicken mushu - flavorful and chicken wasn't dry, 2) sliced bbq pork - i love slice bbq pork and this did not disappoint!, 3) wonton stars - it's not just artificial crab, I could really taste the real crab, 4) shrimp with snowpeas - i love snowpeas and they tasted fresh, shrimp were a decent size too and not scrawny like some places i've been, 5) spicy garlic eggplant - nice kick to the dish, very flavorful, my favorite 6) combination fried rice - nice big pieces of chicken, beef, and more shrimp!...Sometimes I just really crave fried rice and this really hit the spot!  Service was good enough.  Water was always filled.  No complaints!  Left happy and full...bill was a tad high but...that's to be expected in Vegas.

Et9LJLMwnnX4w4WCMrZtEg.text: I'm reviewing only their breakfast buffet. Didn't partake of their regular menu. It's a small breakfast buffet -- obviously not your standard Vegas mega-buffet. That said, it didn't cost as much as your standard Vegas mega-buffet. Just $17 each.   It was a decent selection of breakfast staples -- waffles, pancakes, eggs, french toast, biscuits & gravy, sausage, bacon, and even not so typical things like egg rolls, pot stickers, and fried rice.  Service was quick and on top of things, even with the Memorial Day crowd. So if you're wanting a buffet, but looking for a smaller, less crowded breakfast buffet, head over to NY NY and check out Chin Chin.

fqUU0rehDc7MtUuEUXhGYw.text: Gross food, and with the name like Chin Chin, I should've known.   Ordered the Wor Wonton Noodle Soup and Yang Chow Fried Rice.  Wor Wonton Noodle Soup had a child's hand serving of noodles in a salty, msg-infused water, bbq pork was dry and the wontons were just a fail.   Yang Chow Fried Rice was worse. Mooshy rice cooked in a pool of oil which gives it a huge unappetizing shine, and it was flavorless, you actually had to add soy sauce.  And every Asian knows you shouldn't have to add soy sauce to food like that....  2 stars for decent service, waiter was nice enough to get a new batch of fried rice.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yang Chow Fried Rice, oily and gross....
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Failed Wor Wonton Noodle Soup... -_-

yICaOVVM792kj6yqKhF0Zg.text: Alex G was a great server (and handsome) ... here in Vegas for a few days, grabbed an app and snow pea chicken it was delicious and his service was unbelievable. We will be back!!

W1EREoMiPfWIBoXC7hcIqQ.text: Excellent buffet breakfast, great selection of hot  and cold and wonderful array of fresh fruits served by a delightful waiter by the name of alex

XKhreWHbVsuQsOWV4NSD9Q.text: You have to get the Chinese chicken salad! They have a chin chin in studio city, so when I found out they had it in vegas I had to go. I've been to this location a few times, sometimes the service is excellent, sometimes it's not very good honestly. It really depends on your server, but I've never had that problem in studio city.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WxKvIT96oev7SZknDmJDMA.text: Great service! Food was good and with the coupon it was a great deal. My favorites were the sushi (not a great selection but good enough for me) and salad bar with fresh avocado plus drinks included. Daughter husband and myself were happy which is a score!

A-GN7UlYXL2tRdbxpxPTBw.text: Staff is super nice and engaging! They seem genuine in asking how thing's are.  We were there for brunch and enjoyed the offerings.  When I'm back in Vegas, I'll stop in.  Beau B.

-P0YXskbcnqBPwYpMHri3w.text: At the current time one should avoid this restaurant.  For some reason they are staying open during a renovation, and it is extremely noisy.  The choices on the buffet are slim pickings and at this time you are better served to take your business elsewhere.  I wish them luck and I'm sure after the renovation all will be swell.

CBml8AR-qsSnKCSjPi1N6w.text: Great service! Everything came out really quick. The food was cooked well, the meat was practically falling off the bone. The veggies were seasoned and my favorite thing was the fried rice. Everything was so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me and the restaurant
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs, chicken, fried rice, and veggies
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon drop was so delicious!

mWi5ffP7yYOuh-q8qKyGWA.text: We stayed at Ny Ny and tried all the restaurants and Chin Chin by far was the best in terms of value and service. Manny was our server and my spouse ordered lettuce wraps not realizing it had peppers in it. She mentioned it to Manny and he had a whole new order made and back to the table within minutes. He was very attentive and very willing to please.  The portions are huge so make sure you go hunger, we had appetizers and couldn't come close to finishing it. Excellent value will definitely return.

vtSbTfiGwlcEqABePjKjRA.text: My husband went to Chin Chin after a few days of me wanting sushi. We were in the NYNY casino and I decided NOW was the time for sushi! I saw chin chin and looked the menu over. Everything was reasonably priced, considering it's the LV Strip. The staff was all very professional and kind. We sat at the bar, the bartender was very welcoming and easy to talk to. He made a few suggestions for us. I forget the name of our appetizer he suggested, but it was a fried wonton. It was so good. Then we ordered a California roll topped with yellowtail and some different sauces, that was delicious. But our absolute favorite and most memorable was the "monkey brain". It's a tuna ball covered with avocado and a couple sauces, when you dip into it, it really looks kinda "brainy". It was without a doubt very memorable and extremely delicious. I had never had any sushi so whimsical and fun, not to mention yummy! I recommend that to everyone!! I can't wait for our next trip to Vegas and our next monkey brain from ChinChin!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey brain!

pc6lQcJTfWAKBGsFt9Qc8Q.text: My favorite restaurant of my trip. I ate here for breakfast both mornings that I was here. The buffet is wonderful, everything I had tasted great! The service was phenomenal! Our waiter, WAS IN POINT! I can't stress that enough. This place made my trip.

I-scyXDMKfpxVDASHxck9g.text: We ate here twice during our stay at NYNY. The food was good and the service was excellent. Our server Ben really make sure we were happy and attentive. The restaurant manager (I don't know his name) also stopped by to make sure everything was great. Overall a good experience! We ordered a dim sum and then sum deal which has half orders of dim sum, soup, meat, and rice dishes. You get to pick 3 among those. Believe me the portion size was really good. It was half order but fill us two up. We tried hot and sour soup, BBQ pork, yang chow fried rice and wonton soup. All were good and the price is great ($23 for 3 dishes). Overall this restaurant exceeded my expectation

3H6Rd-8Ht_5eRDYIuFc9JA.text: Had two very good dinners here. I was impressed that they had a gluten-free selection, which I ordered from. I had a dish prepared w/rice noodles and beef and it was great. Our server, Beatriz, was extremely efficient and courteous. I couldn't figure out how she managed to keep our glasses constantly filled. The second night we returned she remembered us and our orders! Pretty amazing. They also gave us a gluten-free dessert on the house, a rich, dense flourless cake. I'd highly recommend Chin Chin.

9g7yEAYG4kcd2sjZtAyfjQ.text: Awesome breakfast spot! The breakfast buffet was on point, and my Bloody Mary was actually spicy enough. Super convenient, and bartender April was so sweet!

TOvglqxBlwItIdaghkp25Q.text: Our first night in Vegas we ate here. The waiter had serious attitude! We ordered miso soup and told the waiter it was really salty. His response: "yeah several other people have said that!" really? lol! Then came cold lettuce wraps and when we told him we just got a "sorry" no offer to replace! I ordered the curry chicken and the potatoes were raw and no sauce very dry! Then the manager came over and kindly offered to redo my plate. He whisked all my food away while I watched my husband and son ate. They brought my steamed rice about 10 mins before the replacement meal and then it was cold by the time the chicken curry came back! Potatoes still raw but no one even asked! Don't you think all the chicken and sauce gone and potatoes on the plate was a great clue lol! No offer to comp or reduce price. The next day I called Andrea (the I don't give a s.... manager) who basically said give us another try to screw u out of $100 and guess what I did! 3 days later breakfast buffet a lady waitress Kanae at least no attitude but she pours a 1/2 cup of water and says "I'll be back!" no refill of water, coffee or OJ! OMG lady what would you do if you had to bring food too! Why is it overpriced restaurants in resorts get to bring crappy food and bad service for very high prices and they don't care and we keep going?????

v2ZLeHuZyoDuReP1XHRung.text: Went to this place for their breakfast buffet and it was pretty decent for the price. The eggs were okay and the chinese bbq pork was pretty good (maybe the best thing).  However, the bacon was flavorless and the homefries hunan chicken were pretty gross. They had a nice selection of pastry and all the drinks you want are included in the price. I would probably give it 2 stars if I had to pay any more than the price of 14.99 and compared to other buffets it was okay. I was surprised they didn't have dim sum or more of a selection.  While it was okay, I probably wouldn't go back.

sUPvrH-9-PiqM6dQf_5MGA.text: My husband and I went to Chin Chin on Friday night May 16 2014. I explained to the waitress I have an egg allergy and couldn't have any mayo or mayo based sauces. She seemed to understand. When she brought our sushi I thought the inside of the roll was cream cheese. I didn't think to ask. The first and only bite I took I realized it had mayo inside. We sat there for a long time waiting for the waitress to come back so I could ask her about the mayo. Her response was, "well there's only a little mayo to bind the crab inside." Too bad I don't have a little allergy. The manager came over to apologize but didn't even offer to take care of the bill. I had to find a place that sold Benadryl to counter act the allergic reaction. I have been sick since then. If you need or want your food made a certain way don't go to Chin Chin. I am incredibly disappointed in the experience we had.

mRZ-MKh7rTGW_83ItBnInQ.text: Just ok...nothing special.  We went here for lunch the other day and it took quite a while for someone to seat us even though the restaurant was mostly empty.  The service was ok, the atmosphere was nice, but the food really wasn't that good.

co_TrM5uReptUVe6fb5Dgg.text: Yes the service was slow, and the hostess acted like she didn't want to seat us.  Within 12 hours of eating here, I got sick to my stomach.

bY33S-Hzl19qHaSW1DLdPg.text: I'm surprised to find a chinese restaurant in vegas that tastes pretty good and close to authentic chinese food.  We sat at the bar and the bar tender was great. She was attentive and friendly. We tried the singapore noodles which were pretty good. Of course I had better but it was pretty close. The portions were huge! We also ordered the curry chicken which was very tasty. The curry wasn't spicy, it was just the way I like it. We started with the foil wrapped chicken which had huge pieces of chicken but not too much flavor so it wasn't that  great.   Overall, it was pretty comforting here. Had a great meal and food wasn't even pricey. Great place for some decent chinese food at a great price in vegas.

yKKIF-AypFPZDWxebJ_I7w.text: I liked this place.  I thought this place would be very Americanized Chinese food, which I loathe, but I was pretty surprised that it wasn't all that Americanized.  My friends and I were looking for somewhere to eat, and somewhere that didn't take forever to serve food because we were headed to MGM to watch a show, and we had about 2 hours to eat and head over to MGM.  We saw this place and we asked the hostess how long the food takes to be served.  She said that it was pretty quick, so we believed her and went in.  I thought that she was just trying to make us stay so she told us that it would be soon, but IT WAS FAST!  We sat down, read the menu really quickly and picked out stuff immediately.  The food was served just as quickly!  And it was good!  The portions were HUGE.   I mean coming to Vegas you expect to spend a bunch of money, but getting gypped because it's Vegas after all, but you definitely get a run for your buck at this place.  I ordered a beef chow fun or something, and it wasn't as greasy as most Chinese restaurants have it, which is good!  I was fairly impressed with the food, quality, service, and money-to-food ratio. :)    I'd definitely go back if I'm feeling some Chinese food in Vegas next time.

Fb69uO-8ptmjEBbb7yl89A.text: After spending a fortune on mediocre food along the strip, I just happened to be at New York New York when I noticed this restaurant and decided to give it a shot. Listen, a chicken/shrimp fried rice is less than $9 here and taste like a decent chinese food !!! Now where on the strip would you find such a fair price ? On top of that the portion was quite generous and the service was fast !! I will DEFINITELY go back, trust me. Folks RUN AWAY from Panda express across the street. The food taste like plastic and cost bout $10!! Pouah !

5z243digP8_wZBWylCKpDQ.text: I was so pleasantly surprised when I came across the one in New York New York Hotel! They have some of the most delicious Chinese food I have ever tasted! The staff is wonderful. Food was tasty (chinese chicken salad and sushi were amongst the faves)

_jAEjK9V6R0ATaxfP-z6sQ.text: Had lunch and sushi at Chin Chin while on a recent trip to Vegas. The sushi was good, we had the 2 for 1 lunch special.  California roll and spicy tuna, the crab in the California roll was fresh, taste was great. I'd have to say the California roll was better than the tuna.  We also ordered General Tso's chicken and a noodle bowl.  The General Tso's had a dark brown sauce with a unique taste. I'm not sure I can say I like that flavor compared to the other General Tso's I've had in the past. As for the noodle bowl, it was tasty, chicken, shrimp, and beef with veggies and thick noodles. I asked for mine a little spicy so it had a bite to it but nothing over the top.  The price was a bit on the high side for lunch, it was 50+ dollars with the food mentioned above and a Coke.  I'd eat at Chin Chin again but it wouldn't be something that is a must have

4NeoXrapBN_UHFWEM-OaNg.text: The service was very slow. Took forever for drinks. The breakfast buffet was limited but the food was good. Service workers were cold and appeared to want you in and out. Probably wouldn't go back.

pdH0930W4RZ8pFPkhqIhNw.text: So I decided to go here after it received a good review in one of the Vegas coupon books and a Chinese breakfast buffet sounded interesting.  I loved the New York/New York hotel and casino but Chin Chin was a dissappontment.  The buffet was small and the only Chinese offerings were fried rice with sausage (really?) and some sort of egg roll...still not sure what was inside.  The wait staff looked really unhappy.  It was just ok.

Cwzs9E8gjzra0GWS4rmjeg.text: Ate here while staying at NY-NY and found the food to be quite tasty, reasonably priced and a nice respite from the casino floor.  May I recommend the Wor Won Ton soup with veggies, seafood and won tons. It is a huge bowl that will serve 3-4 and it is quite tasty. The tangerine beef was tart and sweet.   Good stuff and will eat here next time I am at NY-NY

YHIHIslbqIwasa_Bi9FBvw.text: They have a really nice breakfast buffet for a fair price!!! Got a good selection of breakfast items!! If you don't want to spend $25 to $35 for a huge buffet that you only going to eat less than half the stuff they have than this place is for you!!!

s3QusktoQiMVDy3tjshG7A.text: Food was decent.  Service was NOT.  Although the waiter was friendly, he totally forgot our first course.  Didn't realize it until we asked where our soups were.  Some at the table had sushi and asked for a second roll.  It never came.  And because we had a large party, he got his automatic tip anyway.  Bad service is becoming a theme at New York New York.  Used to be a great place to go, not so much anymore.

jtAxHqWn2QmLb0WNGAV5zg.text: I was excited to eat here since I loved the Chinese chicken salad from the Chin Chin on Sunset Plaza in L.A. And had not had it in years. I ordered a half order of the salad, and a bowl of soup, I believe it was called Max's soup, or something along those lines. My husband ordered the peanut noodles. Well, the salad was just as I remembered it...delicious! The soup, on the other hand was not. It had an odd taste...like boiled cabbage. I knew I made the wrong choice after I had just one spoonful. My husband's peanut noodles tasted like peanut butter overpowered by garlic! Not good. Price was okay, service was mediocre, and with the exception of my beloved chinese chicken salad, the food was yucky. Too bad. We should have known this wasn't going to be good by the way the girls working there bordered on begging us to eat there every time we walked by there on our way to and from the elevators.

fLZomQoY45JZ30G2iCmYuA.text: horrible customer service. Waiter dropped a plate which shattered all over me, spilt water into my purse, and took FOREVER to do anything. Didnt even bother to check back on our table after the incident. When we asked for my meal to be comped due to our horrible experience he took our bill, was gone for 15min then just came back and dropped it on the table, not comped. No manager ever came by to ask if we were okay, there was glass everywhere. I would spend you money elsewhere.

QqxEitOA5lumTcR0lLGP1A.text: Way too salty and nasty.  Imagine a normally tasty Mongolian beef, then at the last minute the chef accidently pours in an entire bottle of soy sauce.  Add to that lots  of MSG and you've reproduced the Chin Chin secret recipe.  This is the Asian restaurant at New York New York, and I say you are better off with Panda Express / Manchu Wok at Excalibur.

hNVDclFb7xPH0Rt8HHND3w.text: Great restaurant with large portion sizes. I had the salmon crunch roll and it was amazing! Also ordered fried wontons and senchuan dumplings and they were great too! Loved the koriander sauce on the dumplings.

wwIi0cHQtYzMgQxjg48REA.text: When I think of Vegas, I think of good dining. This place does not belong there. The atmosphere felt like a cafeteria/food court. The staff was a joke. No one told us we had to pay gratuity on a group of 6. In the end our server had added his tip for lousy service, had I not complained, he would have gotten away with over $60 for a job NOT well done.  A few hours later, as all of us made our way through the night, we all fell ill. We ended the night by going back to our rooms, sick. I am not saying that Chin Chin was the cause, however it was the only thing we had in common.  Dine or Dash? Dash... Just the thought of dining, makes me ill.

msdnpBG08hA1CMYyF7Q91w.text: Andrea is the best ever! She needs a raise or we WILL WALK!!!  Ryan is THE MAN! Focus up!!

pL7OHFMjjNr5JoKMOSuecA.text: Excellent.  Staff warm and friendly.  They only put a few items at a time out, so your food is always good quality.  Tasty drinks.  Made to order omelets in a lovely atmosphere without the cafeteria atmosphere of larger buffets.  They offered us coffee to go, made sure we were happy.

segQABqssxmqb7HlbHB2gA.text: Went there with my girlfriend last night, The services is great and our waitress was awesome, but the food was so average! really  nothing special about it, I had steamed vegetables, I nevertheless have  tasted mushrooms that bad, the sushi was Ok I enjoyed it.

k6xT8tYWm-I4ORkAUHrAKQ.text: This place is great when you just need a nice quiet place to think and eat with your loved ones, chin chin has excellent service and well mannered servers.

JxRRqp0cZK7qIik95MM_nA.text: Best buffet I've ever had for an amazingly low price, which includes drinks like pop, iced tea, and lemonade, and amazing desserts like cake pops, mini cheesecakes and chocolate covered strawberries. The food was better than some sit down Chinese places I've been to. Service was amazing, even though slightly understaffed. They ran out of plates but brought us clean ones anyways. Waiter was very friendly and joked around with us. Highly recommend, but bring a huge appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FmDFybYZwRL18ss8XvLj6g.text: The breakfast buffet was worth the stop. Just perfect after a long night on the town.

V9U_PtdSPe2vIR0EEgK5EQ.text: My husband and I had a great time and experience here. The food was amazing. We started off with the chicken lettuce wraps. Next we had the Inferno Roll and Yellowtail Shashimi which were all so fresh and yummy. The Wasabi is real Wasabi, not the horseradish kind that clears your sinuses. For our entrees we selected the tangerine beef, and the spicy seafood noodles with black bean sauce. Everything was exquisite and the presentation was perfection. To top it off, our amazing server Robb was not only charming, but very attentive and professional. We will definitely be back to visit and recommend this place highly.

qnsdJFCGW1rqxdOqo_8Omg.text: Great customer service I ordered the volcano sushi and my daughter had their noodles with vegetables our meals were really great. Ask for Ben to be your server he was super nice and gave us a lot of info on food and las vegas

iwQXT51dFgGhyEVnvXnqtQ.text: Pros: very reasonable price, espeically if you use the yelp 2 for 1 deal! Server was quick with drinks. Xmas sweet decorations wete real and very cute.best mac and cheese ever! Cons: apart from the mac and cheese, quality of food was pretty poor. Edible but not that great. And why have a server at a buffet?!? I suppose its good for employment statistics but we couldve got our own drinsk very easily and not had to tip!

P4ZH9VA9q81yDumxs_MkTg.text: My visit here was okay, if you ask me if I would go back I think I would but I'm sure there's better Chinese/sushi places in Vegas. The food was very good actually, we didn't do the buffet since it was almost over so we did the a la carte menu, I was with 5 other people. The workers are very kind, but they said the portions were large but they were not enough, especially for the price. But overall, I was satisfied! If you ever visit, I loved the salmon crunch roll:)

vSiZYGkWdEK-CQhej3BlLw.text: Maybe it was the evening but the food was mediocre and service was slow.  The drinks took 15 minutes.   We ordered appetizers.   The appetizers were uninspiring.    The appetizers did not taste as if they were made on site but purchased thru a service company (ex. Sysco ).  My friends ordered the sushi and ment I need it was pleasant but nothing to write home about. I ordered the General Tso Chicken.  My sauce was bitter (thinking it was mixed with something or not prepared correctly.  The wait staff was pleasant but slow.   I would skip this place and find something more appealing.  Please note that you can see the kitchen staff.   They too seem uninspired which is probably reflective of the food.

QZ8PyjgeT6hykCJJCGpW5w.text: So we visit this location during our stay and the service was pretty good but save your money because the food was subpar and waaayy over priced! Many other choices to select within New York New York and on the strip!

h0hHh_TmU8ON1Ibpnsb_-w.text: Quality of food not worth the price. Manager was walking around checking with guests but when we showed her that there is a strand hair in the chicken we ordered, she just took it and no apologies at all. It was my son's birthday and was expecting something special but nahhhh.

JL9jb6TpBed0HMbYg1mWjg.text: Chin Chin is an excellent Chinese restaurant with large shareable portions and always excellent service.  Our waiter this time was Pedro and he was outstanding!  He offered suggestions without being pushy and he was incredibly accommodating. We never had to ask for something twice.  The food was also excellent!

lWgm2Hp3MhauEKO7iVkTBQ.text: Don't eat sushi here. Terrible Bought 50 platter got 2 ebi 2 hamachi 2 tuna 2 tako and 2 unidentified.  That's it no roe uni etc in pics on website.  Quality was fair.  Anywhere else is better.

KurkJa_oHg90YxQDcd3JYg.text: The Red Velvet Pancake Triangles are soooooo yummy. The Honey spicy jumbo shrimps are a must too. The service is superior too.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AOhQVlm4k79mChPrWBmdnw.text: Good food, good service. Check in and get a free lunch with one regular lunch buffet.

MIBCnJKwYxhW9VUc3eTRtw.text: I hate doing this cause I used to love chin chin. It has been one of my favorite restaurants for the lats 10 years and when I say this I'm talking about the one in Brentwood. Now in regards to the chin chin at the NY NY hotel in Vegas, is the worse The quality of the food is bad and the service, perfect match....horrible!!!. if you're looking for a pleasant place with a good food and good service this is not the place.

Ay_EpW5-AjywBcraeyEgmw.text: The restaurant is completely renovated. I've been to all of their locations and this one is such a beaut! Upon entrance the lovely hostess greeted me with a smile and with no hesitation offered me to take a look at the menu. The selection was perfect and they work with everyone's diets! I'm a pescatarian so often it's very difficult for me to find a place that can easily modify and accommodate something for me.  Their sushi menu was long, however not too overwhelming. When I saw that and their wine and sake selection, I was IN! The hostess walked me to my table. And you know how most hosts try to walk way in front of you and you almost have to sprint? They were actually mindful of me and walked beside me. I felt like they made an excellent first impression and my service began memorable. She even pulled out my seat. (Whaaaat) lol I know!   The server was top notch! His name was Pedro and he was on top of it. Very very energetic! My glass was never halfway empty, my table was manicured the entire time, and he sold me on desserts! I am on a diet!   The manager named Magy came by to visit my table. I typically don't like to be interrupted while I'm eating, but her approach was very friendly and she actually took the time to see what I thought about my food. I wanted to go to some nice wine bars and she pointed me towards some great wine spots.  The last time I was there I ordered Szechuan string beans, ordered it spicy and wowwww was it delicious. I ordered the Ma Po Tofu and the sauce was incredible. I tasted some black bean and authentic Chinese seasoning in it. It had a little spice to it just the way I like it and ordered a side of brown rice. Yes.. brown rice for those healthy people out there!  All in all, this place will give you a great experience upon entry, to food delivery, quality of food, and memorable service.   *check out the tips, they have a quality breakfast buffet, a FULL bar, brown rice, make riceless sushi (upon request), and DO NOT have MSG! :)*

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hockey pockey roll
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cwscd7K6ii2G1a-WsK4NEg.text: Meh. Food was decent enough, nothing to write home about. I have definitely had better tasting Asian food. Portions were decent. Service was ok. Waitress kept forgetting to bring my wife's wine. Had to finally flag her down and remind her. I was already half way through my drink... no customer service recovery. I do have to admit that you will pay "Vegas" prices!!! And it really isn't worth it.

UJt7-8DncI8LrlaflqkHYQ.text: Probably one of the best meals we had this trip. We were staying here at New York New York, and were on our way to breakfast, when we passed by here.   They had a breakfast buffet going on, and the friendly hostess suggested we go take a look. We did, and immediately decided to check it out.  The buffet was way nicer then any buffet we had on this trip. Everything was presented very tasteful and upscale. Very fresh, and nicely presented.   They have over 50 items including - red velvet pancakes, lychee fruit, sushi, French toast ect. A combination of both traditional brunch items and Asian food. If you come just as breakfast turns to lunch, you can experience both. You can also order a la carte off the menu if you prefer.   We liked it so much, that we ate here three times during our stay at NyNy. The service always was stellar ! Very friendly, courteous servers and cheery upbeat hostesses.   And if you check in on Yelp, it was buy one get one free lunch buffet ! It was an amazing deal.   Highly recommend!  Enjoy !

r_xNGJPBiFPXPtDF5mXJaw.text: I had high expectations for this place, as my husband went last year and raves about how good it was. I ordered pad Thai and my husband got the lunch buffet since it had orange chicken which he was planning on getting anyway. Maybe I'm spoiled by the Thai food we have near home, but this Pad Thai was not very good. Kinda bland and not very peanut-y. My husband barely ate anything from the buffet because it wasn't that good. I did snag a spring roll he wasn't going to eat and that was good. Overall, super overpriced for what it is. Won't come back the next time we are in Vegas.

qDhflfiBmIXTSJE1KayHXw.text: We decided to go here for my birthday dinner and were not disappointed! We stayed at the Excalibur, so the short walk to New York New York was worth it for this delicious meal.  When we arrived, there were not many seating options available and we were placed at a tall table with chairs that did not have a back. Typically, I would've asked to be seated at a booth or lower table, as I find the tall tables and chair with no backs uncomfortable; however, I did not want to be difficult since they didn't have other seating options available.   Our waiter came up to our table promptly to give us menus and take our drink orders. He was friendly and patient with us as we waded through their huge menu. Their food menu is very extensive, which made it a difficult decision for us! The drink menu has good selection as well.   We decided to start off with their shrimp tempura roll. It was a good size and tasty as well. For our entree, we chose to split the crab and asparagus fried rice. First of all, I thought this was such a creative take on fried rice and one that I never would've thought of. Second, omg! Thank goodness we decided to split it because the portion was absolutely HUGE! My boyfriend and I each ate quite a bit of it and still had at least another good serving of it left.   Another cool feature of this place is that they have the sushi chefs working right at the bar so you can sit right in front of them and watch your sushi being rolled.   Our experience here was really great. We left feeling very full of delicious food and drinks. Our waiter was attentive but not annoying. Definitely recommend this place for a delicious meal.

RoaxAqq1zOHbe3z-m2J4fw.text: Nasty. Went for dinner.  You could tell the food was precooked and microwaved. Spent 100$ for 4 dishes. Yuck. ZERO STAR

QUxFFtP0jdCCl1utnrw_nQ.text: Service here was amazing. The sushi was a 4 but the service was a 6! It was a perfect spot for us to grab a bite before seeing a show. Jules and I cozied up to the bar and had some great drinks and the food was prepared in front of us and arrived quickly. Great and we will be back!

3wNJc-pBRpY0wy_UwxhLtA.text: Great place! The hostess and waitress were both very nice and personable. I got the orange chicken which was very amazing. The only negative was that it was a bit overpriced, but this is expected with Las Vegas. I would definitely go here again if I visited.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dfixEhoVVzAvu4mNsy9vAA.text: Chin chin is the place to kill the hunger cravings with some healthy food before hitting the tables again !   Jesus is the MAN !!! If you want best service and genuine attention ask for him. He will give you the best advise to accommodate your taste.

TrHGNfHRbHBmQI5QN4OPVw.text: We ate here two days in a row because it was so delicious.  I highly recommend Anthony's special & peanut noodles w/ chicken, these were very large servings, enough for a couple to split and eat plenty.  My wife enjoyed the Mongolian beef & the dim sum trio including; pot stickers, Star won tons, chicken spring rolls & gift wrapped chicken.  We were both very satisfied.  The staff are great & the wait times for meals are perfect.  These guys and gals are fast, friendly, and right on with their customer service.  I highly recommend Chin Chin.

iVeygBQqlUyH4wyoy1r-rw.text: Last week, my family took a trip to Las Vegas and visited Chin Chin. We had made a reservation and were seated right away. The food tasted great and one person in our party, even got a specialty drink made for them that wasn't on the drink menu. Our server Mikey, was very friendly and attentive. Always ensuring we had everything we needed to have a great dining experience.

ZWo3KvNivBmirbNAQVaFJQ.text: Had a urge for some good Sushi and friend of mine recommended this place.  CHIN CHIN is an asian fusion restaurant that has some really great food options that remind you of actually really good asian restaurants from my hometown Toronto. #WETHENORTH - back to the restaurnt its a well designed place with some great staff service thats very attentive to yours needs.  I went more with the sushi selection as they look really Yummy.  One item that really was tasty was the NEO roll it was sooo good it was like something put of the Matrix!!! Probably named after Keanu Reeves character lol. Good portions of food and bang for your buck meals cant go wrong.  Definitely will be coming for some eating repeats.  Definitely worth stopping by if youre looking for that asian style cuisine.  Keep up the good work

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Neo roll matrix

agXBf1ectnb9Zkm1en2Ong.text: If you want to taste real authentic Chinese food then skip this place. We ordered chicken fried rice and walnut shrimps. 1 star for fried rice because it taste like soy sauce mix with rice it tasted like americanized fried rice. The shrimps was big but doesn't even taste like authentic walnut shrimps.

8Z6F8AG6Hmj7r1Gv1eSAfQ.text: This is a very nice place for breakfast or brunch. If you come in before 9am, it is $40 for 2, with all drinks, and first cocktails is free too. The orange drink is very good, very fresh and coffee is good too. It is all you can eat buffet, you can have the items are ready on the food counter or you can order from the brunch menu. I love the brunch menu, you can create your own dish, you pick any items you want to. My first "eggs your way" was so good - sunny side up with asparagus, mushrooms, shrimps, crabs meat and steak. It was a perfect dish for me. Because I was getting full but I want more the shrimps and asparagus so I asked the waitress if I skip the eggs but just shrimps and asparagus is okay. She said," sure, you can order any way you want." Love the shrimps and asparagus, very healthy and make me feel good.  The customer service is excellent and our waitress is very sweet and lovely.  Definitely recommend it and we will be back.

s9mrzcIb-uvE-m8o_7DR5A.text: These trip in Vegas need it something else and what else well sushi and these place definitely didn't make everything we where looking for from the bartender Kelsey to all the friendly staff and management even the manager Cory and Oscar both came to the table to see if everything was ok since one of my party dint like what they order but they fixit and make something for him that it was delicious definitely the best Asian and sushi on the strip

PYUHy5pAGrdllbcihJKYqw.text: Classy. Like, notably even more so than I thought it would be. The staff there was so friendly. They had a hostess from Hawaii that had great conversation etiquette and was very entertaining, the servers were extremely hospitable, and the food was delicious. Between the soup and that lemon chicken I had to leave with leftovers because it was soooo filling.   I would say the Lemon Chicken took the win. It was placed on a bed of cabbage (which I'm not personally a fan of, but I get the hype). The lemon sauce that came with it was to die for. I literally DRENCHED my chicken in it after a test taste. No regrets.   They were really up front that the sides are a la carte which I appreciated, but I do with it AT LEAST came with rice. I get buying alternative sides, but rice is a staple. It should be included in a $17 plate of glorified lettuce and a single breaded chicken breast. I'm just saying.   Other than that small little detail, perfect experience, highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon chicken w/ homemade lemon sauce
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oodles of noodles (but good)

dlIFJejTK5v80keGHxbuww.text: Extremely dirty. The hostess was friendly and courteous but the service was so off.  Bring my appetizer after we finish our meals and to top it off their spoon was so dirty, brought out another 3 after he noticed how dirty it was... but this was after he dipped that dirty spoon into my soup.  Food was good but me and my date were throwing up later that night and no it wasn't cuz we were drunk... go to Panda Express and save yourself some $ and time.

v7DFmSfkVlAFRWUXzdgihg.text: Superb customer service!!! The food is good but the customer service took it over the top! I will definitely be going back!  Accommodated a food allergy with out eye rolls or exasperated sighs. That's A+ in my book!

JAo7oxD7Pm4bsbSjRfHt6Q.text: It was nice to have half price deal before 9am for breakfast buffet. The food was good, so the customer service. The nice thing here that they give you unlimited refilled coffee and juice, also they have the options for you to select for your meal, you order whatever on the menu and build your own breakfast plate.  We definitely want to come back.

ZImAy9INNL2EyBGPquBRxw.text: This place was so good. We are vegetarian/vegan and they had a great menu for our dietary needs. The service was excellent.  The staff was very friendly and on top of it all.   The peanut noodles... OOOOOOOOO MYYYYYYY! Best I have ever had. The avocado roll I had was so large too. I wasn't expecting them to be so big. They were fresh, and mouth watering.   A must try in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ThSP9PzdEo8e_Ko9kXzpzA.text: For an upscale restaurant HORRIBLE my pad Thai was mushy and yuck My wife's salad was ok to her The server was to say the least was stupid,how many times can a guest ask for iced tea AND the water was typical bad tasting unfiltered Las Vegas water ,been to small places in Vegas to eat and have been served clean good tasting water Stay away from this place

iz_r7JI2MeGL2rULs1qcQw.text: I am just never sorry to have come here. The drinks are amazing, the presentation is great and the sushi is so fresh. I had the pleasure of sitting at the bar most recently and had wonderful service and got to watch them slice and prepare my rolls and sashimi. I haven't ventured out a lot to the other sushi on the strip, nor do I care to after eating here.

ll2zPq87o4ygXNgNT9bydw.text: We were there mostly for the dim sum and the lo mein for lunch. Its pricey but hey its Vegas. The shumai and dumplings was served hot and tasted fresh like it was hand made and cooked immediately. The lo mein was just ok, they could have added a bit more veggies and meat.

4G1ljEDF67ytTWsnWj6Vug.text: We are staying at the New York New York and the lady in the gift shop recommended trying the breakfast buffet at Chin Chin. We came down about 8:30 and were seated without a wait. The hostess and our waiters were extremely friendly and provided excellent service. The food was great as was the selection of breakfast items. I definitely recommend trying the breakfast buffet

rtf3Qxw188vGxG2BNRaZaA.text: Pretty bad food. We ordered Kung Pao chicken which was literally mix of peanut sauce and chicken. We ordered a bowl of vegetable soup which was bland as well. Panda express is 10x better than this place.

8psE6pWptaUgztWXJ3iQAA.text: Pretty decent Chinese restaurant  We loved their salt and pepper tofu and lo mein.  Friendly servers and good place to dine in.

Th2J-L8JCaaamRQ7rUhzWw.text: Deliciously fresh sushi! We ordered 3 rolls and they were all so fresh and perfectly made. They served some of the best sushi I've ever had. The edamame appetizer was seasoned perfectly and came out right away.  Our waitress was super friendly and made us feel so welcome.  I can't wait to come back and try more things from their menu.

x4cs7oMIRSjiXwTNYnZzag.text: Over priced bad food. Ate dinner yesterday and Not worth the price and ratings on Tripadvisor.   For the price they were charging ambience was very casual and food very ordinary

zFznpOD8fG-u5qMGuS62zQ.text: Expectations exceeded! Our party arrived not knowing anything about the restaurant and had an amazing b experience.  We were seated quickly for a large group arriving for breakfast buffet. With a name like Chin Chin I was expecting something different. Chinese food is served for lunch and dinner in both order from the menu or buffet style...choose wisely.   We started with the featured omlets  that is included with buffet purchase.  The chefs prepare them fresh to order or you can create your own. Meat lovers, Cobb, Veggie, and the magnificent Seafood Omlette was my favorite with shrimp stuffed inside. Delicious! We the walked to the back of the restaurant where the buffet is located and we're amazed by the beautiful offerings like Salmon Eggs Bene, Stuffed Red Velvet pancakes, a variety of Egg Scrambles, and the very creative Breakfast Fried Rice.  All of the food was hot and fresh which sometimes can be a challenge at a buffet. Not here.    I had to save room for the sweets section. My favorite was the strawberry shortcake inspired croissant sammy stuffed with stawberries, whip cream and chocolate drizzle. Splendid!  Overall great experience at Chin Chin. Our entire large party left satisfied and minds blown with the level of service we received from Pedro R.  Vote for Pedro when you venture to Chin Chin.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummo croissants!
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet line
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffer line one

_YLPzIOx1NBUqRB_fbtyqw.text: The food was really good and I like that they had a few sushi choices which were really good. The hostess staff were really nice and welcoming but the thing that really made this restaurant was Dexter. He was amazing and told us all the ins and outs with the menus. He was very knowledgeable and because of that we actually ordered what he suggested. Dexter was great as was everything else the restaurant had to offer.

J6Gm2UAhfWNSEXu5y0bEjQ.text: Second time at chin chin for the  lunch buffet. The first time was okay, nothing special. The lobster fried rice was the most tasting thing on the buffet,while it lasted. They ran out and that was that,no more was put out.   We decided to give it another shot but it was even more disappointing, with the quality of food. Just basic tasteless food. Not too much to choose from. The best thing there was the service from our waiter.

2qvqsGmNaJrUy-W-VdmskA.text: How did I get to Chinny Chin Chin?? Welllllll, my gluten-intolerant friend (rolls eyes) and I were going to watch TIM MCGRAW & FAITH HILL at the T-Mobile Arena! YEEEEHAW! What's an Asian girl going to a country concert?? Asian people listen to country music you racists! Anyways that's besides the point because we still went to eat Chinese food (I'm not Chinese but it's Asian so close enough), so I kept True to my Asian roots - phew.   Anyhow, we got there right before the rush, which I thought would be nice but nope, still waited for our food for what felt like forever (it was about 25 mins - so pretty much forever). I was going to knock them down 1 star for the wait but then when the food came I forgot all about the wait.   JESSICA SHUT UP, what did you eat?? Well damn don't be so rude. So friends, I got the Crispy Spicy Honey Shrimp thing and my friend got the gluten-conscious Honey Walnut Shrimp. BOTH WERE REALLY GOOD AND I HIGHLY RECOMMEND. We also washed it down with 2 Lychee martini dranks. I would come back to order these two dishes but everything else looked meh and overpriced. I'd rather go to panda.
