_XLI8YPOI7hvYYG6-ZtgAQ.text: We were staying in the NYNY and were walking around to find some food. Chin Chin wasn't that crowded and we were a larger group so we decided to eat here. The food was alright but you can get better elsewhere. We had a lot of leftovers when normally our group tends to finish everything. It is Vegas but I felt like prices were more expensive than they needed to be.   The service was good though!

BUDRBKkwEQEIKWvnY40CmQ.text: Delicious food! We went for the all you can eat buffet and it did not disappoint! The servers were great and cleared the extra plates constantly. We had a couple code from subscribing to the hotel emails so it was only $15 per person, soda/tea included! Great deal and well worth it.

Pzi6AP0F06dbMF5-t563Xg.text: We were staying at NYNY and went here for dinner. IT was delicious! Fresh and so yummy. Josh was our waiter and he was great. Really nice and attentive. Recommended a drink that my husband really enjoyed. It was a little pricey but its Vegas.

CXXtm0ftsjAp-5PXUwRPlQ.text: Legit!!  Good value, excellent tasting food with large portions.   We've been here 4 days in Vegas, wish we would have found this earlier in our trip. We would have been back for a second meal.

4zqDxj-R15C6wXDlzNzKzg.text: Good breakfast, very clean and Rhomel is by far one of the best servers that we have ever had.

VmlKn0rU7Q95UmoHM4PVqw.text: I had never been to Chin-Chin, which is strange because apparently it's a Los Angeles based restaurant, and I eat all over LA... We had the lunch buffet... it was okay. Some of the offerings were weird... Mac and cheese with a side of sushi anyone? The broccoli beef was the outstanding dish, very tender meat, perfectly seasoned. All of the other items were okay, but nothing special.  Our server was excellent! Very attentive, constantly refilling our drinks and removing our old plates.

on7qSNtAGi124eUs1v7lqQ.text: Have been to this place several times when visiting vegas. Love that it's a close buffet down at this end of the strip for a reasonable price. Plus, a bonus is if you go to the buffet about 11:20, they switch it out to lunch about 11:40. So you get a little breakfast food and lunch food.

51-_oBHEB8k7nvbyrA2A_g.text: The staff here is amazing! We were very well taken care of. The sushi is very tasty and beautifully presented. I recommend the dragon fruit mojito, sooo good! Definitely coming back! Btw Megan is the best bartender

a0lo7wheEiPPGLptpE19pw.text: Food was great we ate here twice Sunday and Tuesday Pedro our server was really nice he takes pride on his  job we really enjoy Vegas and we love New York casino but we really eanjoy this restaurant  Great job Pedro

ylwxarFuc0aqxjZKYYfUBA.text: Great lunch buffet.  Sushi,  spring rolls,  variety of dishes,  tons of desserts.  All tasty and fresh.  Definitely would recommend!!

2VQL0eninySdnojeVSIkkA.text: Ordered the Basked Alaskan and Yum Yum Scallop. So delicious and perfectly prepared by Chef Koong. The place has a nice setup. We sat at the sushi bar. Koong totally vibed with our whole meal. Im a sushi lover, and its one of the best. Ask for Koong she'll tell you what's best in Vegas.

11YaexVr3DJhyYjC-rRquQ.text: Andrea our hostess was amazing.   She convinced us to come in and the food was amazing and the service was great.   She deserves a raise!!!

w22yLJ58B7z3dCU0YAJUiw.text: 4/7/2018 Went there for the breakfast buffet. Not impressed at all. Don't waste your money, for the 2 of us it came to $54.00. Ian our waiter was super nice though. Props to Ian!

viNpRmwPr7t7G3fQ24wIRg.text: Wonderful food, wonderful service!  Big thanks to Alex and Corey for making dinner such a wonderful experience.

VOT3rjFFcsXFUsUhvrvYgg.text: This place was open late and in the area if not for that I probably wouldn't have gone inside.    It's Americanized Chinese food which is what I like.  I got the General Tso's chicken and it wasn't too spicy.  The Seafood noodles were also good this place is fairly priced @ $14-$15 per entree.

hIPhj3Jj6v1QoYQZcoPiLA.text: Did this place get new management? Wow, its been a couple of months since the last time I was here. I came with some friends last weekend and surprisingly the staff was very inviting. I was very pleased to have received service with a smile, for some reason that simple principle is fading in the the service industry. The food was pretty good but the prompt service somehow made it taste better.  Appetizers! Chinese chicken salad! WOW Amazing! The ginger dressing phenomenal. Chicken potstickers with the sauce they serve (Apricot sauce) mix it with a little chilli paste.   Entree= Genral tso chicken (chicken breast), Szechuan string beans with chicken ex picked veggies, combo fried rice, Walnut Shrimp, and Singapore noodles!   Drinks= Bottle of Hidden crush (Cabernet blend) full bodied Cab, full of tannins that clear your palate so every bite is a first bite!   Servers were amazing and I say servers because everybody and their mother was so attentive with our party, even the manager Kyle checked on us to make sure that our food was to our liking.     If you are in Vegas Chin Chin is the place to go. they have a buffet and a shushi bar (maybe next time).   Will definitely be returning.   Prices are very reasonable and the portions are very generous!   After a good meal, time to GAMBLE!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #thebest

gkCniQ67Ls0cD-caXX9xKg.text: This is one of the best general tso dishes I have had so far. The right level of spicy and crispy.  Would absolutely recommend stopping by here!

NjfLVFtBa8T1eiM3pxVZRA.text: I have ate here 4 others times. I only eat fish and tofu , so I eat tofu a lot . Tofu here sucked , no flavor. But worse was the waiter. He never asked how my food was , never gave me a refill. I didn't eat any of the tofu or the rice, when I told him how bad it was , he said it's tofu. So I paid $46 for a soda and sushi.

ZLVJWw8K_6Vzthde_CiAoA.text: Ellie was a terrific server. She took a personal interest in us and we enjoyed great conversation during the dining experience. The food choices in the breakfast buffet was over the top. The custom ordered omelets were outstanding. Along with the hostesses to seat you who were warm and friendly,  the entire breakfast experience was beyond expectation!

zLlIl-4VtK00kTo3avMgZw.text: I've been here two different times and both visits were great. Good service and great food. The food took a little bit long but Chris, our server made sure we are taken care of. He's great and we had a great time. We had the Chicken and Rib with rice combo. I forgot whats it's called but it was very delicious. We also had the Yang chow rice, hot and sour soup and the Vietnamese spring vegetables.   Whenever I'm in the area, I'm sure to put Chin chin on my places to eat.

PPwFtL9EvshNDfiZvttJSQ.text: Let me preface this review by saying I hate to leave this review bc the service was exceptional, Jordan, our server and the manager on duty ( 3/29 1:38 p) were both fantastic :) Went in with the Yelp check in offer of BOGO lunch buffet, after tax we ended up paying about $11 pp. Had I paid full price, I would have been fairly upset as the choices were very limited and not that tasty to boot. Again, I'm sorry CC staff, you guys are awesome, but I'd hate to steer a fellow Yelper wrong and out of his/her hard earned money. The sole redeeming item was the cheesecake crust. Pretty decent variety of desserts overall. I can't speak for the menu items, this is strictly a review of The lunch buffet, which I'd give a solid 1 star to, considering the price, but Jordan & her mgr brought it up two stars .Thank you both for redeeming what would have otherwise been a 1 star experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake &amp; cookies pretty good, others so-so..
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac n cheese may have been the tastiest item there :/

UfWC4wKm5s13J4vwEABY_Q.text: Spent this weekend in good ol' Vegas. My friend and I wanted to stop in and get our sushi fix. I have never been to this restaurant and was already expecting it to be on the pricey side since it's Vegas. Everything is overpriced. Anyways, they had a deal going on buy 2 sushi rolls, get the 3rd free. We figured that would be good so we ordered a dragon roll, rainbow roll and a lucky seven roll along with a dim sum appetizer called the assorted pleasures dish.  The appetizer came with 2 chicken pot stickers, 2 fried chicken wontons, 2 gift wrapped chicken pieces (chicken wrapped in foil w/cilantro) and a spring roll cut in half. The waitress brought out some dipping sauces. One of them was an apricot sauce that was similar to duck sauce which tasted amazing. I dunked the spring roll and pot sticker in that. The chicken pot stickers and wontons were both pink on the inside. I don't think the pot stickers were thoroughly cooked.  When our sushi came, all 3 rolls were on one plate. That only meant one thing: the rolls were tiny. And they were itty bitty. Don't get me wrong, the sushi was delicious but these rolls are priced out between $12-18 dollars. They were almost the size of a quarter. I hate to sound like a sushi snob, but I've had bigger rolls for less than $15 and of awesome quality. Well, what do you expect? It IS Vegas after all.  I'd say nay to the sushi next time and would probably try some of their other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almost the size of a quarter :/
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow roll, Lucky Seven roll and Dragon roll. Our dipping cup was bigger than the rolls

knYhEePCddE0uBCFfjoxSg.text: The service and food deliver was quick. We ordered the fried rice,  rainbow roll and walnut shrimp.  The best dish was the rainbow roll,  very fresh fish.  The fried rice was a little too salty for our liking it could be the soy sauce they use,  kikkoman (I'm used to Aloha shoyu). The walnut shrimp had way too much sauce on it,  if there was less sauce it would have been so much better. I doubt we will be eating here again.  The waiter never cane back after delivering our order to see how we we're doing..... That's not good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice...a little too salty for my liking.
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Walnut shrimp.....way too much sauce.
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow roll......

ioMmQs4YVhI4PRvJLrgcWA.text: Was a little skeptical at first, but was pleasantly surprised! The service is pretty good. The hostess and our waitress were very nice and made sure that we were enjoying our food and asked us about how our trip was going, etc.  I ordered the crispy honey shrimp with a side of brown rice. And my boy friend ordered a noodle dish. Both were really good! A little on the pricier side (they charge $9 for 2 spring rolls!! Lol)  But for our entrees, the portions are pretty big. we had to take boxes to go. So the price was worth it  The food was very good. Still craving for more of that shrimp!

Zi2x00e_unP29XLaEAPOHQ.text: Ate the breakfast buffet two mornings while staying at New York New York Hotel Casino. We got there in time for the two for one deal. Both mornings the staff was exceptionally nice and attentive. The food was fresh and delicious and what a value! Anyone staying at New York New York should make sure to give the breakfast buffet a try at Chin Chin. You won't be disappointed.

c-TL_leNYegBvRWXHdEpgg.text: I don't write many reviews but I felt compelled to write one for this place. I tried it last night because I was craving some sushi. It's the strip in Vegas, so be prepared to pay strip prices. That said, the Salmon sashimi was some of the best and largest portions I've ever had. Sushi Chef Huynh was very friendly and approachable, he was available for recommendations as he received and cut all the fish himself so he knew what was freshest.  I also ordered the General Tso's chicken, which was good, but in retrospect I should've just had 2 more orders of sashimi.  I'll be back next time I'm in town, maybe for a happy hour next time so that I can afford more sushi.

7PDBgojC97bpqE2WXAr7Bg.text: We just went there because some people in our group didn't want to pay $55 for a steak in the nearby steak place. But we regretted every penny we paid for this Chinese joint. Soup was cold. The skin on the "braised" duck was almost alive and everything else was probably even worse than Panda Express. I can't believe they are surviving in a city that there are so many great places to eat.

O2ySzcuLpSuMpity_p_XZg.text: Great service staff!   Great food!   Their breakfast buffet was so good, we will intentionally come back.   I almost don't want to write a raving review because I selfishly don't want it to be packed the next time I go to Vegas. The wait wasn't long, and I'm still trying to find the words to describe the many food options.  There are many options in the egg department, lots of French toast options, their bacon tasted real..... Just try it.

ggyta-XHt6MCBWGMSnJTow.text: For being a restaurant in one of the biggest hotels in Vegas, this restaurant falls below the quality of cheap Chinese restaurants. It's expensive yet nothing special about the food. The service is slow. I wouldn't choose to go back there again for sure.

Af6gmPeNHpIsc86EuVPUfQ.text: We were really looking forward to Dim Sum and we were totally disappointed!  The service was horrible!  The potstickers were cold.  We sent them back and they reheated the ones we sent back.  I'm sure this is not allowed by health codes.  I ordered a salmon hand roll and it sat at the sushi bar for 10 minutes before I got it.  The seaweed was mushy so I sent it back.  The server was talking to another table and completely forgot about us.  Out of the 4 dishes we ordered they were out of 2.  The only thing that was good was the Gift Wrapped Chicken.  We will never go there again.  YUCK!

tN9i_MnK5tjwRRd0ZE8QuQ.text: By far the worst sushi I have ever had.  It took the waiter a full ten minutes to notice we were there even though we were in the very front and there was hardly anyone in the place. I was excited to get some tasty, tasty sushi but I was sorely disappointed when I got the menu and there were literally six items on the sushi menu. I should have cut my losses right then.  I ordered a Rainbow Roll and some Yellowtail. The yellowtail was alright but I was disappointed there was no roe. The Rainbow Roll was terrible!!! I'm used to getting at least eight decent sized peices out of a roll and for there to be healthy chunks of albacore inside the roll. Not here. This $16 roll was five peaces and was filled with Krab and enough mayo to clog my arterties. I ended up eating most of the rolls because I was hungry but toward the end, I picked the actually fish off the top. When the waiter returned, he commented that I hadn't finished everything and asked if I was too full. I told him no I wasn't too full, I was just really disappointed in the dish. He laughed and said he would finish my food for me, dropped the check and was never seen again.  Yuck.  He gets one star for tracking us down when my boyfriend forgot his credit card.

yyeUBnf41MhBdSi5PY6vRA.text: I unfortunately ended up at the Chin Chin breakfast buffet due to group consensus. All of the regular breakfast items were represented, along with some Asian items like Fried Rice, Egg Foo Young, BBQ Pork, etc... Coffee and juice is also included. Everything seemed OK, nothing unusual until I was running to the washroom in the NYNY Casino to barf up everything I'd just eaten. I could only handle orange juice when I came back. I personally think breakfast foods should not be eaten buffet style! Never again!

ESB7_AlDjuuJzqiZREI7kA.text: A solid meh for their breakfast buffet. Compared to other buffets the price was okay, but also compared to other buffets their selections was really limited. Ah well. Lesson learned.

KG6SvIGIvAwjGAeyG_w4yQ.text: Being in New York New York I expected at least mediocre Chinese food.  This was definitely the worst Chinese food I have ever eaten.  The drinks were so sweet we could not drink them, and the server even mentioned they were bad!  Then the food tasted like vinegar and chili sauce with a couple pieces of chicken.  We could not even tell the difference between sweet & sour sauce and orange chicken sauce.  Any dive buffet in any town would have far superior food.  Chin Chin's service was the worst we have had in Vegas as well!  Skip this place at all costs.

nTPjcZpLuXnPjDL52UZZ3g.text: My cousin and I ate dinner  here before going to see Zumanity. We had pineapple fried rice and curry chicken, both were excellent. The drinks were great too! She had a Grape soda cocktail and i had the Green Dragon Mojito, my favorite drink of the entire trip!. Our server Garfield was excellent, very friendly. Would definitely go back!

91WRvXDj6unO8QiqNNHjmw.text: Yum. If you're in las Vegas, you gotta try this place. Eating here will leave you wishing there was one in your hometown. The service is great and the food is even better. I call this upscale Chinese food. Kinda like PF Changs. I would recommed everything on the menu. My favorites are the wonton soup and the gift wrap chicken. Don't deprive yourself. Eat here.

hJ29wVszrkKhUDJojGpbig.text: WHAT??!!  I cant believe this place has 4 stars!!!  the people reviewing this place have obviously never had good chinese food!  we came here for their breakfast/brunch and it was pretty awful.  they had regular eggs and cantonese eggs, which was eggs mixed with what was supposed to be chinese sausage and some other stuff - not good.  they also had egg fu young, which was also yuck!  they also had bacon and sausage and french toast...how is that chinese??  the only two things that were just ok were the egg rolls and the dumplings, but note that they aren't good...they're just ok.  i gave it 2 stars instead of one bacause the service was good and i didn't find a bug or anything in my food.  i don't think this place is worth the $14, even though that's pretty cheap for a buffet in vegas.  i know what a good chinese breakfast is and this sure ISN'T it!

URkACx5b0eqCWCstapGqAA.text: Maybe I had to much to drink...We were in Vegas after all..but, I was so disappointed on my last visit to Chin Chin. We usually come here for their breakfast buffet because they have a great selection of breakfast munchies. We swung by for dinner and I wish, wish wish I would've just trekked over to another place. But, seeing that I usually enjoy their breakfast buffet, I figured that I would like their dinner selection and service. We ordered 4 pieces of sashimi, chow fun, shu mai and pork dumplings. The sashimi was ok, comparable to grocery store grade. the chow fun was bland and I had to kill it with hot sauce to make it edible. The pork dumplings were a weird , tough gelatinous blob that I couldn't stomach. The only enjoyable part of the meal was the shu mai which was decent. The service was good and I have always been fond of this place for breakfast so I'll come back for that. But, pass on the dinner service-the food sucks!!!

-ZOr1ucOo_lQwaDIIw8qSA.text: So a friend and I decided to try this restaurant because it was convenient (we were staying in the hotel) and because the menu sounded promising.  We went for dinner and while the hostess was extremely nice our waiter left a lot to be desired. He didn't seem to be throughly impressed that he had to wait on someone (never smiled, never asked how we were). He took our drink orders, delivered them and then took our food orders.  I ordered the chicken mushu and my friend ordered the Jean's Long Life Noodles. The food came out and while I was mixing my food together I saw a piece of plastic in my food. Most people would complain about it and send it back but I already knew our waiter could have cared less so I just decided not to eat anymore and pick off my friends dish (which was tasty by the way). Our waiter never came by to see how our food was (no surprise there) and never offered us a dessert menu, he just came by and dropped off the check.  The funny part of this story is, when he saw me pull out a bunch of $100 bills he suddenly became extremely friendly towards us. I left a small tip for him (I used to work for tips as a blackjack dealer, so I sometimes feel guilty when I don't leave anything). I wasn't impressed with this place and wouldn't recommend it to people.

NRUx4Vg3NIuu7tt6V9xyDw.text: This is the best part of visiting New York New York!  We are able to get a decent vegan meal by ordering the chinese chicken salad w/ tofu & had both the steamed veggie and pan fried veggie dumplings.  Good service too!  Nice retreat from the noisy casino floor.

QxbNvgtfpr4QU4KglsAEkA.text: This restaurant is located in the New York New York Hotel/Casino. The food came hot and fresh in pretty big portions. Very good stuff :] Made me so full. The bartenders were cool too. My friend had a really good Margarita and I had a yummy Cosmo. We liked this place because of the atmosphere, people and food. Nice, relaxing decorations. And our waiter was very friendly and helpful. I'd go here again to try some of their other dishes.

_00QVCrautt_GJVFmsGoPA.text: Dim sum and the Singapore Style Noodles are what I would recommend, but all of their dishes are quite delectable.  The first time I tried Chin Chin, I was with a group of 12 during the Thanksgiving holiday weekend.  We ordered about 20 dishes between the 12 of us- food came quickly and HOT, and the quality of the food was great.  Have a craving for chinese food while in Vegas?  I would recommend this establishment.

ep087ygE5DPxBXlt6EiLtw.text: Solid chinese, little overpriced though.  Service is eh-ok.

Ztj1P3tAxGGtlPQzxr1n4Q.text: Best chinese food on the strip! My wife will only eat chinese food here...Best orange chicken anywhere. We also love the string beans and the rice choices. We always bring visiting friends and family here. Everyone has loved it. The decor is nice. The service is friendly  and prompt.

0PY9dEYdQzYep498Ddr_jw.text: Decent "Westernized" Chinese restaurant. It's not real Chinese food but it's close enough. Great place to eat after you're done with the tables. Soups are decent. Food is a bit salty thought. Probably one of your better options @ NY-NY.

vus5IMj-BfsljmaJIfphUA.text: Highly disappointed! This place is located in the NY Hotel. We were tired and placed a "pick up" order. When we got to our room, we realized they didn't give us any spoons to eat our soup with. I called them up and asked if they could please send some up to our room since we had already settled in - the receptionist told me that they "are not allowed to leave the restaurant". The eggplant was super greasy and the lo mein noodles were dry. For being inside a hotel and casino, and having an ultramodern store front, I was expecting much better than your standard  "Chinese food".....if you're looking for a quality meal, you will be disappointed! If you're just looking to fill your stomach after hours of boozing and gambling, you'll be happy.

RORXWARrqiDe4MalSBZ9iA.text: absolutely worthless. the food is expansive and too salty, no test at all.

EFEXjBBgAXVVATdGWA_QoQ.text: We came here at about nine at night after seeing Louie Anderson. The food was good and relatively inexpensive for Vegas.  We both ordered tea (which was complimentary with our meal), I ordered mu shu shrimp and my husband ordered beef with broccoli.  We had fast service and paid $28 for the two entrees.  Our only complaint was there wasn't a whole lot of meat in the beef and broccoli dish (in fact, my husband said it should have been retitled "broccoli and beef").

4Yxm1hCFmqnUOf3y6nNcqA.text: I like this place...its like a poor mans PF Chang's. Its good food if your at The New York New York Casino.   I typically only eat here and at Starbucks when I am at this hotel...  The blonde haired asian hostess is really hot and that is my standard reason for eating here. She can walk me to my table...ANYTIME! lol

OChOSlUmVfWD9pzLXsF7Xg.text: Chin Chin = Worst Worst. First dish was over-drenched tasteless chicken lettuce cups. I asked what was the steamed whole fish for the day and they said a "cod like fish", when I asked further they told me it was Tilapia!!! Which is worse for you than eating a Big Mac. What deceivers! My guest ordered some type of chicken dish she had to spit out, while I ordered sashimi and they delivered sushi. The manager was not very apologetic  and she didn't charge for these dishes but made sure we paid for the tasteless lettuce cups and iced tea. We went somewhere else for dinner.

1IYQtDMsQWIBCLJlCOwcHw.text: Got a late start on breakfast.  So we just ate at the first buffet we passed.  This buffet had a very small selection of food but it was good.  My favorite was the Mimosa. The manager came around and greeted us and accommodated my request for the mimosa and it was the good champange too.  Yummy

VWZZLwhbMBiHLcJHQRIccA.text: The breakfast buffet is worth every penny! The food is amazing.. But most importantly, the staff is phenomenal!!! Our server, True, provided excellent service! I'm amazed at his attention. Additionally, the Manager was super friendly & very funny!  I highly recommend eating here.

Bnd-SoEldMVXWVkgNYYXdA.text: We had hot and sour soup and lettuce wraps.  Soup was luke warm but tasty.   Lettuce wraps were good but not PF Chang's.  server was nice.

adMrsGrbAERUcUhmWDXGmw.text: Some of the worse Chinese food I've ever had, but the service was superb! I ate here on a Saturday night and had: Chow mein with crispy egg noodles and pork: Actually had to send this dish back because it was so horrible. It's like they took the noodles straight out of the container (instead of frying it crispy) and put the pork/veggies/sauce on top. The staff took it off my bill, which I appreciated.  Fried rice with pork: The darkest fried rice I've ever seen, with a lot of sauce! I've never had so much sauce in fried rice before. Also surprised that they didn't put any veggies in the rice...just pieces of pork and egg. Tasted okay.  Mongolian beef: Again, so much sauce! The meat slices were too thick and chewy. The white crunchies underneath were a waste.   Orange chicken: The most edible dish of the night. Good chunks of chicken and veggie  pieces. But the dish was lukewarm, like all the other dishes I had that night.   Prices were decent for a restaurant inside a hotel on the Strip ($15-$20 entrees), but I would rather spend the extra money for better food elsewhere.

OHRXPRnCwOua306lHjFMBA.text: Pedro was the best waiter! Understood our time schedule/ offered to replace the sweet/ (slightly too) sour soup.

MKa2svf35Omz0sW3RC4sTg.text: Never mind all those big name celb chef restaurants, always try the little places they work hard for your business. The food here was outstanding and the service was just as outstanding. Robb Harrison was on top of it all and made you feek welcomed. And Cory the manager made sure our visit was good.

PUbfBtUqeyGN8vgcp-imfQ.text: Dinner: Get "Dim Sum then Some" $21, you will get 3 portions of select dishes. More then enough food! Wish the portions were smaller and cheaper. Get: sliced bbq pork (best dish by far), skip the Chinese chicken salad (not that great), the pork fried rice was a bit over done. No one in our party was impressed. Recommendation for restaurant: Smaller portions at more affordable prices would help fill your seats at dinner.

RWOX2LThaiB2Wwbp_kAcCQ.text: The peanut noodles is a must have!! Coupled with the yang chow rice.... Game over!! Wait staff was really nice and the food came out quick can't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Singapore noodles, peanut noodles and yang chow rice!! Great combo! :)
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut Noodles!! Amazing!!
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Singapore Noodles!! Really Good!

O1cfmuValGSk3v5zLPxhiQ.text: Horrible experience. Credit card system went down, they requested we pay in cash or take photo of our credit card so they could charge later. Manager handle situation poorly and very unprofessional. Do not eat at this location. They are shady and seemed to want to get over on our family.

1Up38_6mAoknDq2rjbv6Dg.text: Service here was exceptional, our server was on top of everything and very accommodating. The maggolian beef was very tender and flavorful, I would order again the con pau chicken on the other hand was just ok, not my style and no kick to it at all. Other then that it's a nice little place tucked into NY NY that will provide great service and good Chinese food while in the area. I wish I could remember my servers name so I could give him his credit but unfortunately I've been eating out every night the last week and I've met great servers at each place and I'm drawing a blank.

RdL91A8B8UQMNd_8c1AUZg.text: No, this isn't the highest end of Asian cuisine, but somehow, hubby and I always find ourselves here for a quick bite midst gambling.  The bar area is perfect for something quick as well as a GREAT people watching post... because let's admit it - Vegas has a huge cast of crazy characters! The menu is basically "Asian" with offerings from a few countries. We went for a couple pieces of hamachi, a spicy tuna roll and then the assorted satay.   The bar also seconds as a sushi bar and I love to watch the chefs do their thing. The bartenders are friendly. It's a nice vibe. No pretense here!   I'd give their sushi a solid 8/10. As for the satay - it comes with two each of beef, chicken and shrimp with assorted sauces, I'd give a 6.5/10. I think the flavors could have been a little more "pow".   Overall, I'd recommend as a quick bite or break from the casino floor. I've never eaten in the actual restaurant but the bar has the same menu. Since we've been here quite a few times before and never been disappointed, I know we'll be back!

n6Lj5IzYGJ8zmX_gUpJc4w.text: Second time here during our stay at the New York New York in Vegas.  Potstickers with chicken as an appetizer. Tasty and juicy.  Afterwards we had the Tomato and Garlic Beef. The meet was tender, the vegetables were crispy, and the sauce was extremely good. Portions are big, we (two) shared one main dish and the both of us got really full.

Ham-r80aIbjhX5C0Gx2_uQ.text: Certain clues indicate that a business is on the brink of failure or beaming with success. Chin chin at NYNY hotel casino is forging toward the former and a far cry from that latter.  In the past, I found the restaurant decent, but my most recent experiences tell me that it may be replaced or the existing operations management should be fired.  The place has no identity, it's not a great Chinese restaurant, mediocre sushi bar, and a poor attempt at recovering revenue by acting as a morning breakfast buffet with bland continental offerings with a splash of " Asian" flavor to concur with the theme.  Notice that there are more bad Yelp reviews of this place than good... Not a a good sign.  Food presented as large portions, but its a "smoke and mirrors" tactic. Mostly fillers and lacking in authentic flavor. Tastes like they took a wok and splashed the kitchen in there with an extreme amount of soy sauce without paying close attention to wok temp, and amount of the authentic spices, or lack thereof.  If you like Panda Express and want to overpay 3x its value then Chin Chin at NYNY will suit your tastes.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken chow fun, freshly prepared but lacking in flavor.
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fragrant vegetables in garlic sauce. Only fresh tasting meal from our lunch
Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. max noodle soup at #chinchin made with chopped yesterday&#39;s meat. The stale flavor and awful presentation ruined our lunch.

6GtaKflw2IMT0wE8avULfQ.text: I was a bit leary of this place after reading the reviews but decided to give it a try anyway as we're going to see Zumanity and Chin Chin is right next door to it in the New York New York Hotel.  You don't have many options for quick sushi on the Strip as most sushi places are fancier places. The service was friendly and the salmon and ahi nigiri sushi was pretty good.  Sushi nigiri averages about $8.00 for two pieces.

photos.caption: Photo of Chin Chin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon and Ahi nigiri

PV__W1dIsF1gFq2iWcYD4Q.text: Reasonably priced Americanized "Chinese" fare....nothing special but our server was cool as hell and made sure to give good recommendations. I had a vegetable tofu dish that was tasty and one of the few healthier items on the menu.  The sauce had a nice taste and wasn't overly salty.  The Grey Goose cosmo was served as it should be...ice cold.

BRnbOUhT7z3f8gOkhL6tGQ.text: First of all, I'm Asian so my expectations for Chinese restaurants are quite high. This is a pretty good restaurant! I suggest it for people who like more Americanized Chinese Restaurants. But.... 3 stars because some dishes are sour. Also, like I said before, I like authentic Chinese foods. If you're living in the hotel NewYorkNewYork, I feel like you should try it out! Just a bit (not really) too much vinegar. DON'T GET THE PEANUT NOODLES, YOU WILL FEEL LIKE YOU ARE EATING NOODLES WITH VINEGAR ONLY!!! Otherwise, it's pretty good!

11uGAEUTfcZLC3Vlj3wS9A.text: Two stars only because the staff was great. The food was stale and over cooked. The buffet is microscopic and the msg is ladled on. The wait staff could not have been friendlier. Too bad about the food.

6pTurHzLbO-39KSCM4O1lA.text: Food was delicious and not over priced like everywhere else in vegas..Ben our waiter was knowledgeable and so sweet! 5 stars for him too! Highly recommend

oTl2ho5UwAK5seLWvlYtZg.text: Would've rate it 2.5 stars. The food was edible. Didn't get any stomach issue. The food is not authentic Chinese cuisine. But we were able to ask our server if the cook/chef will be able to change some of the ingredients in what we ordered, and they were able to cater to our specifications, hence the 3 stars. Soup was a bit on the salty side. Noodles & Fried Rice were good.

M6rNHkbfxKRKOim893kpTw.text: I would rate it a 5 out of 10.  I had Mu Go Gai Pan.  Very little vegetable. Really only celery, which tasted pretty good.  The sauce was nothing special.  Could have been at any small town restaurant.  One step up from going to the buffet.

JZ7Ws4oD5Hev1GqHDi7n2g.text: I was staying at the NY NY and I headed straight for this restaurant after check in just because I love asian food, and none of the other food choices in the hotel really appealed to me (not that interested in italian, hot dogs, pizza or burgers -- boring).  As soon as I got there I asked for a booth -- they claimed they didnt have any although I'm pretty sure I saw some open in the back.  So I took a seat at the bar anyways, which I didnt really like because it's such a public area the way it's placed, with everyone walking by through the casino right next to me while I'm trying to eat.    First thing I do is look at the drinks menu -- only  a handful of cocktails with even less that look appealing. I ordered the lychee martini, and as it turns out, they can't make it because they stopped making the lychee liquor.  Alright. Well somehow tons of other restaurants still manage to serve these,so whatever. I ordered another drink in which I could taste the vodka way too much.    Then I ordered the cream cheese wontons.  The server comes back a few minutes later, and guess what, they don't have that either.  Alright, fine, I order gyoza instead.  Surprise surprise -- the server returns again and let's me know that they don't have gyoza either.  In fact they dont have any of the fried dim sum.  At an Asian restaurant. At 630 in the evening.  Seriously? They aren't apologetic about it at all.  I was pretty nice about it, albeit rightfully disappointing, which they didnt seem to appreciate for some reason.    So I went ahead and just ordered the crispy honey shrimp. I order that a lot at Elephant Bar, and it was pretty good here but not comparable.  The quality/texture of the meat was weird.  It seemed...dry?  I'm not sure how to explain it.  It was a   Not a particularly enjoyable experience, and maybe they should stock up better next time.  From here on out I'll just stick to Ra Sushi -- its on the other side of the strip but it's worth the trip!

u0fEVK6DgTxnF8gsbLTjoQ.text: Bad sushi, do not try the coconut nigori, it's not that good. Everything is overpriced for the poor quality fish. Avoid this place, or just order the Kung Pao Chicken. You can never go wrong with that. But at this price, you'd be better off at Panda Express.

qZsmfBDojIin4O0SqpMOBA.text: One of the best restaurants ever is Chin Chin. The breakfast buffet is fantastic. They have some much food yet everything tastes great. There is great service too. It's not overpriced either.

m_F9xBpdMr7FLxr8V1inQw.text: Chin Chin was so much better than expected.  A man on a flight to Vegas over heard us talking about places to eat and recommended Chin Chin. Coming from a person who lives in Vegas you know it's got to be good.  The staff was very attentive. Food better than Panda Express!

QhXWl8-Vw3EONgH2TYoLMg.text: Sunday Brunch = Runny eggs, oddly seasoned breakfast potatoes, and a slew of underwhelming dishes; however, decent sausage, bacon, pot stickers, and above average table service kept my dining experience above water. A fair amount of steam tray options, and the cooks seemed on top of keeping everything fresh and refilled.  For me it was NOT worth the $15. I guess it's more the convenience of dining in (if you're staying at NYNY) than walking to Denny's or elsewhere.

Q-ANmBBvMPf-XIAwhiB8CA.text: We had very good service here but the food was lackluster.  It seems, since the last time we were here, that the prices of all entrees increased for no other reason than to make the $19.99 lunch buffet look like a viable option.  For the price, the food really isn't worth it.

TuYhD9RUEpx1D0jKMCvPZw.text: I've tried Chin Chin from their other locations like West Hollywood and Beverly Hills. So since I was visiting Vegas and didnt feel like trying anything new I came here. However, the menu is almost the same but with additional items that taste phenomenal!!   Unlike all the negative reviews I read below, we had AMAZING service and the food came out hot and fresh. We also ordered some drinks and that was good too.   I'm amazed by my experience I wasn't expecting too much but they blew me away. Will definitley come back whenever I visit.  5 stars for me!

vhL5AHR8luXTzVqcAXntOg.text: Let me start by saying I love traditional Chinese food. Chin Chin  is not that.  It's Asian/American fusion, which means taking the best part of Chinese food and blending in other elements to get something incredibly special.  And that's exactly what Chin Chin is.  I usually go to the Beverly Hills and Brentwood locations, and the food is consistently good; this review is solely for the Vegas location.   Decor is trendy nouveau Chinese, always neat and clean.  Noise level is low.  Staff is friendly.  So far, so good....and then it gets better.  Our party of 6 (this was for a business trip, Imagine the President, Vice President, Regional Manager, Operation manager, General manager and my self and we only went to Chin Chin because i told them that it was Great!) started off with the not-to-be-missed fried wontons and chicken salad.  Luscious!  We then  rolled into the main dishes which we requested be served family style: Sweet and Sour Chicken - very good; Beef with Broccoli - very good; and Kung Pao Scallops, which pegged the needle on the delicious-meter.  (If you don't like spicy dishes then drop that last one and go sit at the little kids table, you baby.)  This was accompanied by crab asparagus fried rice and steamed rice, done to perfection as always.  But we were still hungry, so we ordered the Garlic Eggplant.  Awesomeness!    Having filled up on main courses we did not partake of the formidable dessert menu, but it was tempting.  Now, about the service.  Our server (Juan),  his name must be in a plaque somewhere in the Server Hall of Fame.  He was everything a perfect server should be; funny, charming, and with a comprehensive knowledge of the menu, he really added an element of pleasure to the meal.  No hyperbole, this guy was the real deal.Chin Chin needs to put him under contract.  Ask for him, you won't be disappointed.  The prices are reasonable for a really nice sit-down place.  The inspired flavors of the dishes makes it all worth it.  After a good meal hit the slot machines. I prefer the ones by the exits since those are the ones that usually pay the most.

tKgMvnWV2t4Z1ai_gd3SiQ.text: Took some co-workers there for a celebration of sorts. (A farewell party) Been to Chin Chins in the Los Angeles area, and was always pleased with out experience. So of course when I moved out here, I expected the same great food and service! I was not let down. My party never had to want for anything!. The service was fast, friendly, and on point! What Las Vegas has that L.A. doesn't is Sushi. I already love the Chinese food, but the sushi put it over the top! I highly recommend coming here for any occasion. If you like tasty food, prompt friendly service, this is the place! Way to go Chin Chin!

kRaXBCGa3IOR4uQVH1ULog.text: Their food is quite ok. I had the spare ribs, the potion size was alright and so was the taste. My gf had tomato garlic chicken which was quite good. The entrees do not come with rice and need to be ordered on the side. The food is expensive considering the potion size and quality. If you are living in New York New York, then it's one of the options to use up up your free dining credit, otherwise I am sure there are better options available for Chinese food.

6A7VpHmaUcUWOZLHz3Oipg.text: I would first like to say that I woke up with my family at 8a.m to eat breakfast at Chin Chin's breakfast buffet. Lets just say I'm not the happiest camper.  First, I would like to say I am extremely disappointed at myself for not paying attention at the hints for an extremely horrible breakfast.   TIP #1 Breakfast Buffet at a mediocre Chinese Restaurant Tip #2 Fried Rice as part of their breakfast menu Tip #3 pastries that i saw them un-package from a Costco type package.  No i didn't take any of those hints as a clue to what was in store for me.   The Food- They serve the usual breakfast fare. Eggs, bacon, sausage, and french toast. To accompany those types of food they have fried rice, bbq pork, assorted fruits and potatoes. The breakfast was so sub-par, so unseasoned i couldn't eat more then one plate. I even asked for cheese for my scrambled eggs and they said they cant give me that... REALLY... REALLY?!  The Price- Everything they serve you can get at a Days-inn that is included with the price of the room. It is $12.95 a person. With that price you can go to Hash House a gogo and get quite honestly the best breakfast in Vegas for the same price. Hell you can go to Circus Circus breakfast buffet and get better. At least they have omelette's and  toast. THEY DIDN'T EVEN HAVE TOAST HERE! Silly me to think that a breakfast buffet would serve toast... silly me.  So I'm giving this place one star, If i could i would give it 1/2 but i can't. I honestly can't believe their are restaurants out here that have the audacity to serve such sub-par, and un-edible food at such a outrageous price.  1/2 A STAR OUT OF 5  p.s THEY DON'T SERVE TOAST!

13sMUMLLAsP-IgcESVu7EA.text: This place should be called Salt Salt instead! OMG! I ordered the hot and sour soup and the amount of salt in it was enough to feed a small ocean. I couldn't eat it!!!  They did take it back and took it off our bill.  I got the yellowtail sushi roll instead and those were the tiniest rolls I have ever gotten - and I consider myself a sushi fiend!  The rolls I get at Whole Foods are bigger than these were!    Hubby ordered the pepper beef and it wasn't too bad.  Only reason we ate here was because we were hungry and the deli place we really wanted to go to was closed already :(  Server was friendly and the wait to get in wasn't too long, but we will never go here again.

yWqm5RhsucH2Wb8ZyTIuCg.text: We have been to this restaurant twice and both times was great. Sushi is wonderful, just stay away from the saki. It is awful.   Service is great but is a but pricey, but you are in Vegas.

4c71J7kgHqjI0tg-K8BuSg.text: Came in for the breakfast buffet and loved everything they have to offer. The waitress, Johanna was fantastic. She greeted us with a big smile and very cheerful. She offered us eggs and omelettes to order. The omelette we order was amazing. We will definitely be back.

lzanryBjGwsFE-2-gwSc3w.text: I sat at the bar during for a late lunch and told the sushi chef to make me "something spicy." He started to respond when the the bartender/waiter totally interrupted him and told him what to make, to which the sushi chef replied "I got this." Then, in a completely rude tone (all in front of me, mind you) this waiter snaps at the chef "Do you want to take the whole bar then, Andrew?" If I am ordering off-the-menu sushi, I want to talk to the shushi chef. It was very rude and the waiter (The name on my receipt was Erin, but I am not sure that was the waiter's name) kept being a smart-ass to the shushi chef the whole time I was there, even making me wait for my check so he could ask the shushi chef if I was ready for it. So immature!  That being said, the roll the chef made for me was pretty fantastic, he would have gotten five stars easily. The fish was fresh and there was just the right amount of spice. The presentation was also pretty with curls of celery and carrots decorating the plate. The prices were on par with LA/Orange County sushi prices.

t_BvQTIWyJh8N7YoC0Jy4g.text: Awesome and quick service. Our server Pedro was excellent with a cute smile. Lots of variety in the Buffet. Fresh and nicely arranged.

-CzBA0o2PgQdNxHIofl_Hg.text: Stumbled into this gem on a Tuesday night after an hour of heavy mixed drinking/lottery playing at NYNY. Holy crap they had Dim Sum but even with a heavy buzz there's no way my cheap behind was going to throw $7.95 at a measly six pieces of Shiu Mai. That's a good ten minutes of play at the penny slots, my friend.   I usually pick at food like an anorexic chipmunk but hot damn! Tonight I single-handedly murdered a whole plate of pineapple fried rice as my bf and cousin watched in amazement. Siriachi sauce and about ten watered-down amfs will do wonders for stomach expandment. That little switch that triggers you to stop eating 'cuz you're full? Never turned on. I was two bites from exploding like a retarded goldfish.  Yeah, you can get just-as-tasty chinese food in LA for a fraction of the price, but for the location and the portions, I'd most definitely stop by again if I'm staying at the NYNY. Word!

o4z4g4NRclNxtjIKdmYg-A.text: The girl who "greeted" me me was rude! I almost left immediately - and I should have. The food was lousy, the service was slow, everyone there seemed grouchy, the dishes were dirty and I had to ask TWICE for clean silverware. No tip and no return trip!
